CPC60220.name: Contribute to developing, implementing and maintaining an organisationâ€™s WHS management system
CPC60220.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to contribute to the development, implementation, and maintenance of a work health and safety (WHS) management system. It involves assisting with the integration of WHS policies and procedures into an organisation's overall management system, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements, and contributing to continuous improvement processes.

CPC60220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for large building projects
CPC60220.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to access, interpret, and apply relevant building codes and standards to the construction processes of large, complex building projects. It involves ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other relevant Australian standards throughout the planning and construction phases.

CPC60220.name: Establish, maintain and review contract administration procedures and frameworks
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves establishing, maintaining, and reviewing contract administration procedures and frameworks for building and construction projects. It includes developing contract administration processes, monitoring contract performance, and implementing improvements to ensure contractual obligations are met efficiently and effectively.

CPC60220.name: Manage processes for complying with legal obligations of a building and construction contractor
CPC60220.desc: This unit addresses the management of processes to ensure compliance with legal obligations pertinent to building and construction contractors. It encompasses identifying and interpreting relevant legislation, implementing compliance procedures, and monitoring adherence to legal requirements throughout project execution. The unit is crucial for contractors aiming to fulfil their legal responsibilities within the construction industry.

CPC60220.name: Manage business risk
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to manage risks in a business context. It includes establishing the risk context, identifying risks, analysing and evaluating risks, and developing and implementing appropriate risk treatment plans. The unit applies to individuals who are required to manage risks across various areas within an organisation or for a specific business unit or project.

CPC60220.name: Develop, plan and implement building and construction environmental management processes
CPC60220.desc: This unit covers the development, planning, and implementation of environmental management processes in building and construction projects. It involves identifying environmental requirements, developing management plans to address these requirements, and overseeing the implementation and monitoring of environmental management practices to minimise the environmental impact of construction activities.

CPC60220.name: Develop, plan and implement a building and construction planning process
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to develop, plan, and implement a comprehensive planning process for building and construction projects. It encompasses establishing a construction planning system that ensures accurate and successful project outcomes, aligning with organisational guidelines and relevant legislation, codes, and standards. The unit is applicable to large organisations managing residential and/or commercial projects of significant size and complexity.

CPC60220.name: Establish systems to develop and monitor building and construction costs
CPC60220.desc: This unit covers the establishment of systems to develop and monitor costs associated with building and construction projects. It includes implementing procedures to accurately forecast, control, and report on project costs, ensuring financial management aligns with project objectives and organisational requirements. The unit applies to senior managers responsible for overseeing financial aspects of large construction projects.

CPC60220.name: Manage and administer development of documentation for building and construction projects
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves managing and administering the development of documentation essential for building and construction projects. It includes overseeing the preparation of detailed project documents such as contracts, plans, specifications, and reports, ensuring they meet project requirements, regulatory standards, and organisational policies. The unit is relevant to professionals responsible for coordinating documentation processes in large construction projects.

CPC60220.name: Develop workplace policies and procedures for sustainability
CPC60220.desc: This unit focuses on developing workplace policies and procedures that promote sustainability. It involves identifying environmental regulations and best practices, formulating policies that encourage sustainable operations, and implementing procedures to reduce environmental impact. The unit is applicable to managers and professionals tasked with integrating sustainability into workplace practices.

CPC10120.name: Prepare to work safely in the construction industry
CPC10120.desc: This is a fundamental requirement for individuals entering construction sites in Australia. It encompasses the skills and knowledge necessary to identify and address common hazards, understand basic risk control measures, and adhere to workplace health and safety (WHS) legislative requirements. Successful completion of this unit is mandatory for obtaining the White Card, which authorises individuals to work on construction sites nationwide.

CPC10120.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping construction workers with the essential skills and knowledge to implement work health and safety (WHS) practices effectively across various construction settings. This unit covers identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (including asbestos), planning and executing safe work practices, and responding appropriately to emergencies. It is a fundamental component for those aiming to perform tasks safely within the construction industry and is also a prerequisite for individuals assessing the 'White Card' unit of competency, CPCCWHS1001.

CPC10120.name: Handle construction materials
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely manage and store common construction materials. This includes manual handling techniques, preparation for mechanical handling, and adherence to environmental management principles. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction materials are handled efficiently and safely, minimising risks and maintaining workplace safety standards.

CPC10120.name: Use construction tools and equipment
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely select, operate, and maintain a variety of construction tools and equipment. This encompasses hand tools, power tools, and pneumatic tools commonly utilised in the construction industry. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are performed efficiently and safely, adhering to workplace health and safety (WHS) standards and manufacturers' specifications.

CPC10120.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This includes understanding team roles and responsibilities, effective communication, planning and organising work tasks, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can contribute positively to team objectives, pursue relevant career pathways, and implement sustainable practices in construction projects.

CPC10120.name: Plan and organise work
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. This includes determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into component activities, estimating time and resources, and collaborating with team members to schedule work and allocate responsibilities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed efficiently, safely, and in accordance with workplace standards.

CPC10120.name: Undertake a basic construction project
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the foundational skills and knowledge necessary to plan, execute, and complete a simple construction project. This encompasses interpreting project plans and specifications, selecting and preparing materials, operating hand tools and equipment safely, and adhering to workplace health and safety (WHS) requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively contribute to basic construction tasks, laying the groundwork for more advanced construction activities.

CPC10120.name: Undertake basic estimation and costing
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare basic estimates of materials, labour, and costs for construction projects. This includes reviewing plans and specifications, creating material lists, obtaining unit costs from suppliers, estimating quantities, calculating costs, and documenting the total cost of tasks. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are planned and executed with accurate budgeting, contributing to effective project management and resource allocation.

CPC10120.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills to perform basic measurements and calculations within a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate measuring equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying fundamental mathematical concepts such as area, volume, perimeter, and ratios to determine material quantities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed with precision, contributing to overall project accuracy and efficiency.

CPC10120.name: Undertake a basic computer design project
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the foundational skills to utilise computer-aided design (CAD) software for creating simple construction-related drawings. This involves interpreting design briefs, developing basic digital drawings, and adhering to industry standards and protocols. Proficiency in this unit enables individuals to effectively produce digital representations of construction projects, enhancing accuracy and communication within the construction industry.

CPC33020.name: Work safely at heights
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform tasks safely at heights in various construction settings. It encompasses identifying work requirements, assessing risks, implementing safety measures, and using appropriate equipment to ensure personal and site safety. This unit is fundamental for construction workers who need to operate at heights, ensuring compliance with safety regulations and promoting a secure working environment.

CPC33020.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in both on-site and off-site construction environments. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials such as asbestos, planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform their tasks safely, adhering to legislative requirements and workplace policies, thereby contributing to a safer work environment.

CPC33020.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish correct and accurate set-out of building components. This includes the set-up, testing, and use of levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using a range of levelling equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform levelling tasks accurately, contributing to the structural integrity and precision of building projects.

CPC33020.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes tasks such as planning and preparing for scaffolding work, placing safety barriers, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and repairing scaffolding components, and dismantling the scaffolding after use. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can provide secure work platforms for various construction tasks, adhering to Australian safety standards and contributing to efficient site operations.

CPC33020.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This includes participating in team planning, understanding roles and responsibilities, identifying pathways to become a tradesperson or skilled operator, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can contribute positively to team objectives, pursue career development, and implement sustainable practices in compliance with industry standards.

CPC33020.name: Plan and organise work
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. This includes determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and coordinating with team members to ensure efficient workflow. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can execute construction activities methodically, adhering to safety protocols and contributing to project efficiency.

CPC33020.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively in a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, participating in simple meeting processes, and interpreting work instructions and safety signage. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can interact efficiently with colleagues and stakeholders, contributing to the smooth operation of construction activities and adherence to safety protocols.

CPC33020.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying fundamental mathematical formulas to determine material quantities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed with precision, contributing to overall project accuracy and efficiency.

CPC33020.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to accurately comprehend construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes understanding different types of construction drawings, recognising symbols and abbreviations, and identifying key features and project requirements from these documents. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can effectively interpret project documentation, facilitating accurate execution of construction tasks in compliance with Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Handle and prepare bricklaying and blocklaying materials
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely handle, sort, and prepare materials for bricklaying and blocklaying tasks. This includes manual and mechanical handling techniques, proper storage methods, and the preparation of mortar mixes to specified ratios. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can efficiently manage materials on-site, contributing to the quality and safety of masonry construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Use bricklaying and blocklaying tools and equipment
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively utilise tools and equipment specific to bricklaying and blocklaying tasks. This includes understanding the functional features and operational requirements of both hand and power tools, as well as plant and equipment used in masonry work. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can perform bricklaying and blocklaying tasks efficiently, adhering to safety protocols and contributing to the quality of construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Lay paving
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare, set out, and install paving for various applications. This includes tasks such as preparing the base and bedding, selecting and laying pavers in designated patterns, and ensuring proper alignment and level. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can execute paving projects effectively, adhering to Australian building standards and safety regulations.

CPC33020.name: Carry out masonry veneer construction
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry veneer buildings and structures. This includes tasks such as installing damp proof courses, wall ties, flashings, and ventilation systems to ensure structural integrity and compliance with Australian building standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively execute masonry veneer construction projects, adhering to safety regulations and quality requirements.

CPC33020.name: Carry out cavity brick construction
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct cavity brick buildings and structures. This includes tasks such as installing moisture barriers, ventilation systems, and roof tie-downs to ensure structural integrity and compliance with Australian building standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively execute cavity brick construction projects, adhering to safety regulations and quality requirements.

CPC33020.name: Lay masonry walls and corners
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry walls and corners for various building types and styles. This includes planning, preparation, setting out, and installation of masonry, ensuring adherence to Australian building standards and codes. The unit is essential for bricklayers and blocklayers working on new or existing structures, enabling them to execute masonry tasks with precision and compliance.

CPC33020.name: Lay multi-thickness walls and piers
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry walls of varying thicknesses and to lay both engaged and isolated piers. This includes proficiency in different brick bonding techniques, such as English and Flemish bonds, and the ability to interpret construction plans and specifications. The unit is essential for bricklayers and blocklayers working on new or existing structures, ensuring they can execute complex masonry tasks with precision and in compliance with Australian building standards.

CPC33020.name: Install flashings and damp proof course
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install various materials for flashings and damp proofing in masonry construction. This includes installing vertical and head flashings to windows and doors, as well as stepped and tray flashings to parapets, to prevent moisture penetration and ensure structural integrity. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively implement moisture control measures, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Construct masonry arches
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct various types of masonry arches within walls and above columns or attached piers. This includes tasks such as setting out and constructing different arch types, preparing voussoirs (wedge-shaped stones or bricks), and fitting arch templates. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can accurately and safely build masonry arches, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Construct curved walls
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry curved walls. This includes using geometry to calculate and set out curves, and constructing both standard curved walls and serpentine (S-shaped) walls. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can accurately and safely build curved masonry structures, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Construct masonry structural systems
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to build masonry load-bearing walls and engaged piers. This involves tasks such as setting out and marking masonry walls, laying blocks to specified heights, installing horizontal reinforcing, and securing roof tie-downs and bracing. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can construct structural masonry elements that comply with Australian building standards and codes, contributing to the integrity and safety of various construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Carry out setting out
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately identify site boundaries and survey indicators, and to establish, measure, and set up profiled set-outs for buildings and structural components in construction projects. This includes tasks such as setting out pads, posts, slabs, strips, and stumps, and installing string lines to profile the footings of a building and associated structures on a site. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can execute precise site layouts in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation, thereby contributing to the structural integrity and accuracy of building projects.

CPC33020.name: Carry out basic demolition
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely remove components from single-storey buildings and structures using basic demolition techniques. This includes planning and preparing for demolition, setting up safety equipment, executing the removal of building components, and properly checking and storing tools and equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can perform demolition tasks in compliance with Australian Standards and workplace safety regulations, contributing to the safe and efficient execution of demolition activities.

CPC33020.name: Construct masonry steps and stairs
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to calculate and construct masonry steps, stairs, and wing walls using various masonry products. This unit applies to bricklayers and blocklayers who set out and construct steps and stairs on new or existing structures, operating with some autonomy. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can accurately plan, prepare, and execute the installation of masonry steps and stairs, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Install fire-rated masonry construction
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct fire-resistant masonry structures. This includes tasks such as laying fire-resistant bricks and blocks, installing fire-rated steel door jambs, fire-proofing service penetrations, and fitting fire-rated insulation between masonry walls and roof coverings. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively contribute to the fire safety of buildings, adhering to the fire control and separation requirements specified in the National Construction Code (NCC) and other relevant legislation.

CPC33020.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other simple structures. This includes tasks such as preparing the substrate, erecting formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, and applying appropriate finishing techniques to achieve the specified design finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can execute basic concreting tasks in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations, contributing to the quality and safety of construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Place and fix reinforcement materials
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to place and secure reinforcement for concrete work as part of construction processes. This includes planning and preparing for the task, executing final preparations for placement, accurately positioning and securing reinforcement materials such as deformed bars, rods, and mesh sheets, verifying the reinforcement setup, and completing clean-up activities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreters can effectively contribute to the structural integrity of construction projects, adhering to Australian building standards and safety regulations.

AUR30320.name: Follow environmental and sustainability best practice in an automotive workplace
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to follow environmental and sustainability best practices in an automotive workplace. It includes identifying environmental hazards, handling materials and waste according to regulations, and implementing sustainable work practices.

AUR30320.name: Follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace
AUR30320.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to follow safe working practices in an automotive environment. It involves identifying and controlling workplace hazards, using personal protective equipment (PPE), and responding to emergencies according to workplace health and safety (WHS) procedures.

AUR30320.name: Use and maintain electrical test equipment in an automotive workplace
AUR30320.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain various electrical test equipment in an automotive context. It includes operating multimeters, oscilloscopes, and scan tools to test and measure electrical system parameters.

AUR30320.name: Solder electrical wiring and circuits
AUR30320.desc: This unit addresses the skills and knowledge needed to perform soldering on electrical wiring and electronic circuits in an automotive setting. It covers preparing components, applying appropriate soldering techniques, and inspecting soldered joints for quality and reliability.

AUR30320.name: Apply knowledge of automotive electrical circuits and wiring systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the application of fundamental knowledge of automotive electrical circuits and wiring systems. It involves interpreting wiring diagrams, understanding the function of electrical components, and applying principles of electricity to automotive applications.

AUR30320.name: Install vehicle lighting and wiring systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to install vehicle lighting and associated wiring systems. It includes selecting appropriate components, routing and securing wiring, making connections, and testing the final installation for correct operation.

AUR30320.name: Repair wiring harnesses and looms
AUR30320.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to repair automotive wiring harnesses and looms. It involves identifying faults, performing repairs on damaged wires and connectors, and ensuring the integrity of the repaired harness.

AUR30320.name: Install ancillary electronic systems and components
AUR30320.desc: This unit involves the installation of ancillary electronic systems and components in vehicles. It covers systems such as audio, visual, navigation, and security devices, including system integration and testing.

AUR30320.name: Test and repair basic electrical circuits
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the competency to test and repair basic electrical circuits in vehicles and machinery. It involves using testing procedures to locate faults and carrying out repairs to restore circuit functionality.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair spark ignition engine management systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the spark ignition engine management systems of vehicles. It includes using diagnostic equipment to identify issues with sensors, actuators, and control modules.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair compression ignition engine management systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the diagnosis and repair of faults in compression ignition (diesel) engine management systems. It involves systematic testing of system components, interpreting diagnostic data, and performing necessary repairs.

AUR30320.name: Test, charge and replace batteries and jump-start vehicles
AUR30320.desc: This unit involves the skills to test, charge, and replace automotive batteries, as well as to safely jump-start vehicles. It covers battery testing methods, charging procedures, and safe handling practices.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair instruments and warning systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit specifies the competency to diagnose and repair faults in vehicle instrument clusters and warning systems. It includes testing gauges, indicator lights, and driver information displays.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair charging systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair vehicle charging systems. It involves testing alternators, regulators, and related components to identify and rectify faults.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair starting systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the skills needed to diagnose and repair vehicle starting systems. It includes testing starter motors, solenoids, and control circuits to find and fix starting problems.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair ignition systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit involves diagnosing and repairing faults in automotive ignition systems. It covers both distributor-based and electronic ignition systems, including testing coils, modules, and spark delivery components.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair automotive electrical systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit addresses the skills required to diagnose and repair faults in general automotive electrical systems, including body electrical systems and accessories. It involves a comprehensive approach to electrical fault-finding.

AUR30320.name: Apply knowledge of petrol and diesel engine operation
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the application of fundamental knowledge of petrol and diesel engine operation in an automotive service or repair context. It includes understanding the principles of internal combustion engines and their main components.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair electronic body management systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge needed to diagnose and repair electronic body management systems, such as central locking, electric windows, and climate control. It involves using scan tools and interpreting network data.

AUR30320.name: Develop and carry out diagnostic test strategies
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the competency to develop and carry out diagnostic test strategies on vehicles, vessels or machinery. It involves a systematic approach to fault finding, including analysing symptoms, developing a test plan, and concluding with a diagnosis.

AUR30320.name: Inspect and service engines
AUR30320.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service engines in an automotive workplace. It includes performing scheduled services, checking fluid levels, replacing filters, and identifying potential issues.

AUR30320.name: Communicate effectively in an automotive workplace
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the skills needed to communicate effectively with colleagues and customers in an automotive workplace. It includes gathering information, providing explanations, and maintaining positive workplace relationships.

AUR30320.name: Provide technical guidance
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the skills required to provide technical guidance and support to colleagues in an automotive workplace. It involves mentoring, explaining technical concepts, and assisting with complex diagnostic tasks.

AUR30320.name: Estimate and quote automotive mechanical and electrical repairs
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the competency to estimate and quote the cost of automotive mechanical and electrical repairs. It includes identifying required parts and labour, calculating costs, and preparing customer quotes.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair electric braking systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit involves diagnosing and repairing electric and electronic braking systems, including anti-lock braking (ABS), traction control (TCS), and stability control (ESC) systems.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair electronically controlled steering systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the diagnosis and repair of electronically controlled steering systems, including electric power steering (EPS) and variable-assist systems. It involves testing sensors, actuators, and control modules.

AUR30320.name: Depower and reinitialise hybrid electric vehicles
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to safely depower and reinitialise the high voltage systems of hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs) to carry out service and repair work.

AUR30320.name: Depower and reinitialise battery electric vehicles
AUR30320.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely depower and reinitialise the high voltage systems of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) to enable servicing and repairs.

AUR30320.name: Inspect and maintain battery electric vehicles
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the competency to inspect and maintain battery electric vehicles (BEVs) and their high voltage systems according to manufacturer specifications.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair vehicle dynamic control systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit involves the diagnosis and repair of integrated vehicle dynamic control systems, encompassing braking, steering, and suspension control systems, to restore full functionality.

AUR30320.name: Apply knowledge of ADAS systems to vehicle pre-repair scans
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge to apply an understanding of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) when carrying out pre-repair vehicle scans to identify system status and repair requirements.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle hydraulic braking systems
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge to diagnose and repair faults in the hydraulic braking systems of light vehicles. It includes servicing master cylinders, brake lines, callipers, and wheel cylinders.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle engines
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in the engines of light vehicles. It involves comprehensive engine testing, fault identification, and performing major and minor repairs.

AUR30320.name: Diagnose complex system faults
AUR30320.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose complex faults in vehicle systems that have intermittent or multiple interacting issues, requiring advanced diagnostic strategies.

AUR30320.name: Use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace
AUR30320.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain a range of tools and equipment in an automotive workplace. It includes hand tools, power tools, and workshop equipment.

AUR30320.name: Promote innovation in team environments
AUR30320.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to be a proactive and innovative contributor to a team. It involves identifying opportunities for improvement, developing creative solutions, and promoting innovation within the team.

AUR32420.name: Follow environmental and sustainability best practice in an automotive workplace
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge to follow environmental and sustainability best practices, including handling and disposing of hazardous materials and implementing sustainable work processes in an automotive setting.

AUR32420.name: Interpret and apply automotive repair instructions
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the skills needed to locate, interpret, and apply technical information and repair instructions found in workshop manuals, technical bulletins, and other manufacturer specifications.

AUR32420.name: Follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace
AUR32420.desc: This unit specifies the competency to identify and follow workplace health and safety (WHS) procedures in an automotive environment, including using personal protective equipment (PPE) and responding to emergencies.

AUR32420.name: Mask vehicle panels and components
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the skills required to mask vehicle panels and components in preparation for refinishing operations, ensuring clean paint lines and protecting areas from overspray.

AUR32420.name: Apply refinishing primers to vehicle surfaces
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge to select and apply various refinishing primers to vehicle surfaces to provide adhesion, corrosion protection, and a suitable foundation for topcoats.

AUR32420.name: Prepare and paint plastic and composite vehicle surfaces
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the competency to prepare and paint plastic and composite surfaces, which require specific preparation techniques and materials for proper adhesion and a durable finish.

AUR32420.name: De-nib, buff and polish vehicle painted surfaces
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the final stage of the refinishing process, including removing minor imperfections (de-nibbing) and using buffing and polishing techniques to achieve a high-gloss finish.

AUR32420.name: Remove paint from vehicle painted surfaces
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively remove paint from vehicle surfaces using various methods, such as sanding or chemical stripping.

AUR32420.name: Prepare vehicle spray painting equipment for use
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the setup, adjustment, and cleaning of spray painting equipment, including spray guns, pressure pots, and air supply systems, to ensure correct and efficient operation.

AUR32420.name: Apply basic colour matching techniques using vehicle paint codes
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the skills to identify vehicle paint codes and use them to mix and match refinishing paint, ensuring a close match to the original vehicle color.

AUR32420.name: Prepare and operate vehicle paint drying equipment
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge to prepare and operate paint drying and curing equipment, such as infrared lamps and spray booths, to accelerate the paint drying process.

AUR32420.name: Prepare vehicle substrates for refinishing
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the critical process of preparing vehicle substrates, including bare metal, existing paintwork, and body fillers, to ensure the refinishing materials will adhere properly.

AUR32420.name: Colour match multi-layer and clear over base two-pack paints on vehicles and components
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes advanced skills in color matching complex multi-layer and pearl paint systems, involving techniques like let-down panels and spray-out cards to achieve an invisible repair.

AUR32420.name: Match direct gloss solid paint colour on vehicles or components
AUR32420.desc: This unit specifies the competency to accurately match direct gloss (single stage) solid paint colors on vehicles, involving tinting and testing to achieve a precise color match.

AUR32420.name: Rectify and touch up vehicle paint faults using clear over base two-pack systems
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the skills to identify and rectify minor paint faults, such as runs or sags, in clear over base two-pack paint systems using specialized touch-up techniques.

AUR32420.name: Apply clear over base two-pack refinishing materials to vehicle body components
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge to apply clear over base two-pack refinishing materials, including basecoats and clearcoats, to achieve a high-quality, durable finish.

AUR32420.name: Apply clear over base multi-layer and pearl refinishing materials to vehicle body components
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the advanced application of multi-layer and pearl refinishing materials, which requires precise technique to ensure correct color, pearl effect, and overall appearance.

AUR32420.name: Apply water-based refinishing materials to vehicle bodies and substrates
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the specific techniques and environmental considerations required to apply modern water-based refinishing materials to vehicle surfaces.

AUR32420.name: Read and respond to automotive workplace information
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers basic literacy skills for an automotive workplace, including reading job cards, safety data sheets, and memos, and responding appropriately.

AUR32420.name: Resolve routine problems in an automotive workplace
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the skills required to identify and resolve routine problems that occur in an automotive workplace, using established procedures and seeking assistance when necessary.

AUR32420.name: Work effectively with others in an automotive workplace
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the competency to work cooperatively as part of a team in an automotive workplace, including communicating effectively and supporting team members.

AUR32420.name: Depower and reinitialise hybrid electric vehicles
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the critical safety procedures required to depower and reinitialise the high voltage systems of hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs) to allow for safe service and repair.

AUR32420.name: Depower and reinitialise battery electric vehicles
AUR32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge to safely depower and reinitialise the high voltage systems of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) to enable servicing and repairs.

AUR32420.name: Test, charge and replace batteries and jump-start vehicles
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the skills to test, charge, and replace conventional 12-volt automotive batteries, as well as to safely jump-start vehicles.

AUR32420.name: Prepare vehicles for customer use
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the final preparation and detailing of a vehicle before returning it to the customer, including cleaning, inspecting repairs, and ensuring all work is complete.

AUR32420.name: Inspect vehicle paint, trim and accessories and recommend repair procedures
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the skills to inspect vehicle paintwork, interior trim, and accessories for damage and determine the appropriate repair procedures.

AUR32420.name: Remove and replace adhesive attached components on vehicles
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the competency to remove and replace components attached with adhesives, such as mouldings, badges, and body panels, without causing damage.

AUR32420.name: Repair vehicle thermoplastic body panels and components
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to repair thermoplastic components, like bumpers, using plastic welding and other specialized repair techniques.

AUR32420.name: Inspect vehicle damage and determine repair procedures
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the skills needed to thoroughly inspect a damaged vehicle and determine the most effective and efficient repair procedures and sequence.

AUR32420.name: Apply original equipment manufacturer repair procedures during vehicle repairs
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the critical competency to access and apply original equipment manufacturer (OEM) repair procedures to ensure repairs meet factory standards for safety and quality.

AUR32420.name: Apply basic airbrush techniques to vehicle body panels
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the skills to use an airbrush to apply custom paint effects, graphics, and detailed touch-ups to vehicle body panels.

AUR32420.name: Touch up minor vehicle paintwork damage
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the skills to perform minor paintwork touch-ups for small scratches, chips, and blemishes without requiring a full panel respray.

AUR32420.name: Apply vehicle body film wrapping
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the specialized skills required to prepare a vehicle's surface and apply adhesive vinyl film (vehicle wrap) for cosmetic or protective purposes.

AUR32420.name: Apply solid acrylic two-pack materials to vehicle components
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge to mix and apply solid acrylic two-pack (direct gloss) refinishing materials to vehicle components.

AUR32420.name: Apply air dry and polyurethane refinishing materials
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the competency to apply air-dry enamels and polyurethane refinishing materials, often used on commercial vehicles and equipment.

AUR32420.name: Rectify and touch up vehicle direct gloss paint faults using two-pack systems
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the skills to identify and rectify minor paint faults in direct gloss two-pack paint systems using specialized touch-up and polishing techniques.

AUR32420.name: Rectify vehicle multi-layer and pearl paint faults using two-pack systems
AUR32420.desc: This unit involves the advanced skills required to rectify paint faults in complex multi-layer and pearl finishes, which is critical for maintaining the original appearance.

AUR32420.name: Carry out custom painting techniques to vehicle body panels
AUR32420.desc: This unit describes the creative and technical skills to apply custom painting techniques, such as fades, graphics, and special effects, to vehicle body panels.

AUR32420.name: Provide work skill instruction
AUR32420.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to provide on-the-job instruction and demonstrate work skills to others in a workplace environment.

AUR40620.name: Carry out diagnosis of complex system faults
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose complex faults in vehicle systems that have intermittent or multiple interacting issues, requiring the application of advanced diagnostic strategies and logical problem-solving.

AUR40620.name: Prepare technical reports
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves the skills required to prepare and write comprehensive technical reports in an automotive context, documenting diagnostic findings, repair procedures, and technical information clearly and professionally.

AUR40620.name: Develop and document specifications and procedures
AUR40620.desc: This unit describes the competency to develop, document, and implement technical specifications and standard operating procedures for automotive tasks, ensuring consistency and quality.

AUR40620.name: Adapt work processes to new technologies
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the skills to adapt personal work processes to accommodate the introduction of new technologies, tools, and equipment in the automotive workplace.

AUR40620.name: Prepare a vehicle repair quotation
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves preparing detailed vehicle repair quotations by identifying required tasks, sourcing parts, estimating labor times, and calculating final costs for the customer.

AUR40620.name: Inspect technical quality of work
AUR40620.desc: This unit specifies the competency to inspect the technical quality of automotive work performed by others against workplace and industry standards to ensure it meets requirements.

AUR40620.name: Maintain quality systems
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the skills to contribute to the maintenance and improvement of an automotive workplace's quality system, including following procedures and identifying areas for improvement.

AUR40620.name: Provide technical guidance
AUR40620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to provide technical guidance, support, and mentoring to colleagues in an automotive workplace.

AUR40620.name: Estimate complex jobs
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves estimating the costs for complex automotive jobs that may involve multiple systems, significant damage, or require specialized parts and procedures.

AUR40620.name: Repair electric braking systems
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the skills needed to diagnose, service, and repair electric and electronically controlled braking systems, including anti-lock braking (ABS) and stability control systems.

AUR40620.name: Depower battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit describes the critical safety procedures required to depower the high voltage systems of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) to allow for safe service and repair.

AUR40620.name: Service and maintain battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge to carry out scheduled servicing and maintenance on battery electric vehicles (BEVs) according to manufacturer specifications.

AUR40620.name: Test and repair high voltage battery systems in battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This advanced unit covers the skills to test, diagnose faults in, and repair high voltage (HV) battery systems in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40620.name: Diagnose and repair traction motor speed control devices in battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit describes the skills to diagnose and repair the traction motor speed control devices, such as inverters and controllers, in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40620.name: Diagnose and repair high voltage traction motors in battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves the advanced diagnosis and repair of high voltage (HV) traction motors that propel battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40620.name: Diagnose and repair auxiliary motors and associated components in battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the diagnosis and repair of various high voltage auxiliary motors and components in battery electric vehicles (BEVs), such as those for power steering and air conditioning.

AUR40620.name: Diagnose and repair system instrumentation and safety interlocks in battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit describes the competency to diagnose and repair the instrumentation and critical safety interlock systems within battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40620.name: Diagnose and repair high voltage cabin heating and cooling systems in battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves diagnosing and repairing high voltage (HV) cabin heating and cooling systems, including electric compressors and PTC heaters, in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40620.name: Diagnose and repair DC to DC converters in battery electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the skills to diagnose and repair the DC to DC converters that step down high voltage to power the 12-volt systems in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40620.name: Test high voltage batteries in hybrid electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit specifies the procedures to test the state of health and performance of high voltage (HV) batteries in hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs).

AUR40620.name: Deactivate and reinitialise power supply in hybrid electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit describes the critical safety procedures required to deactivate (depower) and reinitialise the high voltage power supply in hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs).

AUR40620.name: Service and maintain electrical components in hybrid electric vehicles
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the servicing and maintenance of various electrical and high voltage components specific to hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs).

AUR40620.name: Diagnose complex faults in battery electric and hybrid electric vehicle systems
AUR40620.desc: This advanced unit involves diagnosing complex and interconnected faults within the high voltage and control systems of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) and hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs).

AUR40620.name: Demonstrate knowledge of petrol and diesel engine operation
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers fundamental knowledge of the operating principles, construction, and key components of both petrol and diesel internal combustion engines.

AUR40620.name: Test, charge and replace batteries
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves the skills to test the condition of automotive batteries, perform charging procedures, and safely replace them.

AUR40620.name: Diagnose complex electrical and electronic faults in light vehicle safety systems
AUR40620.desc: This unit covers the advanced diagnosis of complex faults in light vehicle safety systems, including Supplemental Restraint Systems (SRS), Anti-lock Braking Systems (ABS), and Electronic Stability Control (ESC).

AUR40620.name: Carry out vehicle safety and roadworthy inspections
AUR40620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to conduct comprehensive vehicle safety and roadworthy inspections according to regulatory requirements.

AUR40620.name: Diagnose complex faults in vehicle electric-over-hydraulic systems
AUR40620.desc: This unit involves diagnosing complex faults in integrated electric-over-hydraulic systems, which are common in heavy vehicles and machinery for functions like braking and steering.

AUR40116.name: Build customer relations in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to build and maintain positive customer relationships in an automotive environment. It includes communicating effectively, handling customer inquiries, and fostering customer loyalty.

AUR40116.name: Manage environmental and sustainability best practice in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit involves the skills to manage and implement environmental and sustainability best practices. It covers developing workplace policies, managing hazardous materials, and promoting resource efficiency.

AUR40116.name: Maintain business image in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit describes the competency to maintain and enhance the business image of an automotive workplace. It includes managing workplace presentation, staff conduct, and customer service standards.

AUR40116.name: Manage complex customer issues in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit covers the advanced skills needed to manage complex or escalated customer issues. It involves negotiation, conflict resolution, and implementing solutions to maintain customer satisfaction.

AUR40116.name: Manage a small team
AUR40116.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to lead and manage a small team. It includes planning and organizing work, monitoring performance, providing feedback, and leading the team effectively.

AUR40116.name: Implement and monitor WHS policies, procedures and programs to meet legislative requirements
AUR40116.desc: This unit involves implementing and monitoring an organisation's work health and safety (WHS) policies, procedures, and programs to ensure compliance with legislative requirements and a safe workplace.

AUR40116.name: Determine retail rates for automotive products and services
AUR40116.desc: This unit covers the skills to determine appropriate retail rates for automotive products and services. It includes calculating costs, applying mark-ups, and considering market factors.

AUR40116.name: Adapt work processes to new technologies in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit describes the skills needed to adapt personal and team work processes to accommodate new technologies, tools, and equipment introduced into the automotive workplace.

AUR40116.name: Comply with legal aspects of a service and repair contract in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit involves the competency to comply with the legal aspects of service and repair contracts, including understanding consumer law, warranties, and contractual obligations.

AUR40116.name: Conduct information sessions in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit covers the skills required to plan, conduct, and review information sessions or toolbox talks for teams in an automotive workplace.

AUR40116.name: Maintain quality processes in an automotive workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit describes the skills to maintain and improve quality control processes in an automotive workplace, ensuring that work consistently meets industry standards.

AUR40116.name: Estimate and quote automotive mechanical and electrical repairs
AUR40116.desc: This unit involves the competency to estimate and prepare customer quotes for automotive mechanical and electrical repairs, including calculating parts and labor costs.

AUR40116.name: Maintain business technology
AUR40116.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to maintain and troubleshoot common business technologies, including hardware and software, within a workplace.

AUR40116.name: Lead effective workplace relationships
AUR40116.desc: This unit describes the skills needed to lead teams and individuals effectively by developing trust, communicating clearly, and fostering a positive and collaborative work environment.

AUR40116.name: Manage small business finances
AUR40116.desc: This unit covers the skills required to manage the day-to-day finances of a small business, including monitoring financial performance, managing cash flow, and maintaining financial records.

AUR40116.name: Develop work priorities
AUR40116.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge to manage personal work priorities and professional development. It includes planning and organizing own work schedule and participating in career planning.

AUR40116.name: Develop, present and negotiate client solutions
AUR40116.desc: This unit describes the skills required to develop, present, and negotiate financial product and service solutions that meet client needs.

AUR40116.name: Mentor in the workplace
AUR40116.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to establish and develop a mentoring relationship with an individual in the workplace to support their professional growth.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose complex system faults
AUR40216.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose complex faults in vehicle systems that have intermittent or multiple interacting issues, requiring the application of advanced diagnostic strategies and logical problem-solving.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose complex faults in light vehicle safety systems
AUR40216.desc: This unit involves the advanced diagnosis of complex faults in light vehicle safety systems, including Supplemental Restraint Systems (SRS), Anti-lock Braking Systems (ABS), and Electronic Stability Control (ESC).

AUR40216.name: Diagnose complex faults in air conditioning and HVAC systems
AUR40216.desc: This unit describes the skills to perform complex diagnostic procedures on automotive air conditioning and heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems, including their electronic controls.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose complex faults in heavy commercial vehicle braking systems
AUR40216.desc: This unit covers the advanced diagnosis of complex faults in heavy commercial vehicle braking systems, including air brake circuits and electronic brake control systems.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose complex faults in heavy commercial vehicle steering and suspension systems
AUR40216.desc: This unit involves diagnosing complex faults in the steering and suspension systems of heavy commercial vehicles, including electronically controlled suspension and advanced steering geometries.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose complex faults in heavy vehicle diesel engines
AUR40216.desc: This unit specifies the skills required to diagnose complex faults in heavy vehicle diesel engines and their associated management systems, using advanced diagnostic tools and procedures.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose complex faults in heavy commercial vehicle transmission and driveline systems
AUR40216.desc: This unit covers the diagnosis of complex faults in heavy commercial vehicle transmissions, including automated manual transmissions (AMTs), and driveline systems.

AUR40216.name: Conduct non-destructive testing
AUR40216.desc: This unit describes the competency to conduct non-destructive testing (NDT) on automotive components using methods like magnetic particle, dye penetrant, or ultrasonic testing to identify flaws.

AUR40216.name: Test engines using a dynamometer
AUR40216.desc: This unit involves the skills to set up, operate, and interpret data from an engine dynamometer to test engine performance and diagnose complex faults under various load conditions.

AUR40216.name: Analyse and repair performance carburetted fuel systems
AUR40216.desc: This unit covers the specialist skills required to analyse, diagnose, and repair performance-oriented carburetted fuel systems for enhanced engine output.

AUR40216.name: Analyse and repair performance fuel injection systems
AUR40216.desc: This unit describes the skills to analyse, diagnose, and repair performance electronic fuel injection (EFI) systems, including modifying parameters to optimise engine performance.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair high voltage rechargeable energy storage systems in battery electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This advanced unit covers the skills to test, diagnose faults in, and repair high voltage (HV) battery systems and associated components in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair traction motor speed control systems in battery electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This unit describes the skills to diagnose and repair the traction motor speed control systems, such as inverters and controllers, in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair high voltage traction motors in battery electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This unit involves the advanced diagnosis and repair of high voltage (HV) traction motors that propel battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair auxiliary motors and associated components in battery electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This unit covers the diagnosis and repair of various high voltage auxiliary motors and components in battery electric vehicles (BEVs), such as those for power steering and air conditioning.

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair system instrumentation and safety interlocks in battery electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This unit describes the competency to diagnose and repair the instrumentation and critical safety interlock systems within battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair HVAC and rechargeable energy storage cooling systems in battery electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This unit involves diagnosing and repairing the specialised cooling and heating systems used for the cabin (HVAC) and the high voltage battery in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair DC to DC converters in battery electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This unit covers the skills to diagnose and repair the DC to DC converters that step down high voltage to power the 12-volt systems in battery electric vehicles (BEVs).

AUR40216.name: Diagnose and repair high voltage rechargeable energy storage systems in hybrid electric vehicles
AUR40216.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the high voltage (HV) rechargeable energy storage systems of hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs).

AUR40820.name: Diagnose complex system faults
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose complex faults in vehicle systems that have intermittent or multiple interacting issues. It involves applying advanced diagnostic strategies to identify the root cause of a problem, which is a prerequisite for determining if an overhaul is necessary.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul charging system alternators
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the complete disassembly, inspection, repair, and reassembly of automotive charging system alternators. It includes testing components like the rotor, stator, regulator, and bearings to restore the unit to full operational condition.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul starting system motors
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the skills to overhaul automotive starting system motors. It covers dismantling the starter, testing the armature and field coils, replacing worn components like brushes and bushings, and reassembling and testing the unit.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul air conditioning and HVAC system compressors
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers the specialized process of overhauling automotive air conditioning compressors. It includes complete disassembly, inspection of internal components like pistons and seals, replacement of worn parts, and reassembly to manufacturer specifications.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul hydraulic and air over hydraulic braking system components
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the skills to overhaul components from heavy vehicle hydraulic and air-over-hydraulic braking systems, such as master cylinders, wheel cylinders, and boosters.

AUR40820.name: Carry out heavy vehicle wheel alignment operations
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the skills required to perform wheel alignments on heavy vehicles, including measuring and adjusting caster, camber, toe, and tracking to ensure proper handling and tire wear.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul light vehicle braking system components
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers overhauling light vehicle braking system components, such as disc brake callipers and drum brake wheel cylinders, by dismantling, inspecting, honing, and reassembling with new seals and parts.

AUR40820.name: Carry out light vehicle wheel alignment operations
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the skills to perform four-wheel alignments on light vehicles by measuring and adjusting suspension angles like camber, caster, and toe to meet manufacturer specifications.

AUR40820.name: Conduct non-destructive testing
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the competency to conduct non-destructive testing (NDT) on automotive components using methods like magnetic particle, dye penetrant, or ultrasonic testing to identify hidden cracks and flaws.

AUR40820.name: Test engines using a dynamometer
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the skills to set up and operate an engine dynamometer to measure engine performance, including horsepower and torque, and to diagnose complex faults under various load conditions.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul engines
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers the comprehensive process of overhauling an entire engine. It includes complete disassembly, evaluation of all components, performing necessary machining, and precise reassembly to manufacturer specifications.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul diesel fuel injection system components
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the skills to overhaul diesel fuel injection system components, such as injector pumps and injectors, in a clean environment to precise tolerances.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul carburettor fuel system components
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the skills to overhaul carburettors by completely dismantling, cleaning all passages, replacing jets, gaskets, and seals, and reassembling to restore original performance.

AUR40820.name: Operate and monitor computer numerical control machines
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers the skills required to set up, operate, and monitor computer numerical control (CNC) machines to perform precise machining operations on automotive components.

AUR40820.name: Repair bearing tunnels and connecting rods in engines
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the advanced machining skills required to recondition engine bearing tunnels (line boring) and connecting rods to restore correct size, alignment, and operational clearances.

AUR40820.name: Apply metal to rebuild engine components
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the skills to rebuild worn engine components by applying metal using techniques such as thermal arc spraying or welding, before machining them back to standard size.

AUR40820.name: Assemble engine blocks and sub-assemblies
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers the precision work of assembling engine blocks and sub-assemblies after machining, including fitting crankshafts, pistons, and camshafts and checking all clearances.

AUR40820.name: Balance rotating and reciprocating engine components
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the skills to dynamically balance engine rotating and reciprocating components, such as the crankshaft, pistons, and connecting rods, to ensure smooth operation and longevity.

AUR40820.name: Perform advanced machining and blueprinting of engine components
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers high-performance engine building techniques, including machining components to exact specifications (blueprinting) to optimize performance, efficiency, and reliability.

AUR40820.name: Carry out crankshaft grinding
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the specialized machining process of reconditioning a worn crankshaft by grinding the main and connecting rod journals to a precise undersize dimension.

AUR40820.name: Dismantle and evaluate engine blocks and sub-assemblies
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers the initial stage of an engine overhaul, involving systematically dismantling the engine block and sub-assemblies and conducting a thorough evaluation and measurement of all components to determine repair needs.

AUR40820.name: Fit sleeves and bore and hone engine cylinders
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the machining processes of fitting new cylinder sleeves, boring cylinders to a precise oversize dimension, and honing the cylinder walls to the correct surface finish for new piston rings.

AUR40820.name: Heat treat, straighten and reclaim engine components
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers advanced component reclamation techniques, including heat treating to alter metal properties, and straightening bent components like crankshafts and camshafts.

AUR40820.name: Recondition engine cylinder heads
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the complete process of reconditioning engine cylinder heads, including dismantling, pressure testing, resurfacing, servicing valve guides and seats, and reassembly.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul final drive assemblies
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the skills to overhaul final drive and differential assemblies by dismantling, inspecting gears and bearings, setting backlash and preload, and reassembling the unit.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul clutch assemblies
AUR40820.desc: This unit covers the overhauling of clutch assemblies, including inspecting and machining flywheels and pressure plates, and replacing the clutch disc and release bearing.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul manual transmissions
AUR40820.desc: This unit involves the complete disassembly, inspection of gears, bearings, and synchronizers, replacement of worn parts, and reassembly of manual transmissions to manufacturer specifications.

AUR40820.name: Overhaul automatic transmissions
AUR40820.desc: This unit describes the complex process of overhauling automatic transmissions, which includes dismantling, inspecting clutch packs, planetary gear sets, and the valve body, and reassembling with new seals and gaskets.

MSF30322.name: Make measurements and calculations
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately identify appropriate measuring equipment, perform precise measurements, and carry out relevant calculations in furnishing tasks. This includes selecting suitable tools, applying correct measurement techniques, estimating material quantities, and recording results accurately. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry to ensure precision and quality in their work.

MSF30322.name: Communicate in the workplace
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively receive, relay, and record both written and oral messages within a work environment. This includes accurately recording messages, seeking clarification when necessary, accessing required information, relaying information to appropriate personnel, and completing workplace documentation within designated timelines. The unit is applicable across various work environments and is essential for ensuring clear and accurate communication in the workplace.

MSF30322.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to comply with environmental regulations, identify environmental issues, and minimise negative impacts within their work area. This includes recognising workplace environmental and resource efficiency concerns, understanding resource usage in one's role, adhering to environmental policies and procedures, and seeking opportunities to enhance environmental practices and resource efficiency. The unit is applicable across various sectors of the manufacturing industry and its value chain, including office and warehouse settings, and is essential for promoting sustainable work practices.

MSF30322.name: Read and interpret work documents
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify, comprehend, and apply information from various work-related documents. This includes understanding Australian Standards, building codes, job procedures, manufacturer technical instructions, safety data sheets (SDS), and work plans. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to accurately interpret documentation, plan tasks effectively, and maintain proper documentation procedures, ensuring compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

MSF30322.name: Work in a team
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to organise their activities within a team to align with work schedules and meet operational guidelines. This includes identifying team and individual tasks, prioritising activities as directed, breaking work into manageable components, and utilising effective communication and interpersonal skills to ensure cohesive teamwork. Proficiency in this unit enables individuals to contribute effectively within various work environments, ensuring that team objectives are achieved efficiently and harmoniously.

MSF30322.name: Produce manual and computer-aided production drawings
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to create detailed production drawings that support the manufacture and assembly of furniture and cabinetry. This includes producing both manual and computer-aided drawings, utilising orthographic projections and section views, and adhering to Australian Standard AS1100 drawing conventions. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals to accurately represent design specifications, facilitating effective communication and precise fabrication in the furnishing industry.

MSF30322.name: Use furniture making hand and power tools
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and safely operate hand and power tools for common furniture making tasks, such as cutting, joining, planing, and sanding wood and other materials. This includes understanding tool safety, performing basic tool sharpening, and conducting routine maintenance to ensure tools remain functional and safe for use. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to complete routine tasks in industries such as cabinet and furniture making and wood machining, adhering to workplace procedures and manufacturer specifications.

MSF30322.name: Prepare cutting lists from design and production documentation
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to interpret various types of design and production documentation to prepare cutting lists and other information for subsequent processing operations in industries such as cabinet and furniture making and wood machining. This involves accurately extracting dimensions, materials, and quantities from design plans to create detailed cutting lists that guide the manufacturing process. Proficiency in this unit ensures that components are produced efficiently and accurately, minimising material waste and adhering to design specifications. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who are responsible for translating design documentation into actionable production plans.

MSF30322.name: Join solid timber
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to join timber to create solid flat surfaces. This includes accurately measuring, marking, and cutting timbers, applying various edge joining methods such as butt and dowel, moulded edge joints, biscuit joints, and slip-tongue joints, and ensuring the final product meets quality standards. The unit is essential for individuals in the cabinet and furniture making industries, enabling them to produce high-quality solid timber products by following established procedures and utilising appropriate tools and adhesives.

MSF30322.name: Match furnishing style and materials to customer requirements
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to align furniture styles and materials with clients' needs and preferences. This involves understanding various furnishing styles, materials, and production techniques, as well as effectively communicating and negotiating with customers to ensure their requirements are met. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who aim to provide customised solutions that satisfy customer expectations.

MSF30322.name: Design, construct and test jigs
