MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to design, build, and evaluate jigs used in the production of furniture or similar items. This involves understanding the principles of jig design, selecting appropriate materials, constructing the jig to specifications, and testing it to ensure it meets production requirements. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who aim to enhance production efficiency and maintain quality standards through the effective use of jigs.

MSF30322.name: Hand make timber joints
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to craft timber joints using hand and portable power tools. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, accurately marking out cutting and joining lines, and assembling joints to meet specified quality standards. The unit is essential for professionals in the furniture and cabinet making industries, enabling them to produce precise and durable timber joints that contribute to the overall quality of the finished product.

MSF30322.name: Install cabinetry
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install custom-made or mass-manufactured cabinetry, along with associated fixtures and fittings. This includes conducting pre-installation checks, identifying site constraints, executing the installation process, and performing quality assessments of the completed work. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals to ensure cabinetry installations are completed accurately, safely, and in compliance with design specifications and industry standards.

MSF30322.name: Research and organise product inspection and testing
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate the inspection and testing of furnishing products. This involves researching appropriate inspection and testing methods, organising the necessary resources, and ensuring that products meet quality and compliance standards. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who are responsible for maintaining product quality and adhering to industry regulations.

MSF30322.name: Use furniture finishing hand and power tools
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and use appropriate hand and power tools for furniture finishing tasks. This includes understanding the functions and safe operation of various tools, performing routine maintenance, and applying techniques to achieve desired finishes on furniture pieces. The unit is essential for professionals in the furniture finishing industry, enabling them to complete tasks efficiently and maintain high-quality workmanship.

MSF30322.name: Prepare surfaces for finishing
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare a range of furniture surfaces for the application of surface coatings by hand or machine. This includes tasks such as identifying and setting up required materials, tools, and equipment; preparing surfaces in accordance with workplace procedures and specifications; rectifying surface faults; and ensuring surfaces are suitable for further processing. The unit is essential for professionals in the furniture finishing industry, enabling them to complete routine tasks effectively and maintain high-quality workmanship.

MSF30322.name: Deliver and monitor a service to customers
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify customer needs, deliver and monitor customer service, and identify improvements in service provision. This includes establishing rapport with customers, managing complaints, and promoting services and products effectively. The unit applies to those who apply a broad range of competencies in various work contexts, exercising discretion and judgement using appropriate knowledge of customer service. They provide technical advice and support to customers over short or long-term interactions.

MSF30322.name: Manufacture components for doors, windows and frames
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to machine and assemble components for door and window frames, sashes, and panelled doors. This includes tasks such as setting out component materials, operating machinery safely, and adhering to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. The unit is essential for professionals in the construction industry, particularly those specialising in carpentry and joinery, enabling them to produce precise and compliant components for building projects.

MSF30322.name: Estimate and cost job
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate the net cost of providing products and services, calculate mark-up and tax, and develop comprehensive customer quotations. This involves obtaining detailed job information, assessing material and labour costs, and ensuring all calculations comply with organisational procedures and industry standards. The unit is applicable across various industries involving the manufacture and/or installation of products or delivery of services, enabling professionals to provide precise and competitive pricing to clients.

MSF30322.name: Produce angled and curved components using manufactured board
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce and assemble components with angled and curved constructions using manufactured board materials. This includes techniques such as kerfing, machine curving, laminated curving, and skinning curved sub-frames for curved components, as well as creating bevel joins and flat panel angled components. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furnishing and cabinet-making industries to craft complex designs, such as curved counters, desks, and cabinetry, ensuring high-quality workmanship and adherence to design specifications.

MSF30322.name: Select timbers for furniture production
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to determine timber requirements and evaluate the suitability of different timbers against those requirements. This involves assessing various timber properties, such as density, hardness, elasticity, and compatibility with other materials, to ensure they meet specified client or production needs. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furniture production industry to make informed decisions when selecting timbers, ensuring the quality and suitability of the final product.

MSF30322.name: Prepare and apply decorative surfaces for furnishing products
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare, construct, and apply decorative surfaces, such as veneers and inlays, to furnishing products. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, preparing surfaces, constructing decorative elements, and applying them to achieve the desired aesthetic effect. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furnishing industry to enhance the visual appeal and quality of furniture pieces through the application of decorative surface techniques.

MSF30322.name: Produce angled and curved components using solid timber
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce and assemble solid timber components using angled and curved construction methods. This includes techniques such as kerfing, machine curving, laminated curving, and creating bevel joins and flat panel angled components. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furnishing and cabinet-making industries to craft complex designs, such as curved counters, desks, seating, cabinetry, and end panels, ensuring high-quality workmanship and adherence to design specifications.

MSF30322.name: Operate basic static machines safely
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely operate basic stationary machinery used in industries such as wood machining and cabinet and furniture making. This includes tasks such as setting up machines, conducting pre-start checks, operating machines within their designed capacity, and adhering to safety requirements, including the correct positioning of hands and body, use of machine guards, and understanding the importance of grain direction in solid timber. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to perform basic operations on machines like band saws, crosscut saws, panel saws, rip saws, edge banders, hinge borers, thicknessers, jointers, and wide belt sanders, ensuring tasks are completed efficiently and safely in accordance with workplace procedures and manufacturer specifications.

MSF30322.name: Prepare to work safely in the construction industry
MSF30322.desc: This unit is a mandatory training requirement for individuals seeking to undertake construction work in Australia. It imparts essential knowledge of work health and safety (WHS) legislative requirements, enabling individuals to work safely and prevent injury or harm to themselves and others. Key components of the training include identifying and reporting common construction hazards, understanding basic risk control measures, responding to potential incidents and emergencies, and correctly selecting and fitting personal protective equipment (PPE) used in construction work. Successful completion of this unit is a prerequisite for obtaining the 'White Card,' which is compulsory for all construction workers in Australia.

CPC30220.name: Use carpentry tools and equipment
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on equipping learners with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely and effectively select, use, and maintain a variety of carpentry tools and equipment. This includes understanding the functions of different tools, adhering to safety protocols, and performing routine maintenance to ensure tools remain in good working condition. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry, as it lays the foundation for competent and safe tool handling in various carpentry tasks.

CPC30220.name: Handle carpentry materials
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely manually handle, sort, stack, and store carpentry materials in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) and environmental regulations. It also encompasses preparing materials for mechanical handling and applying environmental management principles associated with carpentry materials. This unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30220.name: Carry out general demolition of minor building structures
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively demolish minor building structures to facilitate alterations, extensions, and additions in residential and commercial sites. This includes planning and preparing for demolition tasks, assessing structures to determine the scope of work, managing risks, complying with work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements, and handling materials appropriately for disposal or salvage. The unit is designed for construction workers, such as carpenters and concreters, working as part of a team to complete demolition tasks according to schedules, plans, and specifications.

CPC30220.name: Carry out setting out
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify site boundaries and survey indicators, and to establish, measure, and set up profiled set-outs for buildings and structural components. This includes tasks such as setting out pads, posts, slabs, strips, and stumps, and installing string lines to profile the footings of a building and associated structures on a site. The unit ensures compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation.

CPC30220.name: Install flooring systems
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, and install timber and steel flooring systems that support internal and external walls in residential buildings. This includes installing flooring in areas such as bedrooms, living rooms, kitchens, bathrooms, balconies, and decks. The unit emphasizes compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and other relevant legislation. Key competencies include setting out and installing support structures, bearers, and floor joists, fitting and fixing trimmers and blocks, and installing various flooring materials.

CPC30220.name: Construct and erect wall frames
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, construct, and erect both load-bearing and non-load-bearing wall frames using timber and steel. This includes tasks such as setting out wall locations, cutting and assembling components like studs, plates, lintels, and bracing, and erecting frames in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry or joinery, as it ensures the ability to construct wall frames that meet structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct ceiling frames
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, construct, and erect timber ceiling frames. This includes accommodating various components such as ceiling joists, hanging beams, strutting beams, and combined hanging/strutting beams. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve selecting appropriate materials, accurately setting out ceiling frames in conjunction with roof members, and ensuring compliance with structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Erect roof trusses
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select, set out, erect, and brace timber and steel roof trusses in preparation for installing waterproof roof coverings. This includes interpreting work instructions, planning sequences, managing materials, and ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, National Association of Steel-framed Housing (NASH) Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Key competencies involve setting out truss locations, safely lifting and handling materials, erecting and plumbing trusses in sequence, installing bracing and lateral restraints, and ensuring all work meets structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct pitched roofs
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to set out, construct, and erect pitched roofs to accommodate roof coverings for weatherproofing purposes. This includes determining the necessary materials and processes, and constructing various roof structures such as scotch valley gable and broken hip and valley roofs. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation.

CPC30220.name: Construct eaves
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, and construct eaves in both new and existing structures. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, measuring and cutting components, and assembling eaves to ensure proper ventilation and weatherproofing. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry, as it ensures the ability to construct eaves that meet structural and aesthetic requirements.

CPC30220.name: Install windows and doors
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, and install window and door units in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, accurately setting out openings, installing frames and fittings, and ensuring proper sealing and alignment to achieve weatherproofing and security standards. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry or construction, as it ensures the ability to install windows and doors that meet structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct, assemble and install timber external stairs
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to build and install timber external stairs with one or more flights, providing access to buildings or structures. This includes tasks such as setting out stair components, cutting and assembling stringers and treads, and fitting handrails and balustrades. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry or construction, as it ensures the ability to construct safe and compliant external stair structures.

CPC30220.name: Install exterior cladding
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply material finishes to external framed wall surfaces for weatherproofing and securing buildings. This includes the application of both sheet and linear style claddings in a range of materials, ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve preparing exterior wall frames, installing thermal and moisture management systems, setting out and fixing various types of cladding, and adhering to manufacturers' installation instructions.

CPC30220.name: Install lining, panelling and moulding
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare, set out, and install lining and panelling to masonry and timber and/or metal-framed walls. This includes the installation of mouldings to provide decorative finishes, ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve selecting appropriate materials, preparing surfaces, accurately setting out and installing linings and panelling, and fitting various mouldings such as architraves and skirtings to achieve a high-quality finish.

CPC30220.name: Read and interpret plans, specifications and drawings for carpentry work
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately interpret construction documents to plan and sequence carpentry tasks. This includes understanding construction plans, cross-sectional plans, dimensions, notes, illustrations, project specifications, site plans, elevations, floor plans, sections, and structural details. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for carpentry professionals to ensure that construction work aligns with specified requirements and industry standards.

CPC30220.name: Erect and dismantle formwork for footings and slabs on ground
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct and disassemble formwork for concrete footings and ground-level slabs. This process involves establishing site levels, selecting appropriate materials such as timber, metal, or reconstituted products, and assembling formwork to contain poured concrete until it cures. Additionally, the unit covers the safe dismantling, cleaning, and storage of formwork components for future use. All tasks must comply with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation.

CPC30220.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish correct and accurate set-out of building components. This includes setting up, testing, and using levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using a range of levelling equipment. The unit supports workers in the construction industry who use various common methods and equipment when working with others and as part of a team. It applies to levelling work on residential and commercial work sites.

CPC30220.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes tasks such as planning and preparing for scaffolding work, placing safety barriers, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and repairing scaffolding components, and dismantling the scaffolding safely. The unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for workers in various industries who need to provide safe work platforms for occupational applications.

CPC30220.name: Work safely at heights
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform tasks on construction sites where there is a risk of falling from one level to another. This includes identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting personal protective equipment (PPE), installing fall protection systems, and safely accessing and traversing work areas at height. The unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for construction workers to ensure safety when working at heights.

CPC30220.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other minor works to a specified design finish. This includes tasks such as preparing the substrate, erecting simple formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, placing concrete, screeding to the alignment of formwork, finishing the concrete surface, and safely dismantling formwork. The unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in construction, as it ensures the ability to perform basic concreting tasks that meet structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. Key competencies include effective teamwork, understanding roles and responsibilities, planning and executing tasks, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit also covers identifying pathways to become a tradesperson or skilled operator, recognising existing skills, and determining additional skills needed for career advancement. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30220.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary for effective communication within a construction workplace. It encompasses gathering, conveying, and receiving information through both verbal and written forms, ensuring clarity and understanding among team members. Key competencies include active listening, effective questioning, preparing and presenting basic reports, and participating in simple meeting processes. This unit is designed for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30220.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations essential for determining task and material requirements in a construction environment. Key competencies include selecting appropriate measurement equipment, accurately obtaining linear measurements, applying basic mathematical formulas to calculate quantities such as weight, area, volume, perimeter, and converting measurements between units. This unit is designed for individuals performing routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30220.name: Perform construction calculations to determine carpentry material requirements
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary to accurately calculate material quantities for construction projects. Key competencies include interpreting construction drawings and specifications, calculating areas and volumes of various materials, and determining the precise quantities of materials required for tasks such as wall and roof framing, internal linings, flooring, external cladding, and roofing. This unit is designed for individuals performing routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30220.name: Carry out levelling operations
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform accurate levelling tasks essential for setting out buildings and components in construction projects. Key competencies include setting up, testing, and using levelling devices; applying the rise and fall and height of collimation methods; undertaking closed and open traverses with various levelling equipment; and calculating distances using stadia lines. This unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It is designed for individuals performing levelling operations on residential and commercial work sites in new construction, renovation, refurbishment, and maintenance projects.

CPC30220.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to implement work health and safety (WHS) practices in construction settings. Key competencies include identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (such as asbestos), planning and applying safe work practices, and following emergency procedures. This unit is fundamental for workers across all construction sectors, ensuring adherence to legislated safety practices and contributing to a safer work environment.

CPC30220.name: Identify construction work hazards and select risk control strategies
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively identify hazards and implement appropriate risk control measures on construction sites. Key competencies include planning and preparing for hazard identification, conducting thorough inspections to detect potential risks, and developing job safety analyses (JSAs) and safe work method statements (SWMSs) in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) legislation. This unit is essential for construction workers involved in ensuring safety on residential and commercial work sites, encompassing new constructions, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance projects.

CPC30220.name: Carry out hand excavation
CPC30220.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to perform hand excavation tasks for forming excavations for footings and the provision of services. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the supervision of more experienced workers. It emphasises safety, accurate measurement, and compliance with environmental requirements.

CPC30220.name: Operate elevated work platforms up to 11 metres
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs) in various locations, including uneven terrain. It encompasses tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. This unit is applicable to construction work on residential and commercial sites, including new constructions, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance projects. It emphasises adherence to safety protocols, accurate operation, and compliance with relevant regulations.

CPC30220.name: Construct tilt panels on site
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in a team to set up, pour, and place concrete tilt panels to form internal and external walls for building structures on residential, commercial, or civil construction sites. It encompasses both on-site and prefabricated methods of panel construction, including tasks such as planning and preparation, setting out and constructing temporary casting beds, preparing formwork, placing reinforcement and cast-in fittings, and finishing and curing concrete. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, environmental considerations, and compliance with relevant legislation, regulations, and codes of practice.

CPC30220.name: Place and fix reinforcement materials
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to place and secure reinforcement for concrete work within construction processes. This includes planning and preparing for the task, performing final preparations for placement, accurately positioning and fixing reinforcement materials such as deformed bars, rods, and mesh sheets, verifying the reinforcement setup prior to concrete pouring, and completing subsequent clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, environmental considerations, and compliance with relevant legislation, regulations, and codes of practice.

CPC30220.name: Frame and fit wet area fixtures
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to install supporting frameworks for fixtures and flashings in wet areas such as bathrooms, laundries, showers, toilets, and en suites. This includes preparing for the installation of baths, shower bases, sinks, or basin units, and ensuring proper fitting and flashing to meet regulatory standards. The unit emphasises safety, accurate measurement, material selection, and compliance with environmental requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct and install bulkheads
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to construct bulkheads for decorative purposes, to contain fittings such as range hoods and cupboards, to conceal services, and to facilitate changes in ceiling heights. This includes preparing for sheeting bulkheads with materials like plasterboard, lining boards, reconstituted timber products, and metal or plastic decorative panels. The unit covers the installation of bulkheads that may be hung from, incorporated into, or fastened onto a structure in situ. It emphasises compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and environmental requirements.

CPC30320.name: Carry out setting out
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately establish and mark out the location and dimensions of buildings or structures on a construction site. This process, known as 'setting out,' involves interpreting construction plans, identifying site boundaries, and using tools to mark reference points that guide the construction process. Proficiency in this unit ensures that structures are positioned correctly according to design specifications, which is crucial for the integrity and success of construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Erect and dismantle formwork for footings and slabs on ground
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct and disassemble formwork systems for concrete footings and ground-level slabs. This includes interpreting construction plans, selecting appropriate materials, establishing accurate levels, assembling formwork to contain poured concrete until it cures, and safely dismantling and preparing formwork components for reuse. Proficiency in this unit ensures that formwork is erected and dismantled in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations, contributing to the structural integrity and safety of construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Carry out hand excavation
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform manual excavation tasks for footings and service provisions on construction sites. This includes planning and preparing for excavation, identifying and avoiding underground services, establishing excavation lines and depths, implementing safety measures, and executing the excavation using appropriate hand tools. Proficiency in this unit ensures that manual excavation is conducted safely and effectively, adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental requirements.

CPC30320.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform levelling tasks in a single plane, essential for accurately setting out building components on construction sites. This involves setting up, testing, and using various levelling devicesâ€”such as spirit levels, laser levels, and automatic/optical levelsâ€”to establish and transfer heights as per job specifications. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction elements are positioned correctly, adhering to industry standards and contributing to the structural integrity of building projects.

CPC30320.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on providing individuals with the foundational skills required to operate productively and sustainably in a construction environment. This includes understanding workplace roles, adhering to workplace health and safety (WHS) requirements, planning and prioritising tasks, working collaboratively within a team, and implementing environmentally sustainable practices. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals contribute effectively to workplace goals while promoting resource efficiency and sustainable work practices.

CPC30320.name: Plan and organise work
CPC30320.desc: This unit provides individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively plan and organise tasks within a construction setting. This involves determining work requirements, prioritising tasks, identifying resource needs, and scheduling activities to ensure efficiency and alignment with project goals. The unit emphasises teamwork, clear communication, and adherence to workplace health and safety (WHS) standards, enabling individuals to contribute to smooth and productive workflows on construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively within a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms of communication, as well as participating in simple meeting processes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively interpret instructions, convey information accurately, and engage constructively in workplace discussions, thereby contributing to efficient and safe construction operations.

CPC30320.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the foundational skills required to perform accurate measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting and using appropriate measuring tools, recording measurements, and applying mathematical techniques to calculate dimensions such as area, volume, and material quantities. Proficiency in this unit ensures tasks are executed with precision, contributing to efficient planning and resource management on construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills to accurately comprehend construction drawings and documents. This includes understanding various types of plans, symbols, abbreviations, and specifications pertinent to construction projects. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction personnel can effectively interpret project requirements, facilitating accurate execution of tasks and adherence to design intentions.

CPC30320.name: Handle concreting materials and components
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely manage and prepare concreting materials and components for construction tasks. This includes understanding the properties of various concreting materials, selecting appropriate handling methods, and adhering to safety protocols to ensure the integrity of materials and the safety of personnel. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreting materials are handled efficiently, contributing to the quality and durability of concrete structures.

CPC30320.name: Select, use and maintain concreting plant, tools and equipment
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively handle various concreting machinery, tools, and equipment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment for specific tasks, understanding operational functions and limitations, adhering to safety protocols, and performing routine maintenance to ensure optimal performance. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreting operations are conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with workplace and manufacturer requirements.

CPC30320.name: Determine concrete supply requirements
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to assess and specify the type and volume of concrete needed for various concreting projects. This includes interpreting project documentation to identify concrete properties, calculating required volumes, estimating costs, and scheduling deliveries to ensure timely and efficient supply. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreting operations are planned and executed accurately, aligning with project specifications and industry standards.

CPC30320.name: Place concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively place concrete into prepared formwork or foundations. This includes tasks such as receiving and verifying concrete deliveries, calculating the necessary volume of concrete, transporting it to the designated pour location, and executing the placement and screeding processes to achieve the specified levels and finishes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concrete placement is conducted safely, accurately, and in compliance with project specifications and relevant standards.

CPC30320.name: Finish concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply manual and mechanical finishing techniques to concrete surfaces, ensuring they meet specified standards. This includes tasks such as assessing the concrete surface during the curing process, applying mechanical trowelling to consolidate and densify the setting concrete, installing jointing systems, finishing edges, and ensuring the final surface complies with project specifications. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concrete surfaces are finished to the desired quality, contributing to the durability and aesthetic appeal of the construction project.

CPC30320.name: Cure concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform the initial curing process on freshly poured concrete. This process involves controlling moisture evaporation to ensure proper hydration and strength development of the concrete. Key tasks include applying appropriate curing agents and techniques in accordance with engineering specifications to maintain the desired moisture and temperature conditions during the critical early stages of concrete setting. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concrete structures achieve their intended durability and performance characteristics.

CPC30320.name: Place and fix reinforcement materials
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install reinforcement for concrete structures as part of construction processes. This includes planning and preparing for the task, cutting and bending reinforcement bars, placing and securing reinforcement using bar chairs, ligatures, and spacers, and ensuring compliance with engineering drawings and specifications. Proficiency in this unit ensures that reinforcement materials are accurately positioned and fixed, contributing to the structural integrity and durability of concrete constructions.

CPC30320.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to adhere to Work Health and Safety (WHS) regulations within the construction sector. It encompasses understanding and implementing WHS legislative requirements, recognising construction hazards, and following established safety procedures to ensure a safe working environment. This unit is essential for those entering the construction industry, as it lays the foundation for maintaining safety standards on-site.

CPC30320.name: Plan concrete work and brief team
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively plan concreting tasks and communicate requirements to team members. This includes assessing the size and scope of concreting projects, scheduling activities in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations, identifying and sourcing necessary resources, and briefing team members to ensure tasks are completed on time and within budget. This unit is essential for individuals responsible for organising concreting work and leading teams in the construction industry.

CPC30320.name: Apply decorative finishes to concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to enhance concrete surfaces with decorative treatments. This includes techniques such as stamping, stencilling, colouring, exposing aggregates, and applying textured finishes to create distinctive features for areas like driveways, patios, and pathways. The unit is essential for concreters working autonomously or as part of a team, aiming to produce aesthetically pleasing and durable concrete finishes in various construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Repair and rectify concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to address defects in concrete structures. This encompasses tasks such as patching, refinishing, sealing, recolouring to enhance aesthetic appeal, and more substantial repairs like cutting and replacing concrete sections or repairing cracks in accordance with engineer or manufacturer specifications. The unit does not cover structural defects requiring underpinning or specialist works involving highly engineered solutions. This unit is essential for professionals in the construction industry responsible for maintaining and restoring the integrity of concrete installations.

CPC30320.name: Cut concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively cut concrete using appropriate tools and techniques. This includes planning and preparing for concrete cutting tasks, assessing the work site to determine concrete type and thickness, selecting and using suitable equipment, performing cuts according to specifications, and managing associated hazards such as dust control. This unit is essential for construction professionals involved in projects requiring precise and safe concrete cutting.

CPC30320.name: Conduct concrete pump delivery operations
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and efficiently operate concrete pumping equipment on construction sites. This includes planning and preparing for concrete pumping tasks, conducting pre-operational checks, positioning the pump, managing the delivery of concrete to specified locations, and performing post-operational procedures. Emphasis is placed on adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and effective communication with team members to ensure the safe and precise placement of concrete.

CPC31420.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry. It is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Key competencies include participating in team planning, understanding construction job roles and employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work. Achievement of unit CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. It involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and preparing a written work plan. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work. Achievement of unit CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively with other workers in a construction workplace environment. It includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms of communication. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work. Achievement of unit CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to undertake basic measurements and calculations to determine task and material requirements in a construction work environment. It involves selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and performing calculations for quantities of materials using basic formulas for weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine tasks under supervision. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work; achievement of CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to read and interpret plans and specifications relevant to construction operations at a basic level. It involves understanding key features and functions of different types of construction plans and drawings, interpreting legends, symbols, and abbreviations, and identifying project requirements such as construction types, dimensions, environmental controls, and material specifications. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying work health and safety requirements in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to carry out work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in all on-site or off-site construction workplaces. It involves identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (including asbestos), planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices, and following emergency procedures. The unit is essential for individuals working in the construction industry to ensure personal safety and the safety of others by adhering to legislated work safety practices. Notably, this unit is a mandatory requirement for trainers delivering the White Card Course (CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry).

CPC31420.name: Handle waterproofing materials and components
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely handle and store waterproofing materials and components, both manually and mechanically, in compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as preparing, handling, sorting, stacking, and disposing of waterproofing products and materials during the application of waterproofing systems. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Use waterproofing tools and equipment
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively use tools and equipment in waterproofing tasks, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses planning and preparing for the use of waterproofing tools, selecting appropriate hand and power tools, conducting pre-operational checks, and adhering to safe work practices during operation. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Prepare surfaces for waterproofing application
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to repair and prepare various surfaces for waterproofing applications, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key tasks include assessing and repairing surface defects, cleaning and preparing work areas, and selecting appropriate tools and materials for the waterproofing process. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under supervision. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing system to below ground level wet areas
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply waterproofing systems to below-ground wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as preparing surfaces, selecting appropriate waterproofing materials, applying waterproofing systems, and ensuring proper drainage and protection of the waterproofed area. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing process to internal wet areas
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply waterproofing to internal wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as identifying appropriate waterproofing systems, preparing surfaces, applying waterproofing membranes, and ensuring proper curing and protection of the treated areas. This unit is essential for individuals aiming to perform waterproofing tasks in areas like bathrooms, laundries, and showers, ensuring these spaces are effectively protected against water ingress. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing process to external above-ground wet areas
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply waterproofing to external above-ground wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as identifying appropriate waterproofing systems, preparing surfaces, applying waterproofing membranes, and ensuring proper detailing and termination of the waterproofing system. This unit is essential for individuals aiming to perform waterproofing tasks on structures like balconies, decks, and planter boxes, ensuring these areas are effectively protected against water ingress. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing remedial processes
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply remedial waterproofing processes to wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) requirements, and relevant legislation. It involves planning and preparing for remedial work, selecting appropriate techniques and materials, applying the remedial processes, and conducting tests to confirm the effectiveness of repairs. This unit is essential for individuals responsible for maintaining and repairing waterproofing systems to ensure the integrity of wet areas in both residential and commercial constructions. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Assess construction waterproofing processes
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to assess waterproofing processes across various wet areas in building situations, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It involves planning and preparing for assessments, evaluating selected waterproofing systems for installation techniques, product suitability, compatibility with substrates, and conformity to codes and specifications. Additionally, it includes assessing potential for water penetration, determining installation methods, and identifying potential faults and mitigation activities. This unit is essential for individuals responsible for ensuring the integrity of waterproofing systems in construction projects. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC31420.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge to explore and assess potential business opportunities. It covers identifying and researching viable business ideas, evaluating market needs, and determining the feasibility of these opportunities. The unit is essential for those considering starting a new business or expanding an existing one, as it provides a structured approach to making informed decisions about business ventures.

CPC31420.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC31420.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. It encompasses the use of new and emerging digital technologies, interpretation of financial reports, and analysis of numerical data. Key aspects include developing financial budgets or projections, managing business capital, ensuring adequate financial provision for taxation, and monitoring financial performance through key performance indicators (KPIs). This unit is essential for those establishing a business for self-employment or initiating a new venture within a larger organisation, providing a structured approach to effective financial management in business settings.

CPC31420.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish correct and accurate set-out of building components. It includes the set-up, testing, and use of levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using a range of levelling equipment. The unit supports workers in the construction industry who use various common methods and equipment when working with others and as part of a team. It applies to levelling work on residential and commercial work sites.

CPC31420.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to erect and dismantle modular scaffolding systems up to a height of four metres, providing work platforms for various occupational applications. It encompasses planning and preparation, establishing footings, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting for structural integrity, and safely dismantling the scaffolding. The unit applies to workers across a range of industries and involves working in a team environment. No licensing, legislative, or certification requirements apply to this unit at the time of publication.

CPC31420.name: Carry out basic demolition
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to remove components from single-storey buildings and structures using basic demolition techniques. It includes preparing the site for demolition, safely removing building components, and handling materials for disposal or salvage. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying work health and safety requirements in the construction industry.

MEM31925.name: Interpret technical drawing
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to interpret technical drawings used in engineering and manufacturing contexts. It includes understanding different types of drawings, symbols, dimensions, and material specifications to accurately determine job requirements. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to read and apply information from technical drawings effectively.

MEM31925.name: Organise and communicate information
MEM31925.desc: This unit focuses on effectively organising and communicating information within a manufacturing or engineering context. It involves accessing, interpreting, and conveying information accurately using appropriate methods and procedures to ensure clear and efficient communication in the workplace.

MEM31925.name: Plan work activities
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to plan familiar work activities by following established procedures and work health and safety (WHS) policies. It involves determining job requirements, identifying and prioritising components of the plan, selecting appropriate planning tools, and modifying the plan as necessary to respond to unforeseen developments. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to organise work effectively and safely.

MEM31925.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MEM31925.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to apply environmentally sustainable work practices in the manufacturing sector. It involves identifying environmental regulations applicable to the workplace, assessing current practices, and implementing improvements to reduce environmental risks. Competency in this unit contributes to the development of sustainable work practices.

MEM31925.name: Use power tools/hand-held operations
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to safely operate a variety of hand-held power tools commonly used in manufacturing, engineering, and related environments. It includes selecting appropriate tools, performing operations such as cutting, grinding, and drilling, and conducting routine maintenance. Achieving competency in this unit ensures effective and safe use of power tools in various tasks.

MEM31925.name: Use hand tools
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to use a variety of hand tools in manufacturing, engineering, and related environments. It includes selecting appropriate tools for specific tasks, performing operations such as measuring, marking, cutting, and assembling, and maintaining tools in good working condition. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to use hand tools safely and effectively.

MEM31925.name: Perform computations
MEM31925.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to perform calculations involving percentages, proportions, ratios, and averages, as well as producing and interpreting simple charts and graphs. It is essential for tasks that require precise measurements and data interpretation in manufacturing and engineering contexts. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to perform necessary computations accurately.

MEM31925.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes understanding and following work health and safety (WHS) procedures, using personal protective equipment (PPE), and communicating effectively with team members. Competency in this unit ensures adherence to safety protocols and effective workplace communication.

MEM31925.name: Interact with computing technology
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to use computing technology in a manufacturing or engineering context. It includes accessing, inputting, and storing information using relevant software applications, as well as following organisational procedures for data management. Achieving competency in this unit ensures effective interaction with computing technology in the workplace.

MEM31925.name: Undertake manual handling
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to safely lift and move materials manually or using basic manual handling equipment in various work environments. It includes determining material weight, assessing risks, selecting appropriate lifting techniques, and utilising equipment such as hand trolleys or pallet trucks. Competency in this unit ensures adherence to Safe Work Australia guidelines for manual handling.

MEM31925.name: Perform engineering measurements
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to perform precise measurements in an engineering context. It includes selecting and using appropriate measuring instruments, interpreting technical information, and recording data accurately. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to obtain reliable measurements essential for engineering tasks.

MEM31925.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training
MEM31925.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to assist in delivering on-the-job training within the workplace. It involves planning and organising training sessions, demonstrating work skills, providing feedback, and monitoring trainee progress. Competency in this unit contributes to effective workplace training and skill development.

MEM31925.name: Shut down and isolate machines/equipment
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to safely shut down and isolate machines and equipment in a manufacturing or engineering environment. It includes following standard operating procedures (SOPs) to de-energise and secure machinery, ensuring safety during maintenance or emergency situations.

MEM31925.name: Dismantle, replace and assemble engineering components
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves dismantling engineering components, identifying faulty parts, selecting replacements, and reassembling components into assemblies or sub-assemblies. It ensures that components function correctly and meet specified tolerances.

MEM31925.name: Work safely with industrial chemicals and materials
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to work safely with industrial chemicals and materials. It includes understanding chemical properties, interpreting safety data sheets, using appropriate personal protective equipment, and following safety protocols to minimise risks associated with handling hazardous substances.

MEM31925.name: Perform manual heating and thermal cutting
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves performing manual heating and thermal cutting operations on metals. It includes setting up equipment, applying heating and cutting techniques such as oxy-fuel cutting, and adhering to safety procedures to cut materials to specified shapes and sizes.

MEM31925.name: Weld using manual metal arc welding process
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on various materials. It includes preparing materials and equipment, setting welding parameters, and executing welds to meet specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to produce sound welds in accordance with industry standards.

MEM31925.name: Operate as a team member to conduct manufacturing, engineering or related activities
MEM31925.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to operate effectively as a member of a team in manufacturing, engineering, or related environments. It includes understanding team goals and processes, communicating and cooperating with team members, performing tasks according to organisational and team requirements, and solving problems collaboratively. Achieving competency in this unit ensures effective participation in team-based operations.

MEM31925.name: Order materials
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to order materials for production or maintenance activities. It includes identifying material requirements, selecting appropriate suppliers, placing orders, and following up to ensure timely delivery. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to manage material resources effectively.

MEM31925.name: Operate and monitor machine and process
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to operate and monitor machines and processes in a manufacturing or engineering environment. It includes setting up machines, monitoring operations, identifying and responding to irregularities, and maintaining production quality. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to manage machinery operations efficiently.

MEM31925.name: Carry out mechanical cutting
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate a range of mechanical cutting and holing equipment, such as guillotines, croppers, and saws. It involves selecting appropriate machines and tooling, preparing materials, and performing cutting operations to meet specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out mechanical cutting tasks safely and efficiently.

MEM31925.name: Perform brazing and/or silver soldering
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform brazing and silver soldering operations. It includes preparing materials and equipment, applying appropriate techniques to join metals, and inspecting completed work to ensure it meets specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out brazing and silver soldering tasks effectively.

MEM31925.name: Assemble fabricated components
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to assemble fabricated components in manufacturing or engineering environments. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate assembly methods, using tools and equipment to join components, and ensuring the final assembly meets specifications. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to assemble fabricated components accurately and efficiently.

MEM31925.name: Perform routine manual metal arc welding
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform routine manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on low carbon mild steel. It involves preparing materials and equipment, selecting appropriate electrodes, and executing welds such as butt and fillet joints. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out MMAW tasks safely and effectively.

MEM31925.name: Repair, replace and/or modify fabrications
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to undertake repair, replacement, and modification of fabrications. It includes inspecting fabrications to determine suitability for repair, assessing material requirements, preparing materials, and performing necessary welding and fabrication tasks. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to manage fabrication maintenance and repair tasks efficiently.

MEM31925.name: Use tools for precision work
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to use tools to manually produce work to precise dimensions and finishes. It covers performing precision tasks on various materials using a range of tools, instruments, and power equipment. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to execute precision work accurately and efficiently.

MEM31925.name: Perform routine oxy-fuel gas welding
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform routine oxy-fuel gas welding on materials such as mild/low carbon steel and cast iron. It involves preparing materials and equipment, setting up and operating welding equipment, and executing welds to meet job specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out oxy-fuel gas welding tasks safely and effectively.

MEM31925.name: Weld using gas tungsten arc welding process
MEM31925.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to weld materials using the gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW) process. It includes preparing materials and equipment, setting welding parameters, and performing welds to meet specifications. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to execute GTAW tasks proficiently.

MEM31925.name: Weld using gas metal arc welding process
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to weld materials using the gas metal arc welding (GMAW) process. It involves preparing materials and equipment, selecting appropriate welding parameters, and performing welds to meet job specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out GMAW tasks safely and effectively.

MEM31925.name: Perform internal/external customer service
MEM31925.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to provide effective customer service to both internal and external customers in a manufacturing or engineering environment. It includes identifying customer needs, delivering quality service, and handling complaints or issues professionally. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to maintain positive customer relations.

MEM31925.name: Apply fabrication, forming and shaping techniques
MEM31925.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to apply fabrication, forming, and shaping techniques to produce components from materials such as plate, sheet, tube, and pipe. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, and performing operations such as levelling, rolling, pressing, and bending to meet specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to fabricate components accurately using various forming and shaping methods.

MEM30219.name: Interpret technical drawing
MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to interpret technical drawings. Technical drawings may utilise perspective, exploded views, or hidden view techniques and may include symbol glossaries. Drawings are provided to AS 1100 Technical drawing or AS 1102 Graphical symbols and their equivalents from the full range of engineering disciplines.

MEM30219.name: Undertake manual handling
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to lift and move materials manually and/or using basic manual handling equipment in various environments. It emphasises adhering to Safe Work Australia recommendations, ensuring safety and compliance during manual handling tasks.

MEM30219.name: Perform engineering measurements
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves performing precise engineering measurements using appropriate tools and equipment. It includes selecting and using measuring devices, recording data accurately, and ensuring measurements meet specified tolerances and standards.

MEM30219.name: Perform computations
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on performing mathematical computations essential in engineering contexts. It encompasses calculations involving algebra, geometry, and trigonometry to solve engineering problems, ensuring accurate and reliable results.

MEM30219.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes following standard operating procedures, complying with work health and safety requirements, and using appropriate personal protective equipment.

MEM30219.name: Plan work activities
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves planning work activities in a manufacturing or engineering setting. It includes determining job requirements, sequencing tasks, and coordinating resources to achieve efficient workflow and meet production targets.

MEM30219.name: Organise and communicate information
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on effectively organising and communicating information within a manufacturing or engineering context. It involves accessing, interpreting, and conveying information accurately using appropriate methods and procedures to ensure clear and efficient communication in the workplace.

MEM30219.name: Interact with computing technology
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to use computing technology in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes accessing, inputting, and storing information using various software applications and devices, ensuring efficient and accurate data management.

MEM30219.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves assisting in delivering on-the-job training within the workplace. It includes preparing for training, providing support to trainees, and contributing to the assessment process to facilitate effective skill development and knowledge transfer.

MEM30219.name: Use hand tools
MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively use a variety of hand tools in engineering applications. It encompasses selecting appropriate tools, performing tasks to specifications, and maintaining tools in good working condition.

MEM30219.name: Use power tools/hand-held operations
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the use of a range of hand-held power tools and fixed power tools for hand-held operations in general engineering tasks. It includes selecting appropriate tools, performing operations safely, and conducting operational maintenance to ensure tools are in proper working order.

MEM30219.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to apply environmentally sustainable work practices in the workplace. It includes identifying environmental regulations, assessing workplace environmental practices, and contributing to improvements to minimise environmental risks and maximise resource efficiency.

MEM30219.name: Carry out mechanical cutting
MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate a range of mechanical cutting and holing equipment, such as guillotines, saws, and cropping machines. It involves planning material usage to minimise waste, selecting appropriate machinery and tooling, and performing cutting operations to meet specifications.

MEM30219.name: Perform general machining
