MEM30219.desc: This unit involves performing general machining operations using machines like lathes, mills, planers, and grinders. It includes determining job requirements, selecting and mounting tools, setting machining parameters, and checking components for compliance with specifications.

MEM30219.name: Install machine/plant
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the installation of machinery and plant equipment in industrial settings. It includes planning the installation process, positioning and aligning machinery, connecting services, and testing the installed equipment to ensure operational readiness.

MEM30219.name: Mark off/out (general engineering)
MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to mark off/out general engineering components using appropriate tools and equipment. It involves establishing datum points, transferring dimensions, and performing calculations to ensure accurate marking out in preparation for manufacturing or assembly processes.

MEM30219.name: Use tools for precision work
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain precision tools in engineering tasks. It includes interpreting technical drawings, performing precise measurements, and ensuring components meet exact specifications.

MEM30219.name: Maintain and overhaul mechanical equipment
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves diagnosing faults, performing maintenance, and overhauling mechanical equipment to ensure optimal performance. It encompasses dismantling machinery, repairing or replacing components, and reassembling equipment in accordance with industry standards.

MEM30219.name: Perform fault diagnosis, installation and removal of bearings
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on diagnosing bearing faults, and the installation and removal of bearings in mechanical equipment. It includes selecting appropriate bearings, using correct installation techniques, and ensuring operational efficiency.

MEM30219.name: Dismantle, replace and assemble engineering components
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers dismantling engineering components, identifying faulty parts, selecting replacements, and reassembling components into assemblies or sub-assemblies. It ensures that components function correctly and meet specified tolerances.

MEM30219.name: Perform precision fitting of engineering components
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves fitting engineering components with high precision to meet exact specifications. It includes tasks such as marking out, shaping, and assembling components, ensuring they function seamlessly within mechanical systems.

MEM30219.name: Perform precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components. It involves using appropriate tools and techniques to ensure machinery and components are correctly levelled and aligned to specified tolerances, ensuring optimal performance and longevity.

MEM30219.name: Perform routine gas metal arc welding
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves performing routine gas metal arc welding (GMAW) tasks. It includes preparing materials, setting up welding equipment, and applying GMAW techniques to join materials in accordance with job specifications and safety standards.

MEM30219.name: Shut down and isolate machines/equipment
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the process of safely shutting down and isolating machines and equipment. It includes following standard operating procedures to ensure machinery is correctly de-energised and secured, preventing accidental operation during maintenance or emergency situations.

MEM30219.name: Perform grinding operations
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves performing grinding operations to shape or finish metal components using various grinding machines. It includes selecting appropriate grinding wheels, setting up machines, and applying grinding techniques to achieve required specifications and surface finishes.

MEM30219.name: Perform precision mechanical measurement
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on performing precision mechanical measurements using a range of measuring instruments. It includes selecting and using appropriate measurement tools, interpreting measurements accurately, and ensuring components meet precise specifications.

MEM30219.name: Use workshop machines for basic operations
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to operate workshop machines for basic tasks in a maintenance or jobbing environment. It includes setting up and using machines such as lathes, milling machines, or drilling machines to perform operations like cutting, shaping, or drilling materials according to specifications.

MEM30219.name: Balance equipment
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves balancing rotating or reciprocating equipment to ensure smooth operation and prevent mechanical failures. It includes identifying unbalanced components, selecting appropriate balancing methods, and using balancing equipment to achieve the required balance within specified tolerances.

MEM30219.name: Perform installation and removal of mechanical seals
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on installing and removing mechanical seals in machinery to prevent leakage of fluids. It includes selecting appropriate seals, preparing equipment for seal installation or removal, and ensuring seals are correctly fitted or removed without causing damage to components.

MEM30219.name: Operate as a team member to conduct manufacturing, engineering or related activities
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to work effectively as a team member in manufacturing, engineering, or related environments. It includes communicating with team members, contributing to team objectives, and following established procedures to achieve production or project goals.

MEM30219.name: Order materials
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves ordering materials required for production or maintenance activities. It includes identifying material requirements, selecting appropriate suppliers, placing orders, and ensuring materials are available when needed to support operational needs.

MSF30422.name: Provide First Aid
MSF30422.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to provide a first aid response to a casualty in various situations, including community and workplace settings. It covers recognising and responding to emergencies, applying appropriate first aid procedures, and communicating details of the incident.

MSF30422.name: Cut thin glass by hand
MSF30422.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to cut, shape, and apply finishing techniques to annealed glass up to 8 mm thick and laminated glass up to 8.38 mm thick. It includes interpreting work orders, selecting appropriate tools, and ensuring quality and safety standards are met during manual glass cutting processes.

MSF30422.name: Process glass by basic machines
MSF30422.desc: This unit involves operating basic glass processing machines to cut, edge, drill, or shape glass components as specified in work orders. It includes setting up machines, selecting appropriate tools, and adhering to safety and quality standards throughout the processing activities.

MSF30422.name: Manually move glass
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to manually handle and move glass safely in various work environments. It includes assessing the load, selecting appropriate handling techniques and equipment, and following workplace procedures to minimise the risk of injury or damage.

MSF30422.name: Make measurements and calculations
MSF30422.desc: This unit describes the competency required to perform accurate measurements and calculations relevant to the furnishing industry. It includes selecting and using measuring tools, performing calculations for material requirements, and recording results to ensure precision in work tasks.

MSF30422.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to effectively engage in environmentally sustainable work practices. It includes identifying environmental regulations applicable to the workplace, implementing procedures to support sustainable practices, and seeking opportunities to improve environmental performance.

MSF30422.name: Communicate in the workplace
MSF30422.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge needed to communicate effectively in a work environment. It involves gathering, conveying, and receiving information, as well as carrying out work instructions and reporting operational issues.

MSF30422.name: Work in a team
MSF30422.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work cooperatively with others in a workplace setting. It includes understanding team goals, contributing to team activities, and supporting team members to achieve objectives.

MSF30422.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
MSF30422.desc: This unit specifies the mandatory work health and safety (WHS) training required prior to undertaking construction work. It covers identifying and following WHS policies and procedures, understanding construction hazards, and implementing control measures to prevent injury or illness.

MSF30422.name: Move single glass sheets by mechanical means
MSF30422.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to safely move single glass sheets using mechanical equipment. It includes planning the movement, selecting appropriate equipment, and adhering to safety procedures to prevent damage to the glass and injury to personnel.

MSF30422.name: Glaze and reglaze residential windows and doors
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to glaze and reglaze residential windows and doors. It includes selecting and preparing materials, removing damaged glass, fitting new glass, and ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards.

MSF30422.name: Assess glass and glazing requirements
MSF30422.desc: This unit involves determining and evaluating residential glass and glazing needs against relevant Australian Standards. It encompasses reviewing work documentation, identifying customer requirements, assessing influencing factors, and documenting outcomes to ensure compliance and quality in glazing projects.

MSF30422.name: Install shower screens
MSF30422.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to install shower screens in residential settings. It includes interpreting work orders, selecting appropriate materials and tools, assembling components, and ensuring installations meet safety and quality standards.

MSF30422.name: Install residential windows and doors
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the competencies required to install residential windows and doors. It involves preparing the worksite, selecting and using appropriate tools and materials, installing window and door units, and ensuring installations comply with relevant standards and specifications.

MSF30422.name: Install commercial glazing products
MSF30422.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge necessary to install commercial glazing products. It includes planning and preparing for installation, selecting and using appropriate tools and equipment, installing glazing products in commercial settings, and adhering to safety and quality standards throughout the process.

MSF30422.name: Assemble glazing products
MSF30422.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to assemble components for glazing products. It includes identifying work requirements, preparing materials and work areas, and assembling glazing components according to specifications and safety standards.

MSF30422.name: Read and interpret work documents
MSF30422.desc: This unit describes the competencies needed to accurately read and interpret various work documents within the furnishing industry. It involves identifying key information, understanding design and style features, planning work sequences, and maintaining documentation to ensure tasks are completed as per specifications.

MSF30422.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the application of basic levelling procedures in construction projects. It includes setting up levelling devices, conducting levelling operations, recording measurements, and ensuring accuracy in establishing levels for construction tasks.

MSF30422.name: Work safely on scaffolding higher than two metres
MSF30422.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to work safely on scaffolding at heights greater than two metres. It encompasses understanding safety regulations, identifying hazards, using safety equipment, and following procedures to prevent accidents while working on elevated scaffolding.

MSF30422.name: Estimate and cost job
MSF30422.desc: This unit focuses on developing the ability to estimate materials, labour, and time required for a job, and to calculate associated costs. It includes interpreting job requirements, performing accurate measurements and calculations, and documenting estimates to support effective job costing in the furnishing industry.

MSF30422.name: Manage glass and glazing industry production scheduling
MSF30422.desc: This unit describes the competencies required to manage production scheduling in the glass and glazing industry. It involves planning and coordinating production activities, allocating resources, monitoring progress, and adjusting schedules to meet deadlines and optimise efficiency.

MSF30422.name: Implement and monitor WHS policies, procedures and programs to meet legislative requirements
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the implementation and monitoring of work health and safety (WHS) policies, procedures, and programs in the workplace to ensure compliance with legislative requirements. It includes understanding WHS laws, facilitating consultation processes, identifying hazards, and implementing risk control measures.

MSF30422.name: Prepare to work safely in the construction industry
MSF30422.desc: This unit provides the mandatory work health and safety training required before undertaking construction work. It encompasses understanding legal requirements, identifying construction hazards, using personal protective equipment, and following safety procedures to ensure a safe working environment on construction sites.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle engines
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle engines. It involves identifying and confirming work requirements, preparing for work, diagnosing engine faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle steering systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle steering systems. It includes identifying and confirming work requirements, preparing for work, diagnosing steering system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service petrol fuel systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service petrol fuel systems in vehicles. It includes preparing for the task, inspecting petrol fuel systems, servicing or replacing components as required, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace. It includes selecting and using appropriate tools and equipment, performing routine maintenance, and storing tools and equipment correctly. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service braking systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service braking systems in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the braking system, reporting the inspection findings, servicing and adjusting the braking system, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair spark ignition engine management systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in spark ignition engine management systems of vehicles or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.name: Test, charge, and replace batteries and jump-start vehicles
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to test, charge, and replace batteries, and jump-start vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, testing batteries, charging and replacing batteries, jump-starting vehicles, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle suspension systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle suspension systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing suspension system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle hydraulic braking systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle hydraulic braking systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing hydraulic braking system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.name: Follow environmental and sustainability best practice in an automotive workplace
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service automatic transmissions in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the transmission for leaks, wear, and damage, checking fluid levels and conditions, replacing filters and fluids, performing basic adjustments, and completing workplace processes and documentation. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair charging systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in vehicle charging systems. It involves preparing for the task, testing and diagnosing charging system components such as alternators and voltage regulators, repairing or replacing faulty components, verifying system performance, and completing workplace processes and documentation. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Develop and carry out diagnostic test strategies
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to develop and implement diagnostic test strategies to identify complex faults in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes confirming the existence of faults, conducting systematic diagnostic tests, analysing test results, and developing rectification strategies. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle emission control systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle emission control systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing emission control system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to apply safe working practices in an automotive workplace. It includes identifying and following workplace procedures for hazard identification and risk control, contributing to arrangements for managing occupational health and safety, and completing workplace safety documentation. The unit applies to those working in all sectors of the automotive industry.

AUR30620.name: Test and repair basic electrical circuits
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to test and repair basic electrical circuits in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, testing electrical circuits, repairing faulty circuits, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair starting systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in starting systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing starting system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair ignition systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in ignition systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing ignition system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair cooling systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in cooling systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing cooling system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Carry out servicing operations
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to carry out servicing operations on vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, carrying out routine servicing operations, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service engines
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service engines in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the engine, servicing the engine, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Use and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace. It includes preparing for the task, selecting and using measuring equipment, maintaining measuring equipment, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle manual transmissions
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle manual transmissions. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing manual transmission faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle automatic transmissions
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle automatic transmissions. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing automatic transmission faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle final drive assemblies
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle final drive assemblies. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing final drive assembly faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service steering systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service steering systems in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the steering system for wear and damage, servicing the system, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle drive shafts
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle drive shafts. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing drive shaft faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Remove, inspect, and refit light vehicle wheel and tyre assemblies
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to remove, inspect, and refit wheel and tyre assemblies in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, safely removing wheel and tyre assemblies, inspecting them for wear, damage, and compliance with specifications, performing necessary repairs or replacements, refitting the assemblies, and completing workplace processes and documentation. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service cooling systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service cooling systems in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the cooling system for leaks and component wear, testing coolant concentration and temperature, flushing and refilling the system, and completing workplace processes and documentation. Servicing may include replacing coolants, hoses, and other components as required. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service automatic transmissions
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service automatic transmissions in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the transmission for leaks, wear, and damage, checking fluid levels and conditions, replacing filters and fluids, performing basic adjustments, and completing workplace processes and documentation. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Repair wiring harnesses and looms
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to repair wiring harnesses and looms in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, repairing wiring harnesses and looms, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service suspension systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service suspension systems in vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the suspension system, reporting the inspection findings, servicing and adjusting the suspension system, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.name: Select and use bearings, seals, gaskets, sealants, and adhesives
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to select and use bearings, seals, gaskets, sealants, and adhesives in vehicles. It involves identifying work requirements, selecting appropriate components and materials, using them correctly, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Assemble and fit braking system components
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to assemble and fit braking system components in vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, assembling braking system components, fitting them to the vehicle, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AHC30921.name: Install drainage systems
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to install surface and subsurface drainage systems in various settings, such as agricultural or horticultural environments. This includes tasks like interpreting drainage plans, preparing the site, selecting appropriate materials, installing drainage components, and ensuring the system functions effectively. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols and environmental considerations throughout the installation process.

AHC30921.name: Set out site for construction works
AHC30921.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately set out sites for construction activities. This involves interpreting site plans and specifications, identifying existing site features, marking out proposed construction works, establishing survey benchmarks, and verifying site levels to ensure alignment with project requirements. The unit emphasises the application of mathematical and geometrical principles, the use of appropriate tools and surveying instruments, and adherence to workplace health and safety protocols throughout the site set-out process.

AHC30921.name: Construct brick and block structures and features
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to build brick and block structures in landscaping and construction settings. This includes interpreting site plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting up profiles, applying bonding techniques, cutting bricks or blocks, and ensuring structural integrity. The unit emphasises adherence to Australian standards, workplace health and safety requirements, and environmental considerations throughout the construction process.

AHC30921.name: Construct stone structures and features, and install stone cladding
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to build stone structures and features, as well as to install stone cladding, within landscape project works. This encompasses tasks such as interpreting site plans and specifications, preparing the site, selecting and preparing stone materials, constructing stone structures using various techniques, installing stone cladding, and ensuring the quality of finished work. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the use of appropriate tools and equipment throughout the construction process.

AHC30921.name: Implement a paving project
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to execute paving projects in landscaping and construction contexts. This encompasses interpreting site plans and specifications, preparing the site, selecting and utilising appropriate materials, setting out and excavating the area, installing base and bedding materials, laying pavers in designated patterns, and ensuring proper finishing and quality control. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the paving process.

AHC30921.name: Construct landscape features using concrete
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct concrete structures and features as components of landscape projects. This includes tasks such as interpreting site plans and specifications, preparing the site, setting out and installing formwork, mixing and pouring concrete, applying various finishing techniques, and ensuring the quality of the completed work. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety requirements, environmental considerations, and the proper use of tools and equipment throughout the construction process.

AHC30921.name: Implement a retaining wall project
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to execute retaining wall projects within landscape construction. This involves interpreting site plans and specifications, calculating material and resource requirements, establishing survey benchmarks, excavating to specified soil levels, constructing retaining walls using appropriate tools and equipment, and ensuring the quality of the completed work. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety requirements, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE), and environmental considerations throughout the project implementation.

AHC30921.name: Provide information on plants and their culture
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively communicate plant-related information to clients. This includes identifying client needs, researching and selecting appropriate plant solutions, and conveying cultural requirements such as planting techniques, maintenance practices, and pest management. The unit emphasises the importance of clear communication, attentive listening, and the use of reliable reference materials to ensure clients receive accurate and helpful advice.

AHC30921.name: Implement a plant establishment program
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to establish planting areas in various environments. This includes preparing the site, selecting appropriate plant species, implementing planting techniques, providing post-planting care, and reviewing the establishment process to ensure plant health and growth. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the plant establishment process.

AHC30921.name: Implement soil improvements for garden and turf areas
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to enhance soil quality to support healthy plant growth in garden beds and turf areas. This involves collecting and testing soil samples to assess their physical and chemical characteristics, determining necessary soil improvements, and implementing appropriate treatments to optimise soil conditions. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the soil improvement process.

AHC30921.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to adhere to work health and safety (WHS) protocols within construction settings. This encompasses identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (including asbestos), planning and implementing safe work practices, and responding effectively to emergencies. The unit emphasises compliance with legislative requirements and workplace procedures to ensure personal safety and the safety of others on construction sites.

AHC30921.name: Erect and dismantle formwork for footings and slabs on ground
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct and disassemble formwork for on-ground footings and slabs in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. This involves tasks such as interpreting construction plans, preparing the site, selecting appropriate materials, assembling formwork to specified dimensions, applying release agents, and safely dismantling and storing formwork components post-construction. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the process.

AHC30921.name: Cost a project
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips supervisors and managers with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate and document project costs, including materials, resources, services, consultants, and contractors. This process involves identifying project objectives, determining necessary resources, calculating individual itemised costs, and preparing a comprehensive financial summary for approval. The unit emphasises adherence to organisational guidelines, legislative requirements, and the effective use of appropriate tools and technology throughout the costing process.

AHC30921.name: Maintain roof gardens, vertical gardens and green facades
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively maintain various types of green infrastructure, including roof gardens, vertical gardens, and green facades. This involves tasks such as assessing plant health, implementing appropriate irrigation and fertilisation regimes, managing pests and diseases, and performing routine maintenance to ensure the vitality and aesthetic appeal of these installations. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the use of appropriate tools and equipment throughout the maintenance process.

AHC30921.name: Finish concrete
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply finishing techniques to concrete surfaces to meet job specifications. This includes tasks such as trowelling, floating, and applying surface treatments to achieve the desired finish. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the concrete finishing process.

AHC30921.name: Cure concrete
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform the initial curing process on poured concrete to control moisture evaporation and ensure optimal strength and durability. This involves applying appropriate curing methods and agents in accordance with engineering specifications to maintain the necessary moisture and temperature conditions during the concrete's early stages of setting. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the curing process.

AHC30921.name: Install synthetic textile floor coverings to sports facilities and outdoor spaces
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install synthetic textile floor coverings, such as synthetic turf and needle-punch carpets, in both indoor and outdoor sports facilities and recreational areas. This includes tasks like preparing the subfloor, cutting and laying materials, joining seams, applying adhesives, and finishing the installation to meet specific design and functional requirements. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the installation process.

CPC30620.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively erect and dismantle modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes planning and preparing the work area, selecting and inspecting appropriate equipment, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and repairing scaffolding components, and safely dismantling the scaffolding upon task completion. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and compliance with industry standards to ensure safe and efficient work practices.

CPC30620.name: Work safely at heights
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform tasks at heights on construction sites safely. This includes identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), assessing work areas for potential hazards, and implementing control measures to prevent falls. The unit also covers the correct use of fall protection equipment, safe methods for accessing and traversing work areas at height, and adherence to workplace and regulatory requirements. It is applicable to various construction activities, including new builds, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance work, ensuring that workers can effectively manage the risks associated with working at heights.

CPC30620.name: Operate elevated work platforms up to 11 metres
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs) in various locations, including uneven terrain. This includes tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Calculate costs of construction work
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate and establish costs for construction projects. This includes determining material quantities, labour requirements, timeframes, and overhead expenses to prepare comprehensive cost estimates and client quotations. The unit emphasises adherence to industry standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all costing activities are performed in compliance with workplace and statutory requirements.

CPC30620.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This includes effective teamwork, understanding employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Plan and organise work
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. This includes determining work task outcomes, breaking tasks into component activities, estimating time and personnel requirements, identifying necessary tools and equipment, and preparing a written work plan. The unit also emphasises collaboration with team members to review work plans, schedule tasks, allocate roles and responsibilities, and ensure compliance with work health and safety (WHS) requirements. It is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively within a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, interpreting work instructions, and participating in simple meeting processes. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and effective communication practices are emphasised to ensure clarity and efficiency in workplace interactions.

CPC30620.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform basic measurements and calculations within a construction environment. This includes selecting and using appropriate measuring equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic mathematical formulas to calculate quantities related to weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. The unit also covers converting measurements between metres and millimetres, ensuring precision in determining task and material requirements. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations is emphasised throughout the unit to maintain compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately read and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes understanding key features and functions of various construction drawings, identifying symbols and abbreviations, verifying amendments, and locating key site features from site plans. The unit also covers identifying project requirements such as construction types, dimensions, environmental controls, standards of work, and required materials. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations is emphasised throughout the unit to maintain compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Handle and store painting and decorating materials
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on the essential skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively manage materials used in painting and decorating tasks. This includes understanding the correct procedures for handling, storing, and disposing of various materials to maintain safety standards and ensure the quality of work. The unit is applicable to individuals working in the construction industry, particularly those involved in painting and decorating roles. It emphasises the importance of adhering to safety regulations and environmental considerations when dealing with painting materials.

CPC30620.name: Use painting and decorating tools and equipment
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select, use, store, and maintain a variety of tools and equipment commonly employed in painting and decorating tasks. This includes understanding the functions, limitations, and safe operation methods of both hand and power tools, as well as adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Remove and replace doors and door and window components
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively remove and replace doors, as well as door and window furniture, for painting or replacement purposes. This includes planning and preparing the work area, removing and storing screens and fittings, uninstalling and reinstalling door and window furniture, handling and replacing glass panes, and ensuring all tasks are performed in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Prepare existing coated surface for painting
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to restore, repair, and prepare previously coated surfaces for new paint applications. This involves assessing the condition of existing substrates, performing adhesion tests, selecting appropriate preparation methods, removing unwanted coatings and loose debris, repairing surface defects, and applying suitable primers to achieve a smooth finish ready for painting. The unit emphasises adherence to Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply paint by brush and roller
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply paint coatings to various surfaces using brushes and rollers. This includes preparing the work area and materials, selecting appropriate tools, mixing and matching paint colours, and applying paint to achieve a uniform and quality finish. The unit also covers cleaning up after painting tasks, maintaining tools and equipment, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications to ensure compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply texture coat paint finishes by brush, roller and spray
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply texture coat paint finishes to various surfaces using brushes, rollers, and spray equipment. This includes preparing the work area and materials, selecting and setting up appropriate tools and equipment, mixing and adjusting texture coatings, and applying the finishes to achieve the desired texture and appearance. The unit also covers identifying and rectifying defects in coatings, conducting clean-up activities, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications to ensure compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply paint by spray
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply paint using various spray systems in construction settings. This includes planning and preparing the work area, selecting and setting up appropriate spray equipment, preparing materials, applying paint to achieve an even finish, and conducting clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Match specific paint colours
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to accurately match new and existing paint finishes to specified colour samples. This involves determining the paint type and sheen level, selecting appropriate paint bases and colourants, mixing and testing the paint to achieve the desired colour, and recording the details of the colourants used. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply stains and clear timber finishes
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply stains and clear finishes to timber surfaces, including previously treated timber, to achieve a protective and decorative finish. This involves preparing the work area and materials, staining bare timber, applying clear finishes, and completing clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Erect and maintain trestle and plank systems
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely set up and maintain trestle and plank work platforms commonly used in painting and decorating tasks. This includes planning and preparing the worksite, selecting appropriate equipment, inspecting components for serviceability, correctly positioning trestles and planks to meet Australian standards, and conducting regular inspections to ensure safety and stability during use. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Remove and apply wallpaper
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively remove existing wallpaper and apply new wallpaper to various surfaces. This includes preparing the work area, selecting appropriate tools and materials, removing old wall coverings, preparing surfaces for new wallpaper, and applying wallpaper ensuring an even surface with properly aligned patterns and seams. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply decorative paint finishes
CPC30620.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply various decorative paint finishes to different material surfaces. This includes preparing the application area, applying mirror paint finishes, creating broken colour effects, utilising modern acrylic finishes, performing lining by brush, executing basic stencilling, and implementing basic special effects. The unit also covers the completion of clean-up activities, ensuring all tasks are performed in accordance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental plans, manufacturersâ€™ specifications, and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply protective paint coating systems
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply specialised paint coatings that protect surfaces from atmospheric conditions, sanitation and hygiene risks, and the impacts of high-traffic areas. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, preparing surfaces, applying the protective coating system, and conducting clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Work safely with lead-painted surfaces in the painting industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely identify, manage, and treat lead-based paint hazards in painting and decorating tasks. This includes hazard identification, preparation of the work area, removal or encapsulation of contaminated materials, and completion of clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and compliance with relevant legislation to ensure safe and effective handling of lead-painted surfaces.

CPC30620.name: Prepare uncoated surfaces for painting
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively prepare various uncoated surfaces for painting applications. This involves assessing and testing the condition of substrates, selecting appropriate preparation methods, removing contaminants, and repairing surfaces to achieve a smooth finish ready for painting. The unit emphasises adherence to Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all preparation work meets industry requirements and quality standards.

CPC30620.name: Work safely to encapsulate non-friable asbestos in the painting industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit equips individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to safely manage and encapsulate non-friable asbestos materials encountered during painting and decorating tasks. This involves identifying asbestos-containing materials, selecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), preparing work areas to prevent asbestos disturbance, and applying suitable encapsulation products to seal asbestos fibres effectively. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications to ensure safe and compliant work practices within the painting industry.

CPC30620.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in both on-site and off-site construction environments. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (such as asbestos), planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. The unit emphasises compliance with legislative requirements and workplace policies to ensure personal safety and the safety of others. It is applicable to workers across various sectors within the construction industry and aligns with general construction induction training requirements as specified in the Model Work Health and Safety Regulations 2011.

CPC30620.name: Organise finances for new business ventures
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively manage the financial aspects of establishing a new business. This includes planning financial requirements, identifying funding options, developing budgets, maintaining financial records, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations. The unit emphasises the importance of sound financial management practices to support the viability and growth of new business ventures.

CPC30620.name: Apply trowelled texture coat finishes
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to mix and apply trowelled texture coat finishes to various substrates. This process involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, preparing the substrate, mixing texture coating materials to the designed proportion and consistency, applying the texture coat uniformly using a trowel, and ensuring the finish is plumb and level. The unit also covers curing the texture coat according to weather and temperature conditions, and conducting clean-up activities in compliance with environmental and safety regulations. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturersâ€™ specifications is emphasised to ensure compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC32420.name: Work safely at heights
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to work safely on construction sites where there is a potential to fall from one level to another. This includes identifying task requirements, assessing work areas, selecting and using appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), and implementing fall protection measures. Competency in this unit is essential for construction workers to ensure safety when working at heights, in compliance with Australian safety standards and regulations.

CPC32420.name: Carry out interactive workplace communication
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively engage in interactive communication within the workplace. This includes understanding and applying communication techniques, interpreting and conveying information accurately, and participating in discussions to achieve work outcomes. Competency in this unit is essential for workers to ensure clear and effective communication, contributing to efficient and safe workplace operations.

CPC32420.name: Read plans, calculate quantities and mark out materials
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to read and interpret construction and plumbing plans and specifications, calculate material quantities, and accurately mark out materials. This includes understanding drawing conventions, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, and applying measurement and calculation principles. Competency in this unit is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure precise material preparation and adherence to project specifications, contributing to efficient and effective construction processes.

CPC32420.name: Work effectively in the plumbing services sector
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform effectively within the plumbing services sector. This includes understanding industry employment conditions, responsibilities, and obligations; complying with relevant legislation, regulations, standards, and codes of practice; and applying specific work health and safety (WHS) requirements. Competency in this unit is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure efficient and safe workplace performance, contributing to overall industry standards and public health and safety.

CPC32420.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to comply with work health and safety (WHS) requirements in the plumbing and services sector. It encompasses identifying and following workplace procedures for hazard identification and risk control, contributing to WHS consultative processes, and responding to incidents.

CPC32420.name: Handle and store plumbing materials
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely handle and store plumbing materials, addressing environmental concerns and associated hazards, including waste disposal. It involves selecting appropriate tools and equipment, ensuring their serviceability, and using personal protective equipment (PPE) correctly. The unit also covers identifying and storing materials to prevent damage and cross-contamination, erecting signage and barricades to isolate stored materials, and safely transporting materials in compliance with safety data sheets (SDS) and regulatory requirements. Additionally, it includes procedures for cleaning up spills, disposing of waste, and maintaining tools and equipment.

CPC32420.name: Use plumbing hand and power tools
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to use commonly used hand and power tools in plumbing work applications. It involves preparing to use these tools by identifying work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements, selecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), and ensuring tools are serviceable and safe. The unit covers the safe and effective use of hand and power tools according to manufacturerâ€™s specifications and workplace procedures, as well as the proper storage and maintenance of tools and equipment after use.

CPC32420.name: Carry out levelling
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to conduct levelling procedures in plumbing work. It encompasses setting up and using levelling devices, recording and interpreting readings, and transferring levels accurately to ensure compliance with project specifications and standards.

CPC32420.name: Cut and join sheet metal
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to cut and join sheet metal in the plumbing and services industry. It involves interpreting job specifications, selecting appropriate materials and tools, accurately marking out and cutting sheet metal, and employing suitable joining techniques to assemble components in compliance with industry standards and safety regulations.

CPC32420.name: Carry out simple concreting and rendering
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to perform minor concreting and rendering tasks in plumbing applications. It encompasses preparing materials, placing and finishing concrete, applying render, and adhering to safety and environmental standards. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively undertake basic concreting and rendering tasks as part of plumbing projects.

CPC32420.name: Work safely on roofs
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work safely on roofing structures. It includes identifying work requirements, preparing for work, installing and using fall prevention systems, and adhering to safety protocols. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely perform tasks on roofs, complying with relevant regulations and standards.

CPC32420.name: Flash penetrations through roofs and walls
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to set out, cut, and flash penetrations through roofs and walls for plumbing installations. It involves interpreting plans, selecting appropriate materials, and applying flashing techniques to ensure watertight and compliant installations. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively manage roof and wall penetrations, maintaining the integrity of structures and adhering to Australian standards.

CPC32420.name: Weld polymer pipes using fusion method
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fusion weld polymer pipes, including polyethylene and polypropylene, for plumbing applications. It encompasses preparing joints, conducting test welds, performing fusion welding, and inspecting completed welds to ensure compliance with Australian standards and manufacturer specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely weld polymer pipes using fusion methods, maintaining the integrity of plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install non-ferrous pressure piping
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install non-ferrous pressure piping, such as copper, in plumbing systems. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting up and using silver brazing equipment, and ensuring installations comply with relevant codes and standards. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install non-ferrous pressure piping systems in accordance with Australian regulations.

CPC32420.name: Prepare simple drawings
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to produce onsite drawings for plumbing services work. It involves identifying key features through consultation and reference to plans, selecting suitable views, and applying standard drawing conventions, including relevant codes and standards, to create simple sketches and drawings. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively prepare clear and accurate 2D plan, schematic, isometric, and sectional drawings, complete with appropriate notations and labelling, for plumbing installations.

CPC32420.name: Locate and clear blockages
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install trench support systems to ensure safety during excavation work. It involves assessing site conditions, selecting appropriate support methods, installing trench supports, and complying with safety regulations to prevent ground collapse. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement trench support measures in accordance with Australian standards.

CPC32420.name: Install stormwater and sub-soil drainage systems and drain work site
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to locate and clear blockages in drainage systems. It involves identifying the location and cause of blockages, selecting and using appropriate tools and equipment, and applying safe and effective methods to remove obstructions. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can maintain the functionality of drainage systems by efficiently resolving blockages in compliance with Australian standards.

CPC32420.name: Install prefabricated inspection openings and inspection chambers
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install prefabricated inspection openings and inspection chambers in new or existing domestic or commercial contexts. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and tools, marking out and excavating sites, installing prefabricated concrete or polymer inspection openings and chambers, and connecting inlet and outlet pipes in compliance with relevant codes, Australian standards, and manufacturerâ€™s specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install inspection openings and chambers, facilitating access for maintenance and inspection of drainage systems.

CPC32420.name: Install prefabricated inspection openings and inspection chambers
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan the layout and install below-ground sanitary drainage systems for sewage and waste discharge from sanitary fixtures to approved connection points in new or existing domestic and commercial structures. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out fixture locations, excavating trenches, fabricating and installing pipework, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install sanitary drainage systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Install on-site domestic wastewater treatment plants and disposal systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install on-site domestic wastewater treatment plants and disposal systems. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out and excavating sites, installing treatment plants and disposal systems, and ensuring compliance with relevant codes, Australian standards, and manufacturerâ€™s specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install on-site domestic wastewater treatment systems, maintaining environmental and public health standards.

CPC32420.name: Plan layout and install vacuum drainage systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan the layout and install vacuum drainage systems for sewage and waste discharge in new or existing domestic and commercial structures. It involves interpreting job specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out levels and heights, installing vacuum drainage pipes, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement vacuum drainage systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install fire hydrant and hose reel systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install fire hydrant and hose reel systems in new or existing structures. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out systems, connecting fire brigade suction and booster arrangements, fitting pipework and supports, installing fire hydrant valves, hose reels, and ancillary equipment, and performing hydrostatic tests to ensure compliance with relevant codes, Australian Standards, and manufacturerâ€™s specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install fire hydrant and hose reel systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of fire protection infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Test and maintain fire hydrant and hose reel installations
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to test and maintain fire hydrant and hose reel installations. It involves conducting routine inspections, identifying and rectifying faults, performing flow and pressure tests, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively maintain the operational readiness and safety of fire hydrant and hose reel systems.

CPC32420.name: Install gas appliance flues
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install gas pressure control equipment in gas systems. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing pressure regulators and associated components, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely manage gas pressure control installations, maintaining the integrity and safety of gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Purge consumer piping
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to purge consumer gas piping systems greater than 0.03 cubic metres (30 litres) in volume. It involves preparing for the purging process, selecting appropriate purging mediums and methods, conducting the purge in accordance with safety protocols, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can safely and effectively remove unwanted gases from consumer piping systems, maintaining system integrity and safety.

CPC32420.name: Disconnect and reconnect Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely disconnect and reconnect Type A gas appliances, such as domestic and light commercial appliances with a gas consumption not exceeding 500 megajoules per hour. It involves preparing for the task, isolating gas and other services, disconnecting and reconnecting appliances, and conducting tests to ensure safe operation in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively manage the disconnection and reconnection of Type A gas appliances, maintaining safety and functionality within gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Calculate and install natural ventilation for Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to calculate and install natural ventilation for Type A gas appliances, ensuring adequate airflow for safe operation. It involves assessing installation sites, determining ventilation requirements based on appliance specifications and relevant standards, and implementing appropriate ventilation solutions. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively design and install natural ventilation systems that comply with Australian standards, maintaining safety and efficiency in gas appliance installations.

CPC32420.name: Size and install consumer gas piping systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install gas sub-meters in consumer gas installations. It involves preparing for the installation, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing sub-meters according to manufacturer specifications, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install gas sub-meters, facilitating accurate measurement and monitoring of gas usage within a property.

CPC32420.name: Install LPG storage of aggregate storage capacity up to 500 litres
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to select, install, and test liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) storage facilities with a capacity up to 500 litres. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing cylinders and associated pipework, conducting tests to ensure system integrity, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely manage LPG storage installations, maintaining safety and functionality within gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Install and commission Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission certified Type A gas appliances, which are domestic and light commercial appliances with a gas consumption not exceeding 500 megajoules per hour. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing appliances, testing for safe operation, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install and commission Type A gas appliances, maintaining safety and functionality within gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Collect and store roof water
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to collect and store roof water, including installing storage tanks and related piping systems. It involves determining site-specific requirements, preparing the worksite, installing inlet connections with appropriate filtration devices, and connecting tank overflows to approved stormwater discharge points, ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install roof drainage systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install roof drainage systems and associated rainwater components. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, fabricating components such as gutters and downpipes, and installing them to ensure effective roof drainage. The unit also covers compliance with relevant Australian Standards, codes, and work health and safety (WHS) requirements.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install external flashings
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install external flashings for roof and ceiling installations. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, measuring and cutting flashings to fit specific angles and profiles, and installing them to ensure weatherproofing and durability. The unit also covers compliance with relevant Australian Standards, codes, and work health and safety (WHS) requirements.

CPC32420.name: Install roof components
