CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install roof components, including flashing penetrations to maintain weatherproofing. It involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturersâ€™ instructions; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation, fixing, and sealing of roofing components. The unit also covers compliance with workplace, work health and safety (WHS), and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Plan the layout of a residential sanitary plumbing system and fabricate and install sanitary stacks
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan the layout of a residential sanitary plumbing system and fabricate and install sanitary stacks for sewage and waste discharge from sanitary fixtures in new or existing domestic structures. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and fittings, setting out fixture locations, fabricating and installing pipework and sanitary stacks, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely plan and install sanitary plumbing systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Install discharge pipes
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install discharge pipes for sanitary fixtures. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out pipework, and installing discharge pipes in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install discharge pipes, maintaining the functionality of sanitary plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Install pre-treatment facilities
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install pre-treatment facilities, such as grease traps, oil arrestors, and trade waste arrestors. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate facilities and materials, setting out the installation site, and installing facilities in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install pre-treatment facilities, maintaining environmental and public health standards.

CPC32420.name: Install sewage pumps
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission sewage pumps. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate pump systems and materials, setting out the installation site, installing and connecting pumps and associated pipework, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install sewage pumps, maintaining the functionality of sanitary plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Set out and install water services
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to set out and install water services for domestic and commercial applications. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, setting out pipework and fixtures, installing water meters, and ensuring installations comply with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install water service systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Install and commission water heating systems and adjust controls and devices
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission various water heating systems, including storage and instantaneous units, and to adjust their controls and devices. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate systems and materials, installing and connecting water heaters, and ensuring safe and efficient operation. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install and maintain water heating systems, providing a reliable hot water supply in compliance with Australian standards and codes.

CPC32420.name: Install water pumpsets
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission water pumpsets, including pressure pumps and submersible pumps. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate pumps and materials, setting out the installation site, installing and connecting pumps, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install water pumpsets, maintaining the integrity and functionality of water supply systems.

CPC32420.name: Install and fit off sanitary fixtures, water services and adjust water service controls
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and connect sanitary fixtures, such as toilets and basins, and to adjust water service controls. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate fixtures and materials, installing and connecting sanitary fixtures and associated pipework, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install sanitary fixtures, providing a functional and compliant plumbing system.

CPC32420.name: Install backflow prevention devices
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission backflow prevention devices. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate devices, installing devices in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes, and conducting tests to ensure their effective operation. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install backflow prevention devices, protecting public health by preventing the contamination of potable water supplies.

CPC32420.name: Install property service
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install property service pipe systems to connect with mains services. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, excavating and installing pipework from the main to the property, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install property service connections, providing a reliable supply of water to a property.

CPC32420.name: Install water pipe systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install various types of water pipe systems, including copper, plastic, and metal pipes. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and joining techniques, and installing pipework in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install water pipe systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Connect and install storage tanks to a domestic water supply
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to connect and install storage tanks to a domestic water supply, including installing pumpsets and associated piping systems. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing tanks and pumps in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes, and ensuring the system operates effectively. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install water storage tanks, providing a reliable water supply in a domestic context.

CPC32420.name: Provide First Aid
CPC32420.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to provide first aid response, life support, and management of casualties, as well as to manage the incident and other first aiders, until the arrival of medical or other assistance. It covers responding to a range of first aid scenarios and performing CPR, including administering first aid to a casualty with a burn, a fracture, or a wound. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively provide immediate medical assistance in a variety of situations, contributing to the health and safety of others.

CPC32420.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely and effectively assemble and disassemble scaffolding systems up to a specified height, typically not exceeding four metres. This includes understanding regulatory requirements, selecting appropriate equipment, conducting risk assessments, and implementing safety measures to ensure a secure working environment. Competency in this unit is essential for construction workers who need to perform tasks at heights within the restricted parameters, ensuring compliance with Australian safety standards and contributing to overall site safety.

CPC32420.name: Weld using metal arc welding equipment
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to weld using metal arc welding equipment in plumbing work. It covers preparing materials and equipment, performing welding tasks, and ensuring quality and safety standards are met. Competency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively and safely carry out welding tasks as part of plumbing operations.

CPC32420.name: Plan layout and install vacuum drainage systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan the layout and install vacuum drainage systems for sewage and waste discharge in new or existing domestic and commercial structures. It involves interpreting job specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out levels and heights, installing vacuum drainage pipes, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement vacuum drainage systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Install residential life safety sprinkler systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install fire hydrant and hose reel systems in various structures. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing pipework and supports, connecting fire hydrant valves and hose reels, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement fire hydrant and hose reel systems, maintaining essential fire protection measures within buildings.

CPC32420.name: Test and maintain fire hydrant and hose reel installations
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install life safety sprinkler systems in residential buildings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing pipework and sprinkler heads, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement residential sprinkler systems, enhancing fire safety within dwellings.

CPC32420.name: Maintain Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to maintain Type A gas appliances, which are domestic and light commercial gas appliances with a gas consumption not exceeding 500 megajoules per hour. It involves conducting routine servicing, diagnosing faults, repairing or replacing components, and ensuring appliances operate safely and efficiently in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively maintain the performance and safety of Type A gas appliances.

CPC32420.name: Install gas sub-meters
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install gas sub-meters in consumer gas installations. It involves preparing for the installation, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing sub-meters according to manufacturer specifications, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install gas sub-meters, facilitating accurate measurement and monitoring of gas usage within a property.

CPC32420.name: Install LPG storage of aggregate storage capacity exceeding 500 litres and less than 8 kilolitres
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) storage systems with an aggregate capacity exceeding 500 litres and less than 8 kilolitres. It involves planning the installation, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, positioning and securing storage containers, installing associated piping and regulators, conducting tests to ensure system integrity, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards, codes, and jurisdictional requirements. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install medium-capacity LPG storage systems, maintaining safety and functionality within gas installations.

CPC32420.name: Design domestic urban irrigation systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to design irrigation systems for domestic urban landscapes. It encompasses assessing site conditions, selecting appropriate irrigation components, and developing system layouts that ensure efficient water distribution tailored to the specific needs of residential gardens and lawns.

CPC32420.name: Set out, install and commission irrigation systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to set out, install, and commission irrigation systems in various settings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing system components, and ensuring the system operates efficiently and effectively through proper testing and commissioning procedures.

CPC32420.name: Install home fire sprinkler systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install home fire sprinkler systems. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing pipework and sprinkler heads, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install home fire sprinkler systems, enhancing fire safety within dwellings.

CPC32620.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on the skills and knowledge required to safely erect and dismantle modular scaffolding systems up to four metres in height. This includes planning the task, selecting appropriate equipment, establishing secure footings, assembling the scaffold in compliance with safety regulations, inspecting for structural integrity, performing necessary repairs or alterations, and safely dismantling the structure. The unit is applicable across various industries and emphasises teamwork and adherence to workplace safety standards.

CPC32620.name: Work safely at heights
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to perform tasks at heights on construction sites, ensuring safety and compliance with regulatory standards. This includes identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), assessing work areas for potential hazards, implementing control measures, and effectively using fall protection systems. The unit also covers safe methods for accessing and exiting work areas, maintaining communication during tasks, and adhering to safe work method statements (SWMS). This competency is essential for workers in various industries where there is a risk of falling from one level to another.

CPC32620.name: Operate elevated work platforms up to 11 metres
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs), such as scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. This includes tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down EWPs in various environments, including uneven terrain. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE), conducting pre-operational checks, and implementing appropriate risk control measures to ensure safe operation during construction activities on residential and commercial work sites.

CPC32620.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to adhere to work health and safety (WHS) protocols within construction environments. This encompasses identifying and assessing potential hazards, recognising hazardous materials such as asbestos, planning and implementing safe work practices, and effectively responding to emergencies. The unit emphasises compliance with legislative requirements and workplace procedures to ensure personal safety and the safety of others on-site. It is fundamental for workers across all sectors of the construction industry, promoting a culture of safety and risk management.

CPC32620.name: Read plans, calculate quantities and mark out materials
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately interpret construction and plumbing plans and specifications. This includes obtaining precise dimensions, calculating material quantities, and marking out materials accordingly. Key tasks involve accessing and understanding relevant documentation, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, determining material types, performing accurate calculations, and ensuring markings align with planned dimensions. This unit is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction sectors, ensuring that materials are prepared and utilised efficiently and accurately in accordance with project requirements.

CPC32620.name: Work effectively in the plumbing services sector
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required for effective workplace performance within the plumbing and services industry. This includes understanding employment conditions, responsibilities, and obligations; accessing relevant legislation, regulations, standards, and codes of practice; and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) requirements. The unit also emphasises the importance of teamwork, quality assurance, and sustainability principles, as well as the identification and pursuit of personal development opportunities. It is essential for professionals in the plumbing services sector to ensure compliance with industry standards and to promote a harmonious and efficient work environment.

CPC32620.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) protocols within plumbing and services work environments. Key components include participating in workplace induction procedures, planning and preparing for safe work practices, identifying and assessing risks, recognising and handling hazardous materials, and consistently applying safe work practices. This unit is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure compliance with legislative requirements and to maintain a safe working environment.

CPC32620.name: Carry out levelling
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan and use levelling equipment effectively within the plumbing and services industry. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications to determine levelling requirements, selecting and verifying the serviceability of appropriate tools and equipment, setting up and operating levelling instruments such as laser levels or automatic levels, and accurately recording and marking levels in accordance with job specifications. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements, ensuring that all tasks are performed safely and in compliance with relevant standards. This competency is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure precise installation and alignment of plumbing systems and components.

CPC32620.name: Cut and join sheet metal
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately cut and join sheet metal components within the plumbing and services industry. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications to determine cutting and joining requirements, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, marking out materials, performing precise cuts, preparing surfaces for joining, and assembling components using suitable fastening and sealing methods. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations, ensuring tasks are performed safely and in compliance with relevant standards. This competency is essential for plumbing professionals involved in fabricating and installing sheet metal components, such as ductwork, roofing elements, and drainage systems.

CPC32620.name: Work safely on roofs
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform tasks on roofing structures safely. This includes identifying work requirements from job plans and specifications, preparing for work by selecting appropriate tools and equipment, installing and using fall prevention systems, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) protocols. The unit emphasises the importance of inspecting fall prevention and arrest equipment for serviceability, installing safety systems according to manufacturer and regulatory requirements, and maintaining a clean work area by dismantling safety systems appropriately. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction industries to ensure safe practices when working at heights.

CPC32620.name: Flash penetrations through roofs and walls
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to set out, cut, and install flashing for penetrations in roofing and wall structures. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications to determine flashing requirements, selecting appropriate materials and tools, accurately marking and cutting penetrations, installing supports, fitting penetrating products, and applying purpose-made or proprietary flashing in compliance with relevant codes and standards. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations, ensuring that all tasks are performed safely and in accordance with regulatory requirements. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction industries to ensure watertight and secure installations where services penetrate building envelopes.

CPC32620.name: Prepare simple drawings
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce onsite drawings for plumbing services work. This includes identifying key features through consultation and reference to plans, selecting suitable views, and applying standard drawing conventions in compliance with relevant codes and standards. The unit also emphasises recording essential information using appropriate symbols and abbreviations, and storing drawings according to organisational procedures. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements is integral throughout the process. This competency is essential for plumbing professionals to effectively communicate technical information and ensure accurate implementation of plumbing services.

CPC32620.name: Select and install roof sheeting and wall cladding
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and install insulation, roof battens, and wall cladding using metallic, non-metallic, or other approved roof covering materials. This includes interpreting job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturerâ€™s instructions to determine installation requirements; ensuring material compatibility with the surrounding environment; calculating material types and quantities; and identifying insulation to meet thermal, acoustic, moisture, and bushfire control requirements. The unit also covers receiving and securing materials, preparing for work by checking equipment and ensuring fall protection systems are in place, and installing roof sheeting and wall cladding with appropriate fastening methods. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations is emphasised throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the construction and plumbing industries to ensure compliant and effective installation of roofing and cladding systems.

CPC32620.name: Collect and store roof water
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install storage tanks and related piping systems for the collection and storage of roof water. This includes determining water storage requirements based on factors such as site rainfall data, roof catchment area, and water consumption needs; planning and preparing for installation by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and installing the storage system by preparing the worksite, setting up tank stands or bases, connecting inlet and overflow systems, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturer instructions. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction industries to ensure effective and compliant roof water harvesting systems.

CPC32620.name: Fabricate and install roof drainage systems
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install components of roof drainage systems, including gutters, downpipes, and associated rainwater products. This encompasses interpreting job specifications and relevant Australian Standards to determine installation requirements, selecting appropriate materials and tools, performing accurate measurements and calculations, fabricating components as per design specifications, and installing them to ensure effective roof drainage. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and roofing industries to ensure compliant and efficient installation of roof drainage systems.

CPC32620.name: Fabricate and install external flashings
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately fabricate and install external flashings in construction settings. This includes interpreting installation requirements from plans and specifications, ensuring material compatibility with the surrounding environment, and adhering to workplace policies, work health and safety (WHS) protocols, and environmental and sustainability requirements. Key tasks involve measuring sites for external flashings, fabricating flashings to comply with relevant standards, and installing them using appropriate fastening and sealing methods. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and roofing industries to ensure effective weatherproofing and structural integrity of buildings.

CPC32620.name: Install roof components
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install various roof components, including flashing penetrations, to maintain weatherproofing. This involves interpreting job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturer instructions to determine installation requirements; selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; preparing the work area by checking for obstructions and relocating battens if necessary; and performing the installation, fixing, and sealing of roofing components to ensure compliance with industry standards. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and roofing industries to ensure effective and compliant installation of roof components.

CPC32620.name: Install roof coverings to curved roof structures
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to set out and install curved roof coverings. This includes tasks such as determining the curvature of the roof, creating design sketches, drawing fabrication patterns, calculating material quantities, and installing the roof covering in accordance with job specifications and relevant Australian Standards. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the roofing and construction industries to ensure the effective and compliant installation of curved roof coverings.

CPC32620.name: Install roof sheets, wall cladding and complex flashings
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install roof sheeting, wall cladding, and complex flashings in construction settings. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and tools, preparing the work area, and installing components in compliance with relevant codes, Australian Standards, and manufacturerâ€™s specifications. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the roofing and construction industries to ensure effective and compliant installation of roofing and cladding systems.

CPC32620.name: Provide First Aid
CPC32620.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to deliver a first aid response in various situations, including community and workplace settings. This encompasses recognising and assessing emergency situations, ensuring personal and bystander safety, assessing casualties, and seeking assistance from emergency services. Key components include performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in accordance with Australian Resuscitation Council (ARC) guidelines, providing first aid following established principles, and effectively communicating incident details to emergency services. The unit also emphasises the importance of respecting casualty privacy and confidentiality, completing necessary documentation, and recognising the potential psychological impacts on rescuers, encouraging seeking help when required. This competency is vital for individuals who may be required to provide a first aid response across a range of situations.

CPC32620.name: Operate personnel and materials hoists
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and efficiently operate hoists designed for transporting people and materials to various heights within multi-storey structures. This encompasses conducting pre-operational checks, operating the hoist in accordance with manufacturer and regulatory requirements, performing shutdown procedures, and carrying out post-operational checks to ensure the equipment's integrity and safety. The unit is essential for workers in the construction industry who are responsible for the vertical movement of personnel and materials on-site, emphasising adherence to safety protocols and effective communication with site personnel.

CPC32620.name: Carry out load slinging of off-site materials
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely sling and move materials from off-site locations to designated positions on construction sites. This includes selecting appropriate lifting gear, inspecting equipment for safety, calculating load weights, applying correct slinging techniques, and effectively communicating with crane operators and other personnel to ensure safe and efficient material handling. The unit is essential for workers involved in the transportation and placement of materials in construction settings, emphasising adherence to safety protocols and regulatory requirements.

CPC32620.name: Cut using oxy-acetylene equipment
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively perform basic cutting of mild steel using oxy-acetylene equipment. This includes tasks such as setting up and adjusting the equipment according to manufacturer guidelines, selecting appropriate tip sizes and cutting pressures, preparing materials by marking out and clamping, and executing cuts to achieve clean results. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE), and compliance with environmental requirements. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and services industry, enabling them to carry out fabrication and installation tasks that involve cutting mild steel components.

CPC30820.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30820.desc: A unit of competency that imparts essential skills and knowledge for individuals entering the construction sector. It focuses on effective teamwork, understanding employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Learners are trained to plan and perform work collaboratively, investigate career development opportunities, and implement sustainable practices on construction sites. This unit is particularly suited for those with basic skills, undertaking routine tasks under the guidance of more experienced workers.

CPC30820.name: Plan and organise work
CPC30820.desc: A unit of competency that imparts essential skills and knowledge for individuals in the construction industry. It focuses on planning and organising basic work tasks on a construction site, including determining work task outcomes, breaking tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and collaborating with team members to allocate roles and responsibilities. This unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30820.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to effectively communicate with others in a construction workplace. It involves gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, ensuring clear understanding among team members. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30820.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. It involves selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate measurements, and using basic formulae to calculate quantities of materials. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can determine task and material requirements accurately, contributing to efficient and precise project execution.

CPC30820.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge necessary to read and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. It includes understanding different types of plans, construction symbols, abbreviations, and legends, as well as identifying key features, boundaries, and existing services on a site. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to accurately comprehend project requirements, facilitating effective communication and execution of construction tasks.

CPC30820.name: Handle roof tiling materials
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the handling of roof tiling materials in preparation for roof tiling tasks. It includes the safe and efficient handling, storage, and distribution of materials such as tiles, battens, and underlays on-site. Achieving competency in this unit ensures that workers can manage roofing materials properly, maintaining safety standards and contributing to the smooth progression of roofing projects.

CPC30820.name: Use roof tiling tools and equipment
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to use tools and equipment essential for roof tiling. It involves selecting, operating, and maintaining tools such as trowels, hammers, and cutting equipment specific to roof tiling tasks. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to perform roof tiling activities effectively, ensuring quality workmanship and adherence to safety protocols.

CPC30820.name: Tile regular roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to tile regular roofs, including preparation, setting out, and installation of tiles on straightforward roof structures. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively tile standard roof designs, adhering to industry standards and safety protocols.

CPC30820.name: Tile irregular roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit involves tiling irregular roofs, focusing on complex roof structures with non-standard features. It includes interpreting plans, setting out, and installing tiles on roofs with unique shapes or angles. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to handle challenging roofing projects, ensuring quality workmanship on intricate designs.

CPC30820.name: Repair and replace valleys, valley irons and flashings
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to repair and replace valley sections and flashings on tiled roofs. It encompasses preparing the work area, removing damaged components, and installing new valleys, valley irons, and flashings to restore roof integrity. Competence in this unit ensures that workers can maintain and repair critical roof elements, preventing leaks and structural issues.

CPC30820.name: Repair and renovate tile roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers repairing and renovating tiled roofs, including identifying defects, removing damaged tiles, and installing replacements to restore the roof's condition. It also involves cleaning and applying protective treatments as needed. Achieving competency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively extend the lifespan and functionality of tiled roofing systems.

CPC30820.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to adhere to work health and safety (WHS) requirements in the construction industry. It involves identifying and assessing risks, handling hazardous materials appropriately, planning and preparing for safe work practices, and following emergency procedures. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can maintain a safe working environment by complying with WHS policies and procedures.

CPC30820.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements in a plumbing and services work environment. It includes participating in workplace induction procedures, planning and preparing for safe work practices, identifying and assessing risks, handling hazardous materials, and applying safe work practices. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plumbing workers can effectively carry out WHS requirements, contributing to overall workplace safety.

CPC30820.name: Work safely on roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work safely on roofs. It involves identifying work requirements, planning and preparing for safe work practices, accessing roofs safely, and completing work tasks while adhering to safety protocols. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can perform tasks on roofs without compromising their safety or the safety of others.

CPC30820.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC30820.desc: A unit of competency within the Business Services Training Package. This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to identify and evaluate potential business opportunities. It covers areas such as researching market needs, analysing competitors, assessing financial viability, and understanding regulatory requirements. By completing this unit, learners develop the ability to make informed decisions about the feasibility and potential success of new business ventures.

CPC30820.name: Apply protective paint coating systems
CPC30820.desc: This unit involves the application of protective paint coating systems to various surfaces. It encompasses preparing surfaces, selecting appropriate materials, and applying coatings according to specifications to protect surfaces from environmental factors and wear. Competence in this unit ensures that workers can enhance the durability and appearance of structures through proper application of protective coatings.

CPC30820.name: Slate a roof
CPC30820.desc: This unit involves slating a roof, focusing on the installation of slate tiles to create a durable and aesthetically pleasing roof covering. It includes selecting appropriate materials, setting out, and fixing slate tiles according to specifications. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to execute slate roofing projects, ensuring high-quality finishes that meet industry standards.

CPC30120.name: Use carpentry tools and equipment
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely select and use carpentry tools and equipment, including hand tools, power tools, pneumatic tools, and plant equipment. It covers planning and preparation, selecting and using tools and equipment, and cleaning up, ensuring compliance with work health and safety (WHS) requirements and manufacturers' recommendations.

CPC30120.name: Identify and apply information in construction plans, drawings and specifications
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves interpreting and applying information from construction plans, drawings, and specifications to ensure accurate and efficient construction processes. It includes understanding symbols, terminology, and dimensions, and applying this knowledge to construction tasks.

CPC30120.name: Process materials to produce components using static machines
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to use static machines for manufacturing processes of components, meeting all relevant requirements of Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS), and Commonwealth and state or territory legislation. It includes planning and preparing, operating machines, and cleaning up, ensuring compliance with safety and operational procedures.

CPC30120.name: Carry out levelling operations
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the outcomes required to carry out levelling operations, using the rise and fall method and the height of collimation method, to establish correct and accurate set-out of buildings and components. It includes setting up, testing, and using levelling devices, and undertaking closed and open traverses using a range of levelling equipment.

CPC30120.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the outcomes required to carry out work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in all on- or off-site construction workplaces. It requires the performance of work in a safe manner through awareness of risks and work requirements, and the planning and performance of safe work practices with concern for personal safety and the safety of others.

CPC30120.name: Fabricate shopfitting components using CNC machines
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) machines to fabricate components for shopfitting. It includes interpreting technical drawings, setting up and operating CNC machinery, and ensuring the quality and accuracy of fabricated components. This unit is essential for shopfitters who utilise CNC technology in the production of shopfitting elements.

CPC30120.name: Fabricate and assemble shopfront structures
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and assemble shopfront structures, including bulkheads and shopfront openings. It involves interpreting shopfitting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, and assembling components to form the shopfront structure. This unit is crucial for shopfitters involved in the construction of shopfronts.

CPC30120.name: Assemble and install shopfront structures
CPC30120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to assemble and install shopfront structures, including internal and external prefabricated components, sections, and fittings. It involves assembling components, raising and bracing the shopfront structure, and installing doors and glazing. This unit is vital for shopfitters responsible for the installation of shopfronts.

CPC30120.name: Assemble internal shopfitting units and prepare for transport
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to assemble internal shopfitting units and prepare them for transport. It includes assembling components, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the units, and preparing them for safe transport to the installation site. This unit is essential for shopfitters involved in the assembly and transportation of internal shopfitting units.

CPC30120.name: Apply and trim decorative additions to shopfittings and components
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to apply and trim decorative additions to shopfittings and components. It includes selecting appropriate materials, applying decorative finishes, and trimming additions to achieve the desired aesthetic. This unit is important for shopfitters who enhance the visual appeal of shopfittings through decorative additions.

CPC30120.name: Install prefabricated internal shopfitting units
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to install prefabricated internal shopfitting units on-site. It includes interpreting shopfitting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, and installing components to form the internal shopfitting units. This unit is essential for shopfitters responsible for the installation of prefabricated internal units.

CPC30120.name: Install internal shop walls and fixtures
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install internal shop walls and fixtures, including framing, lining, and associated fixtures. It involves setting out and constructing internal wall framing, installing linings and fixtures, and ensuring the quality and accuracy of the installation. This unit is crucial for shopfitters involved in the construction of internal shop walls and fixtures.

CPC30120.name: Prepare shopfittings and surfaces and apply liquid finishes
CPC30120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to prepare shopfittings and surfaces and apply liquid finishes. It includes preparing surfaces of shop doors, windows, walls, ceilings, partitions, and shopfittings, and applying a range of liquid finishes to achieve the desired aesthetic. This unit is vital for shopfitters who enhance the visual appeal of shopfittings through liquid finishes.

CPC30120.name: Demolish shopfronts and bulkheads
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to demolish shopfronts and bulkheads. It involves planning and preparing for demolition, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, and safely dismantling shopfronts and bulkheads. This unit is essential for shopfitters involved in the demolition of shopfronts and bulkheads.

CPC30120.name: Prepare shop floors for new coverings
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to prepare shop floors for new coverings. It includes removing existing floor coverings, selecting appropriate materials, and preparing the floor surface to ensure the successful application of new coverings. This unit is crucial for shopfitters responsible for floor preparation in shopfitting projects.

CPC30120.name: Install commercial glazing products
CPC30120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to install commercial glazing products. It includes identifying work requirements, preparing materials, and installing glazing products in commercial settings. This unit is essential for professionals involved in the installation of commercial glazing.

CPC30120.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage finances for new business ventures. It includes developing financial strategies, producing financial projections, and managing business assets and financial capital to support business goals. This unit is vital for individuals responsible for financial management in new business ventures.

CPC30120.name: Work safely on scaffolding higher than two metres
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the outcomes required to work safely on construction sites where the work activity involves working above two metres from ground level and where fall protection measures are required. It covers safe methods for accessing the work site and safe methods of moving or passing tools, equipment, and materials to heights above two metres. This unit is essential for workers who perform tasks on scaffolding higher than two metres.

CPC31020.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform fundamental levelling tasks in construction settings. This includes setting up and using levelling devices, taking accurate measurements, and transferring levels to ensure structures are correctly aligned. Proficiency in this unit is essential for maintaining the accuracy and quality of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31020.desc: Provides individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to four metres in height. This includes the placement of safety barriers and the application of appropriate handling techniques for various scaffolding components. Proficiency in this unit is essential for workers across various industries to ensure safe and effective use of restricted height scaffolding in compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

CPC31020.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to operate efficiently within the construction sector. This includes understanding team roles and responsibilities, planning and executing tasks collaboratively, exploring career pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC31020.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate basic tasks on a construction site. This involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and collaborating with team members to allocate roles and responsibilities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction activities are carried out efficiently, safely, and in compliance with workplace standards.

CPC31020.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively in a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, accessing and interpreting information from various sources, preparing and presenting basic reports, and participating in simple meeting processes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can interact efficiently with colleagues, follow instructions accurately, and contribute constructively to workplace discussions, thereby enhancing overall productivity and safety on construction sites.

CPC31020.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic formulas to calculate weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed with precision, contributing to the overall efficiency and quality of building projects.

CPC31020.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to understand and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes identifying key features and functions of various types of construction drawings, understanding legends, symbols, and abbreviations, and extracting essential information such as site locations, dimensions, materials, and environmental requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are carried out accurately and in compliance with project requirements.

CPC31020.name: Handle solid plastering materials
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively manage solid plastering materials on construction sites. This includes planning and preparing for material handling, sorting and storing materials appropriately, and removing materials while adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plastering tasks are conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with environmental and workplace standards.

CPC31020.name: Use solid plastering tools and equipment
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely select, check, use, and store tools and equipment for solid plastering tasks. This includes understanding the functions and limitations of various hand and power tools, conducting pre-operational checks, following start-up and shut-down procedures, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that solid plastering tasks are performed efficiently and safely, contributing to the quality and integrity of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Prepare surfaces for plastering
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare various substrates for solid plastering applications. This includes planning and organising work, identifying and removing hazards or obstructions, selecting and setting up appropriate tools, and performing tasks such as sanding, grinding, patching, levelling, packing, filling, and finishing surfaces to ensure they are ready for plastering. Proficiency in this unit ensures that surfaces are adequately prepared, contributing to the quality and durability of plastering work.

CPC31020.name: Apply float and render to straight and curved surfaces
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to float, render, and finish both flat and curved solid plastering work. This includes planning and preparing work areas, manufacturing templates for curved work or circular columns, preparing background surfaces, applying floating and rendering coats to flat and curved surfaces as well as piers, and finishing rendering coats to achieve specified alignment and quality standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plastering tasks are executed accurately, contributing to the overall quality and durability of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Apply set coats
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to mix and apply plaster setting coats to both flat and curved solid plaster backgrounds. This process involves planning and preparing work areas, selecting appropriate mix ratios for plaster and lime, preparing background surfaces, applying set coats in accordance with relevant standards and specifications, and finishing the surface to achieve a hard, smooth finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plastering tasks are executed accurately, contributing to the overall quality and durability of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Apply trowelled texture coat finishes
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to mix and apply trowelled texture coatings to various surfaces. This process involves preparing substrates, selecting and mixing texture coating materials to the desired consistency, and applying the texture coat uniformly using a trowel to achieve the specified thickness and finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that textured finishes are applied accurately, enhancing the aesthetic appeal and durability of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Restore and renovate solid plasterwork
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to repair and refurbish lime mortar cement render and solid plaster surfaces. This includes planning and preparing for restoration work, selecting appropriate materials and tools, and applying techniques to address damage or deterioration in plastered surfaces. Proficiency in this unit ensures that restoration tasks are executed accurately, contributing to the preservation and enhancement of existing structures.

CPC31020.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) practices in construction settings. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials such as asbestos, planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction activities are conducted safely, in compliance with legislative requirements, and with due regard for personal and communal well-being.

CPC31020.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify and evaluate potential business ventures. This involves sourcing and analysing market information, identifying products or services that align with business ideas, assessing market needs and trends, and understanding the legislative frameworks affecting the business. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can conduct thorough research to determine the viability of business opportunities, facilitating informed decision-making in entrepreneurial endeavours.

CPC31020.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. This includes producing financial budgets or projections, developing plans to manage business capital, ensuring adequate financial provision for taxation, and selecting key performance indicators to monitor financial performance. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively manage the financial aspects of a new business, contributing to its overall success and sustainability.

CPC31020.name: Operate elevated work platforms to 11 metres
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs), such as scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. This includes tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down EWPs in various environments, including uneven terrain. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform elevated tasks safely, adhering to industry standards and regulations.

CPC31020.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other straightforward constructions. This includes tasks such as preparing the substrate, erecting and stripping formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, and applying concrete to achieve the specified design finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed accurately and in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations.

CPC31020.name: Erect and maintain trestle and plank systems
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely set up, inspect, and maintain trestle and plank work platforms commonly used in construction tasks such as plastering and painting. This involves planning and preparing the worksite, selecting appropriate equipment, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards (e.g., AS 4576:2020), and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively and safely utilise trestle and plank systems, contributing to the overall safety and efficiency of construction projects.

AUR50216.name: Develop and document specifications and procedures
AUR50216.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to develop, document, and implement technical specifications and standard operating procedures for automotive tasks, ensuring consistency, quality, and compliance.

AUR50216.name: Conduct research and present technical reports
AUR50216.desc: This unit covers the skills to conduct research on automotive technical issues and present the findings in clear, concise technical reports. It includes gathering information from various sources and structuring a formal report.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in electronic over hydraulic systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit describes the advanced skills to analyse and evaluate complex electrical and electronic faults in electronic-over-hydraulic systems, commonly found in heavy vehicles and machinery.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in body management systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit involves the skills to analyse and evaluate complex electrical and electronic faults in modern vehicle body control systems, such as lighting, access, and security systems.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in monitoring and protection systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit covers the advanced diagnosis of faults in vehicle monitoring and protection systems, including driver warning systems and integrated safety features.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in convenience and entertainment systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit describes the skills to analyse and evaluate complex faults in vehicle convenience and entertainment systems, such as climate control, audio-visual, and navigation systems.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in theft-deterrent systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit involves the specialist skills to diagnose and evaluate faults in complex electronic theft-deterrent and immobiliser systems.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in air conditioning and HVAC systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit covers the advanced diagnosis of electrical and electronic faults within modern, electronically controlled air conditioning and HVAC systems.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in dynamic control management systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit specifies the skills to analyse and evaluate complex faults in vehicle dynamic control systems, including electronic stability control (ESC), anti-lock braking (ABS), and traction control (TCS).

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in engine management systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit involves the advanced skills required to analyse, evaluate, and diagnose complex faults within modern electronic engine management systems.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in HEV and BEV management systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit covers the specialist, advanced skills to analyse and evaluate complex electrical and electronic faults in the high voltage and control systems of hybrid and battery electric vehicles (HEV/BEV).

AUR50216.name: Develop and apply network electronic control system modifications
AUR50216.desc: This unit describes the high-level skills to develop and apply modifications to vehicle electronic network control systems, such as CAN bus systems.

AUR50216.name: Develop and apply electrical system modifications
AUR50216.desc: This unit involves the skills to design, develop, and apply modifications to a vehicle's electrical systems, including integrating new components and circuits.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate electrical and electronic faults in driveline management systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit covers the advanced diagnosis of electrical and electronic faults in driveline management systems, including electronically controlled transmissions and differentials.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate faults in light vehicle braking systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit describes the skills to analyse and evaluate complex faults in the braking systems of light vehicles, beyond standard diagnostic procedures.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate faults in light vehicle steering and suspension systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit involves the advanced analysis and evaluation of complex faults in light vehicle steering and suspension systems, including electronic power steering and adaptive suspension.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate faults in light vehicle engine and fuel systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit covers the advanced skills to analyse and evaluate complex performance and drivability faults in light vehicle engines and their fuel systems.

AUR50216.name: Analyse and evaluate faults in light vehicle transmission and driveline systems
AUR50216.desc: This unit describes the skills to analyse and evaluate complex faults within the transmission and driveline systems of light vehicles.

AUR50216.name: Estimate and quote automotive vehicle or machinery modifications
AUR50216.desc: This unit involves the skills to estimate the costs and prepare quotations for carrying out modifications to automotive vehicles or machinery.

AUR50216.name: Develop and apply mechanical system modifications
AUR50216.desc: This unit covers the high-level skills to design, develop, and apply modifications to a vehicle's mechanical systems, ensuring safety and performance.

AUR50216.name: Implement and monitor environmentally sustainable work practices
AUR50216.desc: This unit specifies the competency to effectively implement and monitor environmentally sustainable work practices and procedures within a workplace.

CPC31220.name: Construct and install bulkheads
CPC31220.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to construct bulkheads for decorative purposes, to contain fittings such as range hoods and cupboards, to conceal services, and to facilitate changes in ceiling heights, all in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and Australian Standards. It encompasses tasks such as preparing for sheeting bulkheads with various materials, setting out and fabricating bulkhead components, and installing both fabricated and pre-manufactured bulkheads. The unit is essential for individuals aiming to perform carpentry tasks involving bulkhead construction and installation in both residential and commercial settings.

CPC31220.name: Assemble partitions
CPC31220.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to set out and assemble partitions for dividing areas into usable spaces. This includes working with prefabricated and demountable partitions made of timber or metal, ensuring compliance with national construction codes, Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve planning and preparation, setting out and cutting components, assembling partitions to specified measurements, and adhering to safety and environmental requirements.

CPC31220.name: Work safely at heights
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform tasks at heights on construction sites, mitigating the risk of falls from one level to another. This encompasses identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) and fall protection systems, assessing work areas for potential hazards, and implementing control measures to ensure safety. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace and regulatory requirements, including the development and application of safe work method statements (SWMS), and is applicable across various construction activities such as new builds, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance.

CPC31220.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This encompasses understanding the construction industry's scope and employment conditions, planning and prioritising work activities, collaborating effectively within a team, identifying personal learning needs for career development, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit emphasises safe work practices, effective communication, and continuous improvement to enhance individual and team performance in various construction contexts.

CPC31220.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate basic work tasks on a construction site. This involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into component activities, estimating time and resources, identifying necessary tools and equipment, and preparing a comprehensive work plan. Additionally, it emphasises collaboration with team members to review plans, schedule work, allocate roles, and ensure adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements. This unit is suitable for individuals undertaking routine tasks under the direction of more experienced workers and is applicable across various construction contexts.

CPC31220.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively within a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, participating in simple meeting processes, and utilising visual communication techniques. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC31220.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations essential for determining task and material requirements in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic formulas to calculate weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. Additionally, it involves converting measurements between metres and millimetres, ensuring accuracy in calculations, and recording results systematically. This unit is applicable to individuals working under supervision in various construction contexts, emphasising the importance of precise measurements and calculations in successful project execution.

CPC31220.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to understand and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes identifying key features and functions of various types of construction drawings, understanding symbols and abbreviations, verifying the inclusion of the latest amendments, and locating existing services, key features, and boundaries on a site plan. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC31220.name: Fix standard plasterboard wall sheets
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install standard plasterboard wall sheets in accordance with manufacturers' and job specifications. This includes preparing the work area, selecting and preparing materials, measuring and cutting plasterboard sheets, and fixing them to wall frames using appropriate adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet the required levels of finish and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix standard plasterboard ceiling sheets
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install standard plasterboard ceiling sheets in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting and preparing materials, measuring and cutting plasterboard sheets, and securely fixing them to ceiling frames or furring channels using appropriate adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet the required levels of finish and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix battens
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install battens in preparation for lining systems in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, measuring and cutting battens to specified dimensions, and securely fixing them to substrates using suitable fasteners and techniques. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet project specifications and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix wet area sheets
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install wet area sheets in compliance with manufacturer and job specifications. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and cutting sheets, and securely fixing them to designated surfaces in wet areas such as bathrooms and laundries. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations are watertight and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix ceiling sheets to external protected areas
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install ceiling sheets in external protected environments, such as under eaves or verandas. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and cutting ceiling sheets, and securely fixing them to ceiling frames or structures using suitable adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations are durable and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix fibre cement board
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install fibre cement boards in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and cutting fibre cement boards, and securely fixing them to designated surfaces using suitable adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Apply levels of finish standards to planning and inspection of own work
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply industry standards for levels of finish when planning and inspecting their plastering work. This involves understanding and interpreting the relevant standards, assessing surface quality, selecting appropriate finishing techniques, and ensuring that the completed work meets the specified level of finish. The unit emphasises attention to detail, quality control, and adherence to industry best practices to achieve the desired outcomes in plastering projects.

CPC31220.name: Mix plastering compounds
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare various plastering compounds used in wall and ceiling lining applications. This involves selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and combining components, and mixing them to the correct consistency as specified by manufacturers' guidelines. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that the prepared compounds are suitable for their intended application and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Finish plasterboard joints manually
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to manually finish plasterboard joints to a standard ready for decoration. This involves preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, applying jointing compounds and tapes, and finishing joints to achieve a smooth, seamless surface. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that the finished work meets industry requirements and is suitable for subsequent painting or finishing.

CPC31220.name: Manually sand plaster work
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to hand sand joints in plaster walls, ceilings, and cornices to achieve a smooth finish suitable for decoration. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate tools and personal protective equipment (PPE), ensuring joints are dry and fully cured, and meticulously sanding plaster surfaces to the specified level of finish without over-sanding.
