The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that the completed work meets industry requirements and is ready for subsequent painting or finishing.

CPC31220.name: Cut and fix paper-faced cornices
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately cut and install paper-faced cornices in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, measuring and cutting cornices to precise angles, and securely fixing them to plasterboard surfaces using suitable adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations are seamless and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Install dry wall passive fire-rated systems
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and install dry wall fire-rated systems to walls and ceilings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, and installing fire-rated systems in compliance with manufacturer specifications and the National Construction Code (NCC). The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet the required fire-rating criteria and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Install suspended ceilings
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install both exposed and concealed suspended ceiling systems in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, setting out ceiling grids and alignment levels, fixing suspension rods to structural members, assembling and securing the suspended framework, and installing lining materials according to design specifications. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations comply with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and workplace requirements.

CPC31220.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) practices in construction settings. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials such as asbestos, planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction activities are conducted safely, in compliance with legislative requirements, and with due regard for personal and communal well-being.

CPC31220.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC31220.desc: A unit of competency within the Business Services Training Package (BSB). This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to identify, research, and evaluate potential business opportunities. It covers areas such as analysing market needs, assessing financial viability, understanding regulatory requirements, and considering potential risks. The unit is designed for those aiming to establish or expand a small business, enabling them to make informed decisions about the feasibility and potential success of new business ventures.

CPC31220.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC31220.desc: A unit of competency within the Business Services Training Package (BSB). This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. Key areas covered include developing financial budgets and projections, managing business capital, ensuring compliance with taxation requirements, and monitoring financial performance using key performance indicators (KPIs). The unit also emphasises the use of new and emerging digital technologies to enhance business profitability. It is particularly relevant for those establishing a business for self-employment or initiating a new venture within a larger organisation.

CPC31220.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills to perform levelling tasks in a single plane, essential for accurately setting out building components. This encompasses the setup, testing, and utilisation of various levelling devices, as well as the establishment and transfer of heights using appropriate equipment. The unit is pertinent to construction industry workers engaged in residential and commercial projects, emphasising adherence to safety protocols, accurate measurement techniques, and effective communication within a team environment.

CPC31220.name: Use explosive power tools
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate explosive power tools (EPTs) that utilise explosive charges to fasten materials or fix fasteners to bases. This includes understanding the functions, operations, and limitations of EPTs, selecting appropriate charges and fasteners, adhering to safety protocols, and performing maintenance tasks. The unit is applicable to workers in the construction industry and emphasises compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental requirements.

CPC31220.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to four metres in height. This includes planning and preparing for scaffolding tasks, establishing secure footings, erecting scaffolding in compliance with safety regulations, inspecting for structural integrity, performing necessary repairs or alterations, and dismantling the scaffolding upon task completion. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, environmental considerations, and effective teamwork within various industries.

CPC31220.name: Rectify faults in drywall applications
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify and rectify faults in drywall installations. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate tools and materials, assessing and diagnosing faults such as board fractures, joint imperfections, or surface irregularities, and implementing effective rectification methods to restore the drywall to the specified level of finish. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all remedial work complies with relevant codes and industry best practices.

CPC31220.name: Complete penetrations and flashings
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to execute penetrations and install flashings associated with wall and ceiling linings. This includes planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, creating penetrations safely with minimal modification or damage to host materials, installing flashings, and applying sealants or caulking compounds to restore the integrity of wall or ceiling systems. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all work complies with relevant Australian Standards and regulatory requirements.

CPC31320.name: Apply waterproofing for wall and floor tiling
CPC31320.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively apply waterproofing systems in preparation for wall and floor tiling. This includes understanding the selection and application of appropriate waterproofing materials, ensuring compliance with relevant standards and regulations, and preparing surfaces to receive waterproofing membranes. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can prevent water ingress, thereby enhancing the durability and integrity of tiled surfaces.

CPC31320.name: Prepare surfaces for tiling application
CPC31320.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to repair and prepare various substrates for wall and floor tiling. This includes tasks such as cleaning surfaces to remove contaminants, installing underlay for framed substrates, controlling suction in cementitious and masonry substrates, and applying screeding or rendering to achieve the necessary surface finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively prepare different surfaces, facilitating the successful application of tiles in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Install mosaic tiling
CPC31320.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install mosaic tiles on both flat and curved surfaces. This includes tasks such as checking that mosaic tiles conform to the specified size, pattern, colour, and characteristics; setting out mosaic work to be symmetrical and balanced while minimizing waste; preparing substrate surfaces by cleaning them of loose material and contaminants; and installing mosaic tiles to achieve a quality finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively execute mosaic tiling projects in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic formulas to calculate weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can accurately determine task and material requirements, facilitating efficient and precise project execution.

CPC31320.name: Install floor tiles
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install floor tiles across various substrates in both residential and commercial settings. This includes tasks such as preparing the work area, selecting and using appropriate tools and materials, setting out tiles to ensure symmetry and alignment, cutting tiles to fit around obstacles, and applying adhesives and grouts to achieve a high-quality finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can execute floor tiling projects that meet industry standards and client expectations.

CPC31320.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to accurately understand construction drawings and documents. This includes identifying key features and functions of various types of plans, understanding construction symbols and abbreviations, verifying the latest amendments, and locating existing services, key features, and boundaries on a site plan. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can effectively interpret project requirements, facilitating accurate and efficient execution of construction tasks in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Install wall tiles
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install wall tiles on various substrates in both residential and commercial settings. This includes tasks such as preparing the work area, selecting and using appropriate tools and materials, setting out tiles to ensure symmetry and alignment, cutting tiles to fit around obstacles, and applying adhesives and grouts to achieve a high-quality finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can execute wall tiling projects that meet industry standards and client expectations.

CPC31320.name: Use wall and floor tiling tools and equipment
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively select, operate, and maintain tools and equipment specific to wall and floor tiling tasks. This includes understanding the functions and limitations of various hand and power tools, performing pre-operational checks, adhering to safety protocols, and ensuring proper cleaning and storage after use. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can proficiently handle the necessary tools and equipment, contributing to the quality and efficiency of tiling projects.

CPC31320.name: Tile curved surfaces
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to tile curved surfaces on solid and sheet substrates using mortar or adhesive. This includes preparing for and tiling curved wall and floor surfaces, columns, circular walls, and arches. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively execute tiling projects involving curved surfaces in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Install decorative tiling
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, set out, and install decorative tiling projects that form specific patterns. This includes tasks such as interpreting design specifications, selecting appropriate materials, preparing substrates, cutting tiles to precise dimensions, and aligning tile joints to achieve the desired decorative effect. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can execute intricate decorative tiling installations in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively with other workers in a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms of communication, accessing and interpreting basic information from various sources, preparing and presenting basic reports, and participating in simple meeting processes. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can effectively exchange information, follow instructions, and contribute to workplace discussions, thereby enhancing collaboration and productivity on-site.

CPC31320.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate basic work tasks on a construction site. This involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into manageable components, estimating time and resource needs, and collaborating with team members to allocate roles and responsibilities. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can execute tasks efficiently, adhere to work health and safety (WHS) standards, and contribute to the successful completion of construction projects.

CPC31320.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish accurate set-out of building components. This includes setting up, testing, and using levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using various levelling equipment. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform levelling tasks on residential and commercial work sites, contributing to precise construction and compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Handle wall and floor tiling materials
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely handle and store wall and floor tiling products and materials. This includes tasks such as preparing, handling, sorting, stacking, distributing, and disposing of tiling materials in accordance with safety data sheets and workplace requirements. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can manage tiling materials efficiently, contributing to the smooth execution of tiling projects and adherence to industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in both on-site and off-site construction environments. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognizing hazardous materials (such as asbestos), planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform tasks safely, with an emphasis on personal safety and the safety of others, in compliance with legislative requirements and workplace policies.

CPC31320.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This encompasses planning and prioritizing work activities, collaborating effectively with team members, understanding various construction job roles and employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can contribute positively to team objectives, pursue continuous personal development, and implement sustainable work practices in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Repair wall and floor tiling
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to replace damaged wall and floor tiles. This includes tasks such as removing defective tiles without harming adjacent areas, preparing surfaces for new tile installation, selecting matching replacement tiles, and installing them to maintain alignment and finish consistency. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively perform repair tasks, restoring the integrity and appearance of tiled surfaces in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Work safely at heights
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to operate safely on construction sites where there is a risk of falling from one level to another. This training encompasses hazard identification, selection and use of appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), implementation of fall protection measures, and adherence to safe work procedures. It also includes identifying and reporting common faults with scaffold or work platform systems. This unit is applicable to various construction activities, including new builds, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance tasks, ensuring that workers can effectively manage the risks associated with working at heights.

CPC31320.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other minor works to a specified design finish. This includes tasks such as preparing the subgrade, erecting and stripping formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, and placing and finishing concrete in accordance with project specifications. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can execute basic concreting tasks efficiently and in compliance with industry standards, including the National Construction Code (NCC) and relevant Australian Standards.

CPC31320.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and efficiently assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes tasks such as planning and preparing for scaffolding work, placing safety barriers, selecting and inspecting equipment, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and maintaining scaffolding structures, and safely dismantling and storing equipment after use. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can provide secure work platforms for various construction tasks, adhering to industry standards and contributing to overall site safety.

CPC40120.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 1 and 10 buildings
CPC40120.desc: Equips construction professionals with the skills to access, interpret, and apply relevant building codes and standards as outlined in the National Construction Code (NCC) for Class 1 and 10 buildings up to two storeys. This includes understanding the structure of the NCC and effectively utilizing its information to ensure compliance in various residential construction projects. The unit is essential for builders, site managers, and related professionals responsible for adhering to building codes and standards in residential construction.

CPC40120.name: Manage work health and safety in the building and construction workplace
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively manage workplace health and safety (WHS) within the building and construction industry. This includes conducting thorough workplace inspections to identify potential hazards, performing comprehensive WHS risk analyses, and developing and implementing appropriate responses to mitigate identified risks in compliance with government legislation and regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals, such as builders, site managers, and forepersons, can establish and maintain safe work environments, thereby reducing the likelihood of accidents and promoting overall site safety.

CPC40120.name: Plan building and construction work
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan on-site activities for residential and commercial construction projects. This includes sequencing construction tasks, identifying and organizing necessary human and physical resources, and developing comprehensive project schedules. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can efficiently coordinate operations, manage resources, and prepare essential documentation, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Supervise site communication and administration processes for building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to oversee on-site communications, ensure compliance with quality control standards, and manage administrative processes in construction projects. This includes developing effective communication systems among on-site and off-site personnel, implementing quality control measures, conducting site inspections to monitor work quality, and maintaining comprehensive project records. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively coordinate site activities, uphold industry standards, and facilitate successful project completion.

CPC40120.name: Apply legal requirements to building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to ensure compliance with legal and regulatory obligations in residential and commercial construction projects. This includes understanding and applying relevant legislation, such as licensing and registration requirements, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, building codes, and standards. Additionally, it covers managing contractual obligations, insurance requirements, financial transactions, and industrial relations policies. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively navigate the legal landscape of the construction industry, ensuring projects adhere to all necessary legal standards and obligations.

CPC40120.name: Apply structural principles to residential and commercial constructions
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to interpret and apply structural principles in both residential and commercial building contexts. This includes understanding load-bearing structures, selecting appropriate construction methods, and ensuring compliance with relevant building codes and standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can make informed decisions regarding structural integrity, contributing to the safety and durability of building projects.

CPC40120.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately interpret construction plans and specifications for residential and commercial projects. This includes identifying site characteristics, understanding structural and non-structural details, and comprehending the layout and dimensions of proposed buildings. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively translate two-dimensional plans into three-dimensional understanding, facilitating accurate estimation, planning, and supervision of building projects.

CPC40120.name: Prepare simple building sketches and drawings
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce clear and descriptive sketches and drawings for building and construction projects. This includes capturing design concepts from architectural plans, creating two-dimensional and three-dimensional sketches, and applying standard drawing conventions such as symbols, abbreviations, and notations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively communicate ideas to clients and other stakeholders, facilitating accurate estimations and detailed explanations of construction details and measurements.

CPC40120.name: Apply site surveys and set out procedures to building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately set out buildings on construction sites using technical instruments and levelling and surveying techniques. This includes determining grid levels, developing contour plans, and performing necessary calculations to ensure precise building placement. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively apply site surveys and set-out procedures, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Minimise waste on the building and construction site
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to support sustainable building practices by minimizing waste removed from residential or commercial construction sites. This includes planning a waste minimization strategy, calculating cost benefits, and implementing alternative waste minimization systems. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively manage compliance with waste regulations and adopt environmentally responsible practices, contributing to the sustainability and efficiency of building projects.

CPC40120.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 2 to 9 Type C buildings
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to access, interpret, and apply relevant building codes and standards, specifically the National Construction Code (NCC), to Class 2 to 9 Type C building projects. This includes understanding the structure of the NCC, determining building classifications, ensuring construction compliance with performance requirements, and identifying fire protection requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals, such as builders and site managers, can effectively ensure compliance with building codes and standards, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Select, prepare and administer a construction contract
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to manage contracts for both commercial and residential construction projects. This includes selecting appropriate contract types, preparing comprehensive contract documents, administering contract-related documents, and identifying causes of contract breaches. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively oversee contract negotiations, manage contractual obligations, and ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, contributing to the successful execution of construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Identify and produce estimated costs for building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate costs associated with materials, labor, and other resources in construction projects. This includes interpreting construction drawings and specifications, calculating material quantities, estimating labor hours and costs, identifying physical resource requirements, and compiling comprehensive project cost estimates. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can develop precise cost estimations, facilitating effective budgeting and financial planning for building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Produce labour and material schedules for ordering
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to develop comprehensive schedules for both human resources and materials in residential and commercial construction projects. This involves assessing project requirements, breaking down the project into stages and tasks, itemizing necessary materials and labor, and setting milestones and timeframes for commencement and completion. Additionally, it includes monitoring project costs, maintaining project files, and ensuring effective communication with suppliers and contractors. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can efficiently plan, allocate, and manage resources, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Select, procure and store construction materials for building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to supervise the selection, acquisition, and on-site storage of construction materials for residential and commercial projects. This includes evaluating material properties for suitability, ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and project specifications, and managing procurement processes to secure quality materials. Additionally, it involves overseeing the delivery, handling, and storage of materials on-site to prevent damage and maintain quality. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively manage material resources, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Resolve business disputes
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively manage and resolve disputes that may arise during residential and commercial contracting projects. This includes developing and implementing dispute resolution processes and procedures, evaluating dispute information, negotiating with involved parties, and identifying opportunities for resolution through internal or external means. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals, such as builders and site supervisors, can address conflicts positively, maintaining project continuity and fostering professional relationships.

CPC40120.name: Use building science principles to construct energy efficient buildings
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to apply building science principles in the construction of energy-efficient structures. This involves understanding and implementing strategies related to thermal performance, moisture control, ventilation, and sustainable materials to enhance a building's energy efficiency. By mastering these principles, professionals can contribute to the development of buildings that are not only environmentally friendly but also cost-effective in terms of energy consumption.

CPC40120.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. This includes utilizing new and emerging digital technologies, interpreting financial reports, and analyzing numerical data to make informed financial decisions. Key components involve developing financial budgets or projections, managing business capital, ensuring compliance with taxation requirements, and monitoring financial performance through key performance indicators (KPIs). Proficiency in this unit ensures that entrepreneurs and business managers can effectively oversee the financial aspects of new ventures, contributing to their sustainability and growth.

CPC40120.name: Apply project quality management techniques
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to enhance project outcomes through effective quality management. This includes contributing to quality planning by determining stakeholder requirements and identifying quantifiable criteria for deliverables, applying quality policies and procedures by implementing quality assurance and control measures, and participating in continuous improvement processes to review and enhance project outcomes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that project practitioners can support project managers and teams in maintaining high-quality standards throughout the project lifecycle, thereby contributing to the successful completion of projects.

CPC41020.name: Lead team effectiveness
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to lead teams in a workplace environment. It encompasses planning and supervising team performance to achieve organisational goals and objectives. Key aspects include developing team plans, leading and facilitating teamwork, and actively liaising with management.

CPC41020.name: Manage work health and safety in the building and construction workplace
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage work health and safety (WHS) in building and construction workplaces. It involves inspecting workplaces for hazards, conducting risk analyses, and developing and implementing appropriate responses to mitigate risks, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements and organisational policies.

CPC41020.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC41020.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to read and interpret plans and specifications relevant to construction projects. It includes identifying types of drawings and specifications, recognising commonly used symbols and abbreviations, and understanding project requirements to ensure accurate implementation in construction activities.

CPC41020.name: Plan and prepare for activities on demolition sites
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to plan and prepare for demolition activities. It covers assessing site conditions, identifying hazards, determining demolition methods, and arranging necessary resources to ensure demolition work is conducted safely and efficiently.

CPC41020.name: Plan demolition work to minimise risk to health, safety and environment
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on planning demolition work with an emphasis on minimising risks to health, safety, and the environment. It involves developing strategies to control hazards, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and implementing measures to protect workers and the surrounding environment during demolition activities.

CPC41020.name: Supervise operational activities on demolition sites
CPC41020.desc: This unit involves supervising operational activities on demolition sites. It includes coordinating tasks, monitoring work progress, ensuring compliance with safety standards, and managing personnel to achieve project objectives efficiently and safely.

CPC41020.name: Finalise demolition activities and supervise property handover
CPC41020.desc: This unit covers the processes involved in finalising demolition activities and supervising the handover of the property. It includes ensuring all demolition tasks are completed to specifications, conducting site inspections, addressing any discrepancies, and completing necessary documentation to facilitate a smooth handover to the client or their representative.

CPC41020.name: Apply structural principles to the planning of the demolition of a structure
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply structural principles in planning the demolition of structures. It involves understanding structural integrity, assessing potential risks, and developing demolition plans that ensure safety and compliance with relevant standards and regulations.

CPC41020.name: Identify and produce estimated costs for building and construction projects
CPC41020.desc: This unit involves identifying and producing estimated costs for building and construction projects. It includes analysing project documentation, calculating material and labour costs, and preparing detailed cost estimates to support budgeting and financial planning in construction projects.

CPC41020.name: Read and interpret demolition site plans and drawings
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on the ability to read and interpret site plans and drawings specific to demolition projects. It encompasses understanding symbols, notations, and details presented in plans to accurately determine the scope and requirements of demolition tasks.

CPC41020.name: Remove non-friable asbestos
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely remove non-friable asbestos-containing material (ACM) in various settings, including construction sites, ships, and soils. It encompasses preparing the work area, containing and removing non-friable ACM, and adhering to decontamination and disposal protocols. Completion of this unit is mandatory for workers involved in removing more than ten square metres of non-friable ACM, aligning with national occupational licensing requirements.

CPC41020.name: Remove friable asbestos
CPC41020.desc: This unit covers the competencies necessary to remove friable asbestos-containing material (ACM). It involves preparing and enclosing the removal area, employing safe removal practices, and following stringent decontamination and disposal procedures. Successful completion certifies individuals to undertake Class A (friable) asbestos removal work, as required by national occupational licensing standards.

CPC41020.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on the application of Work Health and Safety (WHS) requirements, policies, and procedures within the construction industry. It includes identifying and following safety procedures, understanding legislative requirements, and implementing risk control measures to maintain a safe work environment.

CPC40920.name: Establish legal and risk management requirements of new business ventures
CPC40920.desc: This unit covers the essential processes for identifying and complying with legal and risk management requirements when establishing a new business venture. It involves researching and implementing procedures to meet legal obligations, developing risk management strategies, and maintaining effective systems to ensure ongoing compliance.

CPC40920.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary to accurately read and interpret plans and specifications for residential and commercial construction projects. It encompasses identifying various types of plans, understanding drawing conventions, recognising structural and non-structural details, and applying this information to tasks such as estimation, planning, and supervision within the building and construction industry.

CPC40920.name: Carry out work-based risk control processes
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to carry out work-based risk control processes in plumbing and services work environments. It involves identifying potential hazards, assessing associated risks, implementing appropriate control measures, and reviewing their effectiveness to ensure workplace safety. The unit emphasises compliance with relevant work health and safety (WHS) regulations and the development of risk control policies and procedures.

CPC40920.name: Access and interpret regulatory requirements for the plumbing and services industry
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to access and interpret regulatory requirements pertinent to the plumbing and services industry. It involves understanding the hierarchical relationship between legislation, regulations, codes, and standards, including the National Construction Code (NCC). The unit emphasises identifying building classifications, jurisdictional variations, and the distinction between Performance Solutions and Deemed-to-Satisfy (DTS) provisions to ensure compliance in plumbing projects.

CPC40920.name: Design and size sanitary drainage systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of sanitary drainage systems for residential and commercial unit developments. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, determining fixture requirements, calculating pipe sizes, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and jurisdictional regulations. The unit emphasises the application of sustainable design principles and the accurate documentation of system layouts to meet industry standards.

CPC40920.name: Design and size stormwater drainage systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of surface and sub-soil stormwater drainage systems up to legal points of discharge for residential dwellings (Class 1a), commercial Class 6 buildings, and unit complexes comprising at least eight Class 1a dwellings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, performing catchment and runoff calculations, selecting appropriate materials, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and jurisdictional requirements.

CPC40920.name: Design and size consumer gas installations
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design and size consumer gas installations, including consumer piping, flueing, and ventilation systems. It involves preparing for the design process, determining specific gas installation requirements, planning detailed system layouts, and completing necessary documentation. The unit ensures compliance with relevant Australian standards and jurisdictional regulations to promote safe and efficient gas installations.

CPC40920.name: Estimate and cost work
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to estimate materials, labour, and time for plumbing services in Class 1 buildings. It involves gathering customer requirements, interpreting plans and specifications, considering sustainability principles, and calculating costs, including overheads and mark-up percentages, to produce accurate quotations. Additionally, it covers documenting and verifying cost details in accordance with workplace procedures.

CPC40920.name: Design and size sanitary plumbing systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of sanitary plumbing systems for multi-floor residential and commercial buildings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, determining fixture requirements, calculating pipe sizes, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and jurisdictional regulations. The unit emphasises the application of sustainable design principles and the accurate documentation of system layouts to meet industry standards.

CPC40920.name: Design and size heated and cold-water services and systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of heated, tempered, and cold-water services, flushing systems, and hydrant and hose reel systems for residential and commercial multi-floor buildings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, performing calculations to determine appropriate pipe sizes and system components, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and jurisdictional requirements. The unit emphasises the application of sustainable design principles and accurate documentation to meet industry standards.

CPC40920.name: Plan finances for new business ventures
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on identifying and planning the financial requirements essential for launching a new business venture. It encompasses setting profit targets, calculating costs and pricing, conducting break-even analyses, and developing comprehensive financial plans, including cash flow projections and budgeting. Additionally, it involves researching and selecting appropriate sources of finance to ensure the venture's financial viability.

CPC40920.name: Manage work health and safety in the building and construction workplace
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to manage work health and safety (WHS) in building and construction workplaces. It involves inspecting sites for hazards, conducting risk analyses, and developing and implementing appropriate responses to mitigate risks in compliance with government legislation and regulations. This unit is essential for builders, site managers, and forepersons responsible for managing risk in construction environments.

CPC40920.name: Apply sustainable building design principles to water management systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on applying sustainable building design principles to the development and implementation of water management systems in construction projects. It involves assessing and selecting appropriate water management strategies, such as rainwater harvesting, greywater recycling, and efficient plumbing design, to minimise environmental impact and promote resource efficiency. The unit emphasises compliance with relevant regulations and standards to ensure the sustainability and effectiveness of water management solutions.

CPC40920.name: Resolve business disputes
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to advise on or resolve business disputes that may arise during activities in residential and commercial contracting projects. It includes the development and implementation of dispute resolution processes and procedures. This unit applies to builders, site supervisors, and related construction industry professionals responsible for resolving business disputes in a positive manner.

CPC40920.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to carry out work health and safety (WHS) requirements in a plumbing and services work environment. It involves participating in workplace inductions, planning and preparing for safe work practices, identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials, and applying safe work procedures to ensure personal and site safety.

CPP41419.name: Access and interpret legislation in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge to identify, access, and interpret legislation pertinent to real estate operations. It encompasses understanding the legislative framework, recognising the structure of laws, maintaining current knowledge of relevant legislation, and applying this understanding to ensure compliance in real estate practices.

CPP41419.name: Prepare for professional practice in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on understanding the personal and legislative requirements essential for professional practice in real estate. It encompasses knowledge of business structures, regulatory frameworks, codes of practice, and professional development pathways within the industry.

CPP41419.name: Prepare to work with real estate trust accounts
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work with real estate trust accounts within established agency controls. It includes examining trust accounts, identifying established controls applicable to real estate trust account transactions, and explaining common inaccuracies in trust account transactions. The unit applies to individuals currently working in or seeking to work in the real estate industry. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Access and interpret ethical practice in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work ethically in real estate. It includes expressing a thorough understanding of ethical standards in real estate. This unit supports real estate professionals in reducing financial and reputational risks, meeting consumer protection standards, and dealing responsibly with ethical breaches and challenges. The unit applies to people currently working in or seeking to work in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Establish marketing and communication profiles in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to develop marketing and communication profiles in real estate. It includes understanding methods for marketing and communicating, clarifying the type, value, and purpose of different communication activities, and developing a personal profile for marketing and communication in real estate. This unit applies to people currently working in or seeking to work in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Manage tenant relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on establishing and maintaining positive relationships with tenants in the real estate industry. It encompasses effective communication, addressing tenant concerns, ensuring compliance with lease agreements, and managing tenant expectations to promote satisfaction and retention.

CPP41419.name: End tenancy
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to finalise a tenancy in the real estate sector. It covers identifying circumstances for ending tenancy agreements, preparing necessary documentation, coordinating property inspections, managing bond releases, and addressing issues arising from tenancy terminations.

CPP41419.name: Market property
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to market properties for sale or lease in the real estate industry. It encompasses developing and implementing marketing plans tailored to specific properties, preparing marketing materials, selecting appropriate media channels, and monitoring the effectiveness of marketing activities to attract potential buyers or tenants.

CPP41419.name: Manage tenancy
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to manage a tenancy effectively. It includes timely and effective communication with tenants, landlords, and other stakeholders, as well as the management of rent payments, arrears, routine inspections, repairs, maintenance, tenancy renewals, rent increases, and tenancy agreement breaches.

CPP41419.name: Appraise property for sale or lease
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to appraise residential property for sale or lease. It includes selecting appropriate appraisal methods, conducting property inspections, analysing market conditions, and recommending a price range or rental value. This unit does not cover formal property valuations.

CPP41419.name: Transact in trust accounts
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to conduct transactions in real estate trust accounts. It includes identifying the purpose and types of property trust accounts, applying agency controls to transactions in property trust accounts for specific purposes, balancing, reconciling and reporting on trust account transactions, and maintaining records of trust account transactions. The unit applies to people currently working in or seeking to work in real estate in a capacity that requires them to transact in trust accounts. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Present at hearings in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to effectively appear before a hearing in the real estate industry. It encompasses preparing for hearings, adhering to appropriate hearing etiquette, participating in conciliation processes, and presenting a case during hearings. The unit applies to industry professionals acting on behalf of principals in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Use inclusive work practices
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to recognise and interact productively with diverse groups of individuals in the workplace. It covers responding to and working effectively with individual differences that might be encountered during the course of work. The unit applies to individuals who work in a variety of contexts where they will be expected to interact with diverse groups of individuals. They may also provide some leadership and guidance to others and have some limited responsibility for the output of others. No licensing, legislative or certification requirements apply to this unit at the time of publication.

CPP41419.name: Establish landlord relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to establish and maintain effective relationships with landlords in property management. It includes confirming the scope of landlord requirements, completing property management agreements, and establishing frameworks for communication. The unit applies to individuals working in real estate who are responsible for managing landlord relationships. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Establish vendor relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to establish and maintain effective relationships with vendors in property sales. It includes planning prospecting activities, confirming vendor needs and expectations, preparing and conducting listing presentations, completing listing agreements, and planning for ongoing communication and records management associated with the vendor relationship. The unit applies to individuals working in real estate who manage vendor relationships. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Deliver presentations to clients in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to present information to clients in real estate in a planned, structured, and professional manner. It includes preparing for presentations, conducting them effectively, and reviewing their outcomes to identify areas for improvement. The unit applies to industry professionals acting on behalf of principals in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Sell property
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to sell property through methods such as private treaty, auction, and other negotiations. It includes preparing the property for sale, negotiating sales between vendors and buyers, and facilitating the completion of contracts. The unit applies to individuals currently working in or seeking to work in real estate who apply knowledge of legislative and compliance requirements, ethical standards, and consumer preferences to manage real estate operations. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Establish buyer relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to establish, develop, and manage positive relationships with buyers in the real estate industry. It includes identifying and explaining ethical and conduct standards, promoting personal and agency brands in communication with buyers, responding to and documenting buyer inquiries, clarifying and documenting buyer preferences, matching buyer preferences to properties for sale, presenting opportunities for property inspections, interpreting buyer feedback, developing communication strategies to address buyer expectations, and maintaining ethical practice, client service, and confidentiality standards. The unit applies to individuals working in real estate who apply knowledge of legislative and compliance requirements, ethical standards, and consumer preferences to manage real estate operations. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPC50220.name: Manage business risk
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the development and implementation of strategies to manage business risks. It involves identifying potential risks, analysing their likelihood and impact, and developing appropriate mitigation plans to minimise adverse effects on business operations.

CPC50220.name: Lead WHS risk management
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on leading workplace health and safety (WHS) risk management processes. It includes establishing risk management frameworks, identifying hazards, assessing risks, and implementing control measures to ensure a safe working environment.

CPC50220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 1 and 10 buildings
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves accessing, interpreting, and applying relevant building codes and standards to the construction of Class 1 and 10 buildings, which include residential dwellings and non-habitable structures. It ensures compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other legislative requirements.

CPC50220.name: Select, prepare and administer a construction contract
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the processes of selecting appropriate construction contracts, preparing contract documentation, and administering the contract throughout the construction phase. It ensures that all parties understand their obligations and that the project is completed in accordance with contractual agreements.

CPC50220.name: Identify and produce estimated costs for building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves identifying and estimating the costs associated with building and construction projects. It includes analysing project documentation, calculating material and labour costs, and preparing detailed cost estimates to inform budgeting and financial planning.

CPC50220.name: Produce labour and material schedules for ordering
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on developing detailed schedules for labour and materials required for construction projects. It involves interpreting project plans and specifications to determine quantities and timelines, ensuring that resources are available when needed to maintain project efficiency.

CPC50220.name: Supervise site communication and administration processes for building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the supervision of communication and administrative processes on construction sites. It includes managing information flow, coordinating meetings, maintaining records, and ensuring effective communication among stakeholders to facilitate smooth project operations.

CPC50220.name: Apply legal requirements to building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves understanding and applying legal requirements relevant to building and construction projects. It includes knowledge of contracts, regulations, codes, and standards to ensure that all aspects of the project comply with legal and regulatory obligations.

CPC50220.name: Apply structural principles to residential and commercial constructions
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on applying structural principles to the construction of residential and commercial buildings. It involves understanding load-bearing structures, material properties, and construction methods to ensure the structural integrity and safety of buildings.

CPC50220.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves the ability to read and interpret construction plans and specifications for both residential and commercial projects. It includes identifying site characteristics, understanding building layouts, and extracting essential information to guide construction activities.

CPC50220.name: Prepare and evaluate tender documentation
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves evaluating project and contract requirements to prepare and formalise tender documentation in the building and construction industry. It includes interpreting, compiling, and documenting essential project information into a final tender document.

CPC50220.name: Prepare simple building sketches and drawings
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on preparing sketches and drawings used for communicating ideas to clients and other parties in the building and construction industry. It includes capturing design concepts from architectural drawings to create simpler versions for estimating and explaining details.

CPC50220.name: Apply site surveys and set-out procedures to building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers applying site surveys and set-out procedures to building and construction projects. It involves interpreting site plans, conducting site surveys, and setting out building works in accordance with project specifications and relevant standards.

CPC50220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 2 to 9 Type C buildings
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves accessing, interpreting, and applying relevant building codes and standards to the construction of Class 2 to 9, Type C buildings. It ensures compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other legislative requirements for these building classes.

CPC50220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Type B construction
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on applying building codes and standards to the construction process for Type B construction. It involves ensuring that building work complies with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other relevant standards for Type B buildings.

CPC50220.name: Monitor costing systems on complex building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers monitoring costing systems on complex building and construction projects. It includes overseeing financial management processes, ensuring accurate cost reporting, and maintaining budgetary control throughout the project lifecycle.

CPC50220.name: Supervise the planning of on-site building and construction work
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves supervising the planning of on-site building and construction work. It includes coordinating site activities, managing resources, and ensuring that work is planned and executed in accordance with project schedules and quality requirements.

CPC50220.name: Select and manage building and construction contractors
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on selecting and managing building and construction contractors. It involves evaluating contractor capabilities, negotiating contracts, and overseeing contractor performance to ensure project requirements are met.

CPC50220.name: Administer the legal obligations of a building and construction contractor
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers administering the legal obligations of a building and construction contractor. It includes understanding and managing contractual, legal, and regulatory responsibilities to ensure compliance throughout the construction process.

CPC50220.name: Manage construction work
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves managing on-site construction work to meet commercial contractual obligations. It includes establishing effective communication processes, managing risks and work health and safety (WHS), overseeing the supply of materials and equipment, and coordinating on-site operations to ensure project timelines and quality standards are met.

CPC50220.name: Manage environmental management practices and processes in building and construction
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on planning and implementing effective environmental management practices in building and construction projects. It encompasses developing environmental management plans, ensuring compliance with environmental legislation, monitoring environmental performance, and promoting sustainable building practices to minimise environmental impact.

CPC50220.name: Manage professional technical and legal reports on building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves managing the preparation and evaluation of professional, technical, and legal reports related to building and construction projects. It includes interpreting complex documentation, ensuring reports comply with regulatory requirements, and effectively communicating findings to stakeholders to support informed decision-making.

CPC50220.name: Apply structural principles to the construction of buildings up to three storeys
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the application of structural principles in the construction of buildings up to three storeys. It involves understanding load-bearing components, selecting appropriate construction methods, and ensuring compliance with relevant building codes and standards to maintain structural integrity and safety.

CPC50220.name: Manage building and construction business finances
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on managing the financial aspects of a building and construction business. It includes budgeting, financial planning, monitoring cash flow, and ensuring financial compliance to support the profitability and sustainability of the business.

CPC50220.name: Manage project quality
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves managing project quality to ensure outcomes meet stakeholder expectations. It includes developing quality management plans, implementing quality assurance processes, and conducting quality control activities to achieve project objectives.

CPC50220.name: Identify services layout and connection methods for Type B and C constructions
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers identifying the layout and connection methods for services in Type B and C constructions. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, coordinating with service providers, and ensuring compliance with building codes and standards to facilitate the integration of services into construction projects.

CPC50220.name: Develop workplace policies and procedures for sustainability
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on developing and implementing workplace policies and procedures that promote sustainability. It includes identifying areas for improvement, engaging stakeholders, and establishing practices that reduce environmental impact and enhance sustainable operations within the organisation.

CPP51122.name: Manage compliance in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to analyse, develop, implement, manage, and evaluate compliance in the property industry. It involves identifying legislative requirements, conducting risk analysis, developing compliance strategies, and monitoring and evaluating compliance systems within a property agency.

CPP51122.name: Establish and monitor property industry trust account management practices
CPP51122.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to establish and monitor trust account management practices in the property industry. It includes implementing legislative requirements, developing policies and procedures, overseeing trust account transactions, and ensuring accurate record-keeping and reporting.

CPP51122.name: Manage ethical practice in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to implement and manage ethical practice systems in a property agency. It involves identifying ethical practice requirements, developing and implementing risk control strategies, monitoring ethical practices, and evaluating and improving ethical practice systems.

CPP51122.name: Manage a safe workplace in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to manage work health and safety (WHS) policies, procedures, and programs in the property industry. It includes establishing and maintaining WHS systems, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements, and promoting a safe work environment.

CPP51122.name: Manage teams in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage and evaluate agency teams in the property industry. It involves planning and implementing team activities, monitoring team performance, providing support and feedback, and fostering a positive team environment to achieve organisational goals.

CPP51122.name: Manage operational finances in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to manage operational finances within a property agency. It includes budgeting, financial forecasting, monitoring financial performance, and ensuring financial activities comply with legislative and organisational requirements.

CPP51122.name: Develop a strategic business plan in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to develop a strategic business plan for a property agency. It involves analysing market opportunities, setting business objectives, formulating strategies, and developing action plans to achieve long-term business success.

CPP51122.name: Manage customer service activities in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage customer service activities in the property industry. It includes developing customer service strategies, managing customer relationships, handling complaints, and implementing improvements to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.

CPP51122.name: Manage people performance
CPP51122.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to manage the performance of staff who are direct reports. It includes work allocation, performance planning and review, providing feedback, and managing follow-up. The unit emphasises performance management and development as key responsibilities for effective managers.

CPP51122.name: Provide leadership across the organisation
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to demonstrate senior leadership behaviour, and to lead the organisation and others. It includes influencing groups and individuals, building and supporting teams, and shaping and managing the organisation's culture.

CPP51122.name: Plan and interpret market research
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan market research and interpret its findings. It involves defining market research objectives, selecting appropriate data collection methods, analysing data, and reporting on findings to inform business decision-making.

CPP51122.name: Manage business operational plans
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to develop and monitor the implementation of operational plans to support efficient and effective workplace practices and organisational productivity and profitability. It includes developing and managing operational plans, monitoring performance, and reviewing operations to achieve business goals.

BSB50820.name: Manage project scope
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the processes required to ensure a project includes all the work necessary to achieve its objectives. It encompasses defining and managing both the project and product scope, involving the development of a scope management plan, collection of requirements, definition of scope, creation of a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), and validation and control of scope. Effective scope management ensures that only the work required to complete the project is performed, preventing scope creep and ensuring project success.

BSB50820.name: Manage project time
BSB50820.desc: This unit addresses the skills and knowledge necessary to manage timely completion of a project. It involves determining and implementing the project schedule by identifying and sequencing activities, estimating activity durations, developing and controlling the schedule. Proficiency in this area ensures that project timelines are met, resources are allocated efficiently, and potential delays are identified and mitigated promptly.

BSB50820.name: Manage project quality
BSB50820.desc: This unit pertains to the management of project quality to ensure that project deliverables meet the required standards and stakeholder expectations. It includes planning quality management, managing quality assurance, and controlling quality through systematic measurement, analysis, and improvement of project processes and outputs. Emphasis is placed on continuous improvement and adherence to organisational quality policies and procedures.

BSB50820.name: Manage project cost
BSB50820.desc: This unit involves the processes required to manage project costs to ensure the project is completed within the approved budget. It covers planning cost management, estimating costs, determining the budget, and controlling costs. Effective cost management ensures that project resources are used efficiently, financial risks are mitigated, and the project remains financially viable throughout its lifecycle.

BSB50820.name: Manage project human resources
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the management of human resources within a project context. It includes planning human resource management, acquiring, developing, and managing the project team. Key activities involve defining roles and responsibilities, developing staffing management plans, fostering team development, managing team performance, and resolving conflicts. Effective human resource management ensures that the project team is skilled, motivated, and working collaboratively towards project objectives.

BSB50820.name: Manage project information and communication
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the effective management of project information and communication processes to ensure timely and appropriate generation, collection, dissemination, storage, and disposal of project information. It involves developing a communication management plan, managing project information flow, and ensuring that stakeholders receive relevant and accurate information throughout the project lifecycle. Effective communication management is crucial for aligning stakeholder expectations, facilitating decision-making, and ensuring project success.

BSB50820.name: Manage project risk
BSB50820.desc: This unit addresses the identification, analysis, and management of risks within a project context. It encompasses the development of a risk management plan, risk identification, qualitative and quantitative risk analysis, risk response planning, and monitoring and controlling risks throughout the project. Proficient risk management ensures that potential threats are mitigated, and opportunities are capitalised upon, thereby enhancing the likelihood of project success.

BSB50820.name: Manage project integration
BSB50820.desc: This unit pertains to the coordination of all aspects of a project to ensure its successful completion. It involves developing a project charter, project management plan, directing and managing project work, monitoring and controlling project work, performing integrated change control, and closing the project or phase. Effective integration management ensures that project activities are aligned, resources are utilised efficiently, and project objectives are achieved cohesively.

BSB50820.name: Manage complex projects
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the management of projects that are characterised by high levels of complexity, uncertainty, and ambiguity. It involves applying advanced project management techniques, managing multiple interrelated project components, dealing with a wide range of stakeholders, and navigating complex organisational environments. Proficiency in managing complex projects ensures that project managers can effectively handle challenges and deliver successful outcomes in intricate project scenarios.

BSB50820.name: Manage business resources
BSB50820.desc: This unit involves the efficient and effective management of business resources to achieve organisational objectives. It includes planning resource requirements, acquiring and allocating resources, monitoring and controlling resource usage, and evaluating resource management processes. Effective resource management ensures that physical, human, and financial resources are utilised optimally, contributing to organisational productivity and success.

BSB50820.name: Communicate with influence
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the development and application of communication strategies to influence others and achieve desired outcomes. It encompasses understanding the audience, crafting persuasive messages, utilising appropriate communication channels, and evaluating the effectiveness of communication efforts. Proficient communication with influence is essential for leaders and managers to effectively convey ideas, drive change, and achieve organisational goals.

BSB50820.name: Develop critical thinking in others
BSB50820.desc: This unit involves fostering critical thinking skills in individuals and teams to enhance problem-solving and decision-making capabilities. It includes creating an environment that encourages critical analysis, facilitating learning opportunities, mentoring, and providing feedback to develop others' critical thinking abilities. Developing critical thinking in others contributes to improved innovation, adaptability, and performance within the organisation.

UEE32225.name: Apply work health and safety regulations, codes and practices in the workplace
UEE32225.desc: This unit outlines the skills and knowledge required to apply work health and safety (WHS) regulations, codes and practices when performing work functions in the electrotechnology industry. It includes identifying hazards, assessing risks, and implementing control measures in line with industry and legislative requirements.

UEE32225.name: Document and apply measures to control WHS risks associated with electrotechnology work
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves identifying, documenting, and applying WHS/OHS hazard and risk control measures. It includes identifying workplace hazards, assigning risk levels, developing control measures to eliminate or mitigate risks, and maintaining documentation in accordance with compliance procedures.

UEE32225.name: Fabricate, assemble and dismantle utilities industry components
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to fabricate, assemble, and dismantle utilities industry components using fitting and metal fabrication techniques. It includes interpreting drawings, using hand and power tools safely, and joining components using various methods.

UEE32225.name: Fix and secure electrotechnology equipment
