45637AUR32721.name: Diagnose and repair HVAC and rechargeable energy storage cooling systems in battery electric vehicle*
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) and rechargeable energy storage cooling systems of battery electric vehicles (BEVs). The unit involves removing and replacing refrigerant, as well as performance testing the HVAC and RESS cooling system. It involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation. Importance is placed in the unit on applying electrical safety procedures when working on high voltage (HV) rechargeable energy storage systems (RESS).

45637AUR32721.name: Diagnose and repair DC to DC converters in battery electric vehicles*
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the high voltage (HV) direct current (DC) to low voltage (LV) DC of battery electric vehicles (BEVs). The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation. Importance is placed in the unit on applying electrical safety procedures when working on high voltage (HV) rechargeable energy storage systems (RESS).

45637AUR32721.name: Use and maintain electrical test equipment in an automotive workplace
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to select, use and maintain electrical test equipment used in an automotive workplace for the purpose of identifying, diagnosing and rectifying electrical and electronic faults in vehicles or machinery.

45637AUR32721.name: Test and repair basic electrical circuits
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect, test and repair basic electrical circuits in vehicle and machinery electrical systems. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting and testing the circuit, repairing the circuit, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR32721.name: Test, charge and replace batteries and jump-start vehicles
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to test, charge, replace, retest and secure a range of automotive batteries, including vehicle or machinery jump-starting procedures. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting and testing the battery to determine serviceability, charging, jump-starting, removing and replacing, and undertaking the final retesting of batteries, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR32721.name: Service air conditioning and HVAC systems
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to service air conditioning systems, including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) systems, fitted to a range of vehicles and machinery. It involves preparing for the task, carrying out performance testing and correct servicing procedures, performing post-service testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR32721.name: Develop and carry out diagnostic test strategies
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to develop and carry out a diagnostic testing strategy on vehicles, vessels or machinery. It involves confirming the existence of a fault, identifying the required diagnostic information, developing a diagnostic strategy, applying the diagnostic strategy, and reporting conclusions.

45637AUR32721.name: Use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace
45637AUR32721.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to select, use, maintain and store tools and equipment in an automotive workplace.

45637MEM30219.name: Interpret technical drawing
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to interpret technical drawings. Technical drawings may utilise perspective, exploded views or hidden view techniques and may include symbol glossaries. Drawings are provided to AS 1100 Technical drawing or AS 1102 Graphical symbols and their equivalents from the full range of engineering disciplines.

45637MEM30219.name: Undertake manual handling
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to lift and move materials manually and/or using basic manual handling equipment in a wide range of environments.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform engineering measurements
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform measurements requiring straightforward use of mechanical measuring devices which incorporate visual inspections representing units of measurement and associated calculations in a range of manufacturing, engineering and related environments. Measurements may be expressed in metric or imperial units.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform computations
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to estimate approximate answers to arithmetical problems, carry out calculations involving percentages and proportions, and determine simple ratios and averages.

45637MEM30219.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to work effectively in manufacturing and engineering work situations, including planning routine work and participating in and following work health and safety (WHS) procedures. The unit applies to working either individually or in a team situation and includes contributing to work-related group activities in a manufacturing or engineering workplace.

45637MEM30219.name: Plan work activities
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to plan familiar work activities, whilst following established procedures and work health and safety (WHS) policies and procedures of the organisation.

45637MEM30219.name: Organise and communicate information
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to access, organise and communicate information related to production, maintenance or associated processes or tasks that apply in manufacturing, engineering or related environments.

45637MEM30219.name: Interact with computing technology
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of computing technology typically used in manufacturing, engineering or related environments to access, input and store information.

45637MEM30219.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assist in the provision of on-the-job training to others while undertaking normal duties and it may involve the replacement of normal duties with training duties for limited periods of time. The individual would not be expected to be solely responsible for the assessment or reporting of a trainee's progress.

45637MEM30219.name: Use hand tools
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of hand tools for a variety of general engineering applications.

45637MEM30219.name: Use power tools/hand held operations
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of hand held power tools and fixed power tools for hand held operations used in a variety of general engineering applications.

45637MEM30219.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to comply with environmental regulations, identify environment issues and minimise the risks of negative impact on work and carry out improvements in own work area.

45637MEM30219.name: Carry out mechanical cutting
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate a range of mechanical cutting and holing equipment.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform general machining
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Mechanical apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in non-computer numerical controlled (CNC) machining of ferrous and non-ferrous materials.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform grinding operations
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson - Mechanical apprenticeship training and the recognition of trad- level skills in performing grinding operations and checking finished components for conformance to specifications.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform precision jig boring operations
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform precision jig boring operations using a range of jig boring and milling machines.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform complex milling operations
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform complex milling operations on a range of materials, including non-standard metals and alloys.

45637MEM30219.name: Mark off/out (general engineering)
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for engineering tradesperson - mechanical apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in marking off/out in general engineering.

45637MEM30219.name: Dismantle, replace and assemble engineering components
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to dismantle, identify faulty components, select replacements and assemble engineering components into assemblies or sub-assemblies in accordance with standard operating procedures (SOPs).

45637MEM30219.name: Perform precision fitting of engineering components
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson - Mechanical apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in precision fitting and mechanical repair.

45637MEM30219.name: Maintain and repair mechanical drives and mechanical transmission assemblies
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to undertake maintenance, diagnose faults and repair drives and transmission assemblies, and undertake final adjustment and commissioning on industrial machinery.

45637MEM30219.name: Maintain pneumatic system components
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to check pneumatic system components, identify and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM30219.name: Maintain hydraulic system components
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to check hydraulic system components, identify, and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM30219.name: Install machine/plant
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to install machine/plant where the equipment being installed requires substantial modification to the existing site and/or connecting equipment and excludes minor modifications.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform precision mechanical measurement
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform precision mechanical measurement.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform routine oxy fuel gas welding
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare materials and perform routine oxy fuel gas welding of mild/low carbon steel and cast iron where the welding is not required to meet an Australian Standard or equivalent.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform routine gas tungsten arc welding
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare the materials and carry out routine gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW) and applies in a maintenance or manufacturing environment where the weld quality is not required to meet an Australian Standard.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to undertake levelling and alignment measurements/readings and perform levelling and/or alignment and adjustment tasks on machines and engineering components.

45637MEM30219.name: Perform equipment condition monitoring and recording
45637MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to undertake condition monitoring of equipment, including recording the results.

45637MEM31419.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency describes the skills and knowledge required to work effectively in manufacturing and engineering environments, including planning routine tasks, following work health and safety (WHS) procedures, and contributing to group activities. It covers safe operational practices in compliance with legislative and regulatory requirements, as well as participation in quality systems, communication, and cooperation with others in workplaces operating under informal or formal quality management and improvement systems.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify batteries, low voltage sensors and circuits
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use test instruments, test the battery, assess and rectify wiring faults. It applies to testing and rectification activities associated with 12, 24 36 and 48 volt wiring systems on vehicles, mobile plant and stationary equipment.

45637MEM31419.name: Use hand tools
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of hand tools for a variety of general engineering applications.

45637MEM31419.name: Interact with computing technology
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of computing technology typically used in manufacturing, engineering or related environments to access, input and store information.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain, fault find and rectify hydraulic systems for mobile plant
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to test, fault find and rectify hydraulic systems used in the earthmoving, agricultural and transport industries. It covers identifying the hydraulic system and components used on mobile plant, general servicing and identifying faults that are related to electronic and fieldbus controls and communication.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and maintain electronic controlling systems on mobile/stationary plant
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to test, diagnose and fault find electronic control systems associated with mobile and stationary plant and equipment. It applies to whole of equipment diagnosis and rectification and complements diagnostic and rectification skills contained in individual system units of competency.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform engineering measurements
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform measurements requiring straightforward use of mechanical measuring devices which incorporate visual inspections representing units of measurement and associated calculations in a range of manufacturing, engineering and related environments. Measurements may be expressed in metric or imperial units. Electrical/electronic devices used are those not requiring the connection or disconnection of circuitry.

45637MEM31419.name: Undertake manual handling
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to lift and move materials manually and/or using basic manual handling equipment in a wide range of environments. Maximum manual lifting weight is limited to Safe Work Australia recommendations.

45637MEM31419.name: Interpret technical drawing
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to interpret technical drawings. Technical drawings may utilise perspective, exploded views or hidden view techniques and may include symbol glossaries. Drawings are provided to AS 1100 Technical drawing or AS 1102 Graphical symbols and their equivalents from the full range of engineering disciplines.

45637MEM31419.name: Apply knowledge of large combustion engine operations to service/maintenance
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to identify engine features and operations essential for large engine servicing and maintenance tasks. It includes identifying and assessing large combustion engines, the equipment powered by the engines, and the operations the equipment is required to perform and applying this information to engine service and maintenance tasks.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform computations
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to estimate approximate answers to arithmetical problems, carry out calculations involving percentages and proportions, and determine simple ratios and averages. It also covers producing and interpreting simple charts and graphs in manufacturing, engineering or related environments.

45637MEM31419.name: Dismantle, replace and assemble engineering components
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to dismantle, identify faulty components, select replacements and assemble engineering components into assemblies or sub-assemblies in accordance with standard operating procedures (SOPs). It also applies to the straightforward removal and replacement of pre-manufactured bearings and seals.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose, repair and replace diesel engines in stationary and mobile plant
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to diagnose, repair and replace diesel engines used in mobile and stationary plant and equipment. It covers the diagnosis of diesel engine operation to determine location and cause of faults and whether in situ repair, more specialist investigation or engine removal for off-site repair is required. It includes bottom and top end repair of engines and re-installing repaired or replacement engines into stationary and mobile plant. Where repairs to fuel, coolant, electrical and starting, exhaust systems, as well as transmissions and accessories and their components are required, see the appropriate units.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify fieldbus circuits in mobile/stationary plant/equipment
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to carry out diagnosis and rectification of circuits used in controller area network (CAN) and other fieldbus systems and control technology components in mobile and stationary plant. It applies to systems and components that do not require a host computer. The unit can apply to circuits used for communication with and between systems and components, including systems for engine management, suspension, hydraulics and pneumatics, chassis and body management, braking systems, mechanical, electrical and hydraulic drives, lighting control, air conditioning, vehicle guidance and telemetry.

45637MEM31419.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assist in the provision of on-the-job training to others while undertaking normal duties and it may involve the replacement of normal duties with training duties for limited periods of time. The individual would not be expected to be solely responsible for the assessment or reporting of a trainee's progress. Typical applications could include the provision of on-the-job training by a tradesperson to apprentices/trainees or by a production worker to other production workers/trainees.

45637MEM31419.name: Use power tools/hand held operations
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to use a range of handheld and fixed power tools for general engineering applications, excluding tools dedicated to specific operations or machines such as nut-runners, air drills, and power drivers.

45637MEM31419.name: Plan work activities
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to plan familiar work activities, whilst following established procedures and work health and safety (WHS) policies and procedures of the organisation. Planning is undertaken by the individual performing the work. Individual plan components may require modification and prioritising to meet job requirements or to respond to unforeseen circumstances.

45637MEM31419.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to comply with environmental regulations, identify issues, minimise negative impacts, and make improvements in the work area. It applies to operators and team members across all sectors of the manufacturing industry and its value chain, including offices and warehouses, and requires working individually or in teams, often in coordination with other staff such as shift members and control room operators, with contextualisation to the relevant industry or organisation.

45637MEM31419.name: Organise and communicate information
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to access, organise and communicate information related to production, maintenance or associated processes or tasks that apply in manufacturing, engineering or related environments.

45637MEM31419.name: Install and commission pre-engineered fire-suppression systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission pre-engineered fire-suppression systems. It includes verifying that systems are installed and operate as intended according to the requirements of system manufacturers and relevant Australian Standards.

45637MEM31419.name: Inspect, test and maintain non-gaseous pre-engineered fire-suppression systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency specifies the skills and knowledge required to inspect, test and maintain pre-engineered foam, wet chemical, powder or water mist fire-suppression systems. Service activities are conducted according to the relevant Australian Standard and manufacturer requirements for the installed system.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform general machining
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Mechanical apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in non-computer numerical controlled (CNC) machining of ferrous and non-ferrous materials.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform precision fitting of engineering components
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson - Mechanical apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in precision fitting and mechanical repair.

45637MEM31419.name: Use tools for precision work
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use tools to manually produce work to precise dimensions and/or finishes.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain pneumatic systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to undertake preventive maintenance checks/adjustments on pneumatic systems, and fault-find, replace, repair or overhaul and recommission pneumatic systems.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to undertake levelling and alignment measurements/readings and perform levelling and/or alignment and adjustment tasks on machines and engineering components.

45637MEM31419.name: Terminate and connect electrical wiring
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to terminate, disconnect or reconnect electrical wiring, including all types of cords and cables and circuits, excluding specialist cables.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform electrical/electronic measurement
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to terminate, disconnect or reconnect electrical wiring, including all types of cords and cables and circuits, excluding specialist cables.

45637MEM31419.name: Service and repair mobile plant air conditioning systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to service and repair in cabin air conditioning systems installed in mobile plant and rail vehicles. It covers systems supplying heating, ventilation, air conditioning (HVAC) and cooling systems to operator compartments and includes servicing, fault finding, repairing and replacing of control and operating components, refrigerant check, replacement and recovery, and recommissioning of the air conditioning system.

45637MEM31419.name: Overhaul engine fuel system components
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to recondition and reinstall fuel system components on large stationary or mobile diesel engines. It includes removal and cleaning of fuel system components, assessing components for wear and defects, deciding whether a component should be reconditioned or replaced, reinstallation of reconditioned components in engines and testing of reconditioned components for effective operation.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform routine gas tungsten arc welding
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare the materials and carry out routine gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW) and applies in a maintenance or manufacturing environment where the weld quality is not required to meet an Australian Standard.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform routine gas metal arc welding
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare materials and carry out routine gas metal arc welding (GMAW) and applies in a maintenance or manufacturing environment where the weld quality is not required to meet an Australian Standard or equivalent.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform high reliability soldering and desoldering
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform soldering/desoldering for the installation and fabrication of electrical/electronic components to advanced or military specifications, or where the reliability of electrical connections is critical and where the prevention of damage through electrostatic discharge or other means is required as well as the soldering of electronic surface mount devices (SMD).

45637MEM31419.name: Perform manual soldering/desoldering â€“ electrical/electronic components
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform manual soldering/desoldering for the installation and fabrication of electrical/electronic components.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform fault diagnosis, installation and removal of bearings
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform fault diagnosis, installation and removal of bearings.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain track type undercarriage on mobile plant
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to maintain track assemblies, including checking components, clearances, tension and replacing any faulty components. It covers mobile plant equipment that uses crawler belts and/or chain links.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain, fault find and repair stationary plant gas turbine engines
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to maintain gas turbine engines used in stationary plant applications. It covers scheduled servicing, preventative maintenance, fault finding and repair or rectification of faulty operation and components undertaken on gas turbine engines up to 5 GJ/hr (1300 kw) capacity, including ancillary equipment that may be associated with the engine operation.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain, fault find and repair traction drive mechanics
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to maintain and repair traction drive systems on transport and mobile equipment. It covers the skills and knowledge for mechanical related maintenance and fault finding of traction drive systems, including fault finding and rectifying mechanical systems and components supporting the operation of the traction drive system.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain fluid power controls
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to install and repair and/or rectify fluid power controls, and adjust fluid power system control sequence and operation.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform gland packing
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to inspect glands and gland packing and remove and replace or top up gland packing. It applies to packing for high or low temperatures and pressures, solids, gases and liquids.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform engine bottom-end overhaul
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to dismantle, clean and assess parts, record and interpret measurements, and recondition components. It includes cylinder honing using hand held power tools, and replacement of bearings, piston rings and similar activities but not major machining, including crankshaft grinding, cylinder boring and tunnel boring.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform engine top-end overhaul
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to dismantle, clean and assess parts, record and interpret measurements and recondition the cylinder head. It includes all types of engines and work associated with the reconditioning of cylinder heads, including determining the causes of failures, replacement of inserts, guides and injector sleeves, grinding of valves and seats, and crack/twist/bend testing. The reconditioning of original parts, crack repairs using non-welding techniques and sizing and fitting of replacement parts are also included.

45637MEM31419.name: Disconnect/reconnect fixed wired equipment up to 1000 volts a.c./1500 volts d.c.
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to disconnect and reconnect equipment to all voltage levels up to1000 volts a.c./1500 volts d.c.

45637MEM31419.name: Disconnect/reconnect fixed wired equipment over 1000 volts a.c./1500 volts d.c.
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to disconnect and reconnect and making safe for maintenance of equipment for all voltage levels above 1000 volts a.c./1500 volts d.c.

45637MEM31419.name: Tune diesel engines
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to compression test and tune up the engine. It applies to tune up procedures and evaluation of engine performance on compression ignition engines.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform installation and removal of mechanical seals
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to check, dismantle, select, reassemble and install a range of mechanical seals.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain hydraulic system components
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to check hydraulic system components, identify, and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM31419.name: Service combustion engines
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to check and assess engine consumable fluids and components for serviceability, perform the service procedures and report what has been carried out. Servicing activities include obtaining and dispatching samples for spectrographic or laboratory analysis.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify braking systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to check and assess braking systems, and replace/repair/overhaul braking system components associated with mobile equipment.

45637MEM31419.name: Perform routine manual metal arc welding
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to carry out routine manual metal arc welding (MMAW) of low carbon mild steel where the welding is not required to meet an Australian Standard or equivalent.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain mobile plant suspension systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess, maintain and repair/replace suspension systems of all types of wheeled and/or tracked plant/vehicles.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain wheels and tyres
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess wheel condition, and repair/replace and maintain the wheel. It covers the basic maintenance and repair or replacement of wheel rims and to the full range of wheel/tyre assemblies, plant and equipment using appropriate regulations, codes of practice, manufacturer specifications or in-house standards as a guide for assessment repair and assembly.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify low voltage starting systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess the operation, test and repair starting systems requiring the use of amps, voltage and resistance (AVR) test equipment.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain steering systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess steering system operation, and repair or replace faulty components on steering systems for vehicles, mobile plant and equipment.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain and repair engine lubrication systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess lubrication system operations and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain induction, exhaust and emission control systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess induction, exhaust and emission control system operation and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify low voltage charging systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess generator/alternator operation, and test and repair and/or replace generators and alternators. It applies to the testing and rectification work associated with 12, 14, 36 and 48 volt charging systems on vehicles, mobile plant and stationary equipment.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify drive line and final drives
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess drive line and final drive operation, and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify automatic transmissions
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess converter/transmission operation, and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM31419.name: Diagnose and rectify manual transmissions
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assess clutch and transmission operation, and repair or replace faulty components.

45637MEM31419.name: Maintain and repair stationary and mobile plant engine cooling systems
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to service, maintain, diagnose, and repair the cooling systems of combustion engines in vehicles and plant used for manufacturing, maintenance, and engineering operations.

45637MEM31419.name: Implement and monitor environmentally sustainable work practices
45637MEM31419.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to analyse the workplace in relation to environmentally sustainable work practices and to implement, monitor, and evaluate improvements. It applies to individuals responsible for a specific work area or who lead a work group or team and addresses the knowledge, processes, and techniques necessary to develop tools and strategies for sustainable practices. This includes identifying areas for improvement, creating plans to enhance environmental performance, and implementing and monitoring these improvements effectively.

45637MEM31925.name: Use hand tools
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of hand tools for a variety of general engineering applications.

45637MEM31925.name: Use power tools/hand held operations
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of hand held power tools and fixed power tools for hand held operations used in a variety of general engineering applications.

45637MEM31925.name: Interact with computing technology
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to use a range of computing technology typically used in manufacturing, engineering or related environments to access, input and store information.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform engineering measurements
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform measurements requiring straightforward use of mechanical measuring devices which incorporate visual inspections representing units of measurement and associated calculations in a range of manufacturing, engineering and related environments. Measurements may be expressed in metric or imperial units. Electrical/electronic devices used are those not requiring the connection or disconnection of circuitry.

45637MEM31925.name: Undertake manual handling
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to lift and move materials manually and/or using basic manual handling equipment in a wide range of environments. Maximum manual lifting weight is limited to Safe Work Australia recommendations.

45637MEM31925.name: Interpret technical drawing
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to interpret technical drawings.Technical drawings may utilise perspective, exploded views or hidden view techniques and may include symbol glossaries. Drawings are provided to AS 1100 Technical drawing or AS 1102 Graphical symbols and their equivalents from the full range of engineering disciplines.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform computations
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to estimate approximate answers to arithmetical problems, carry out calculations involving percentages and proportions, and determine simple ratios and averages. It also covers producing and interpreting simple charts and graphs in manufacturing, engineering or related environments.

45637MEM31925.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to assist in the provision of on-the-job training to others while undertaking normal duties and it may involve the replacement of normal duties with training duties for limited periods of time. The individual would not be expected to be solely responsible for the assessment or reporting of a trainee's progress. Typical applications could include the provision of on-the-job training by a tradesperson to apprentices/trainees or by a production worker to other production workers/trainees.

45637MEM31925.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to plan familiar work activities, whilst following established procedures and work health and safety (WHS) policies and procedures of the organisation. Planning is undertaken by the individual performing the work. Individual plan components may require modification and prioritising to meet job requirements or to respond to unforeseen circumstances.

45637MEM31925.name: Plan work activities
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to plan familiar work activities, whilst following established procedures and work health and safety (WHS) policies and procedures of the organisation. Planning is undertaken by the individual performing the work. Individual plan components may require modification and prioritising to meet job requirements or to respond to unforeseen circumstances.

45637MEM31925.name: Organise and communicate information
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers the skills and knowledge required to access, organise and communicate information related to production, maintenance or associated processes or tasks that apply in manufacturing, engineering or related environments. For accessing and recording of data requiring system knowledge and judgement, Unit MEM16008 Interact with computing technology should be selected.

45637MEM31925.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to comply with environmental regulations, identify and address environmental issues, minimise negative impacts, and implement improvements. It applies to individuals or teams working sustainably across manufacturing and related sectors, and can be contextualised to suit different industry areas and roles.

45637MEM31925.name: Assemble fabricated components
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Fabrication apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on heavy or light metal fabrications. It may also apply to other trade occupations requiring higher level MMAW welding skills.

45637MEM31925.name: Weld using manual metal arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Fabrication apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on heavy or light metal fabrications. It may also apply to other trade occupations requiring higher level MMAW welding skills.

45637MEM31925.name: Weld using gas tungsten arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Fabrication apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW) on heavy or light metal fabrications. It may also apply to other trade occupations requiring higher level GTAW welding skills.

45637MEM31925.name: Weld using gas metal arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Fabrication apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in gas metal arc welding (GMAW) on heavy or light metal fabrications. It may also apply to other trade occupations requiring higher level GMAW welding skills.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform geometric development
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Fabrication apprenticeship training and recognizes trade-level skills in marking out general fabrications using geometric development techniques to specifications interpreted from technical drawings and job specifications, ensuring accuracy in cutting, shaping, and assembling components for fabrication projects.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform advanced welding using submerged arc welding
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency has been developed for engineering fabrication trade training and the recognition of trade skills in advanced welding using submerged arc welding (SAW). It defines the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare for, and carry out advanced welding using SAW where the weld would be required to conform to AS 1554 Structural Purpose (SP) or equivalent national or international standards or codes as defined in the unit in combination with its prerequisites.

45637MEM31925.name: Repair, replace and/or modify fabrications
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to undertake repair, replacement and/or modifications of fabrications requiring an integrated level of skills in fabrication maintenance and repair and is intended to build on skills covered by the specialist prerequisites.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform automated thermal cutting
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate single and multi-headed automated thermal cutting machines for plate and pipe used in heavy engineering.

45637MEM31925.name: Carry out mechanical cutting
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate a range of mechanical cutting and holing equipment, with typical applications including cutting for manufacture, production cutting, and cutting materials in a maintenance environment.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform routine submerged arc welding
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare the materials and carry out routine submerged arc welding (SAW) and applies in a maintenance or manufacturing environment where the weld quality is not required to meet an Australian Standard.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform routine gas tungsten arc welding
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare the materials and carry out routine gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW) and applies in a maintenance or manufacturing environment where the weld quality is not required to meet an Australian Standard.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform routine flux core arc welding
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare the materials and carry out routine flux core arc welding (FCAW) and applies in a maintenance or manufacturing environment where the weld quality is not required to meet an Australian Standard.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform routine oxy fuel gas welding
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare materials and perform routine oxy fuel gas welding of mild/low carbon steel and cast iron where the welding is not required to meet an Australian Standard or equivalent.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform routine gas metal arc welding
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to prepare materials and carry out routine gas metal arc welding (GMAW) and applies in a maintenance or manufacturing environment where the weld quality is not required to meet an Australian Standard or equivalent.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform soft soldering
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform soft soldering applications of ferrous and non-ferrous materials, using straightforward techniques, where heat damage to components or finish of soldered joint is not critical.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform manual heating and thermal cutting
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform manual heating, thermal cutting and gouging including the assembly and disassembly and operation of the equipment on a range of materials.

45637MEM31925.name: Weld using flux core arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform flux core arc welding (FCAW) on heavy or light metal fabrications.

45637MEM31925.name: Weld using flame powder spraying
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform flame powder spraying, on a range of heavy or light materials and applies to welding of materials using powder spraying equipment where powders are fed through the flame and are deposited onto the surface to be built up or joined.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform brazing and/or silver soldering
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to perform brazing (including braze welding) and/or silver soldering and includes the preparation of materials and equipment and the inspection of the completed work. It applies to silver soldering and brazing using all grades of silver solder and braze

45637MEM31925.name: Apply safe welding practices
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to identify risks associated with welding operations that would typically conform to AS 1554 General Purpose and American Bureau of Shipping (ABS) or equivalent on all commonly used metals and the implementation of techniques used to reduce or eliminate welding hazards.

45637MEM31925.name: Manually finish/polish materials
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to finish and polish materials using appropriate media and equipment.

45637MEM31925.name: Weld using submerged arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to carry out submerged arc welding (SAW) where the welds are more likely to be associated with heavy rather than with light fabrication.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform routine manual metal arc welding
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to carry out routine manual metal arc welding (MMAW) of low carbon mild steel where the welding is not required to meet an Australian Standard or equivalent.

45637MEM31925.name: Apply basic engineering design concepts
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to apply in situ design skills to determine design requirements and create a design for application within the engineering fields of mechanical, production, electrical or electronic, fabrication and fluid power. Design concepts may be applied to the fabrication and modification of structures, plant and equipment, and design of tooling and gauges, production control systems, fluid power layouts and electrical circuits.

45637MEM31925.name: Set and edit computer controlled thermal cutting machines
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers setting and editing computer-controlled thermal cutting machines for post-trade engineering fabrication training, recognizing skills in selecting work holding fixtures, adjusting thermal cutting nozzle controls, and trialing and completing machine setup according to unit requirements and prerequisites.

45637MEM31925.name: Mark off/out structural fabrications and shapes
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers mark off/out of structural fabrications and shapes for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Fabrication apprenticeship training, recognizing skills in marking general fabrications and shapes to specified measurements and tolerances using appropriate tools and equipment, including producing templates and patterns as required.

45637MEM31925.name: Dismantle, replace and assemble engineering components
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers dismantling, identifying faulty components, selecting replacements, and assembling engineering components into assemblies or sub-assemblies according to standard operating procedures (SOPs), including the straightforward removal and replacement of pre-manufactured bearings and seals.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform advanced welding using oxy acetylene welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers advanced welding using oxy acetylene welding for engineering fabrication trade training, recognizing trade skills in planning, preparing, and performing welds in accordance with relevant Australian or international standards, codes, or welding procedure specifications (WPS).

45637MEM31925.name: Perform advanced welding using manual metal arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers advanced welding using manual metal arc welding (MMAW) for engineering fabrication trade training, recognizing trade skills in planning, preparing, and performing welds that conform to AS 1554 Structural Purpose (SP) or equivalent national or international standards.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform advanced welding using gas tungsten arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers advanced welding using gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW) for engineering fabrication trade training, recognizing trade skills in planning, preparing, and performing welds that meet AS 1554 Structural Purpose (SP) or equivalent national or international standards.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform advanced welding using gas metal arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers advanced welding using gas metal arc welding (GMAW) for engineering fabrication trade training, recognizing trade skills in planning, preparing, and performing welds that conform to AS 1554 Structural Purpose (SP) or equivalent national or international standards.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform advanced welding using flux core arc welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers advanced welding using flux core arc welding (FCAW) for engineering fabrication trade training, recognizing trade skills in planning, preparing, and performing welds that conform to AS 1554 Structural Purpose (SP) or equivalent national or international standards.

45637MEM31925.name: Perform advanced manual thermal cutting, gouging and shaping
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit of competency covers advanced manual thermal cutting, gouging, and shaping for engineering fabrication trade training, recognizing trade skills in producing complex internal and external profiles, and defines the skills and knowledge required to set up and safely perform these processes to meet predetermined shape, size, and surface finish specifications.

45637MEM31925.name: Weld using oxy fuel gas welding process
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit has been primarily developed for Engineering Tradesperson - Fabrication apprenticeship training and the recognition of trade-level skills in oxy fuel gas welding on heavy or light metal fabrications. It may also apply to other trade occupations requiring higher level oxy fuel gas welding skills.

45637MEM31925.name: Monitor quality of production welding/fabrications
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to perform basic inspection of completed or partly completed welded fabrications in a production environment, monitoring fabrication quality using welding techniques and testing procedures, under the guidance of a qualified supervisor or engineer.

45637MEM31925.name: Apply fabrication, forming and shaping techniques
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit covers skills for Engineering Tradesperson â€“ Fabrication, focusing on forming and shaping products to specifications interpreted from technical drawings and job specifications using various tools and techniques, typically applied in steel fabrication, boilermaking, or sheet metal work.

45637MEM31925.name: Maintain weld records
45637MEM31925.desc: This unit covers maintaining accurate and compliant weld records, including establishing record-keeping requirements and documenting weld details in accordance with enterprise quality systems, customer or project specifications, or welder qualification continuity, using formal record systems either electronically or manually.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle engines
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle engines. It involves identifying and confirming work requirements, preparing for work, diagnosing engine faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle steering systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle steering systems. It includes identifying and confirming work requirements, preparing for work, diagnosing steering system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect and service petrol fuel systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service petrol fuel systems in vehicles. It includes preparing for the task, inspecting petrol fuel systems, servicing or replacing components as required, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace. It includes selecting and using appropriate tools and equipment, performing routine maintenance, and storing tools and equipment correctly. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect and service braking systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service braking systems in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the braking system, reporting the inspection findings, servicing and adjusting the braking system, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair spark ignition engine management systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in spark ignition engine management systems of vehicles or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Test, charge, and replace batteries and jump-start vehicles
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to test, charge, and replace batteries, and jump-start vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, testing batteries, charging and replacing batteries, jump-starting vehicles, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle suspension systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle suspension systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing suspension system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle hydraulic braking systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle hydraulic braking systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing hydraulic braking system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Follow environmental and sustainability best practice in an automotive workplace
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service automatic transmissions in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the transmission for leaks, wear, and damage, checking fluid levels and conditions, replacing filters and fluids, performing basic adjustments, and completing workplace processes and documentation. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair charging systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in vehicle charging systems. It involves preparing for the task, testing and diagnosing charging system components such as alternators and voltage regulators, repairing or replacing faulty components, verifying system performance, and completing workplace processes and documentation. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Develop and carry out diagnostic test strategies
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to develop and implement diagnostic test strategies to identify complex faults in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes confirming the existence of faults, conducting systematic diagnostic tests, analysing test results, and developing rectification strategies. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle emission control systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle emission control systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing emission control system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to apply safe working practices in an automotive workplace. It includes identifying and following workplace procedures for hazard identification and risk control, contributing to arrangements for managing occupational health and safety, and completing workplace safety documentation. The unit applies to those working in all sectors of the automotive industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Test and repair basic electrical circuits
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to test and repair basic electrical circuits in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, testing electrical circuits, repairing faulty circuits, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair starting systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in starting systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing starting system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair ignition systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in ignition systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing ignition system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair cooling systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in cooling systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing cooling system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Carry out servicing operations
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to carry out servicing operations on vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, carrying out routine servicing operations, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect and service engines
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service engines in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the engine, servicing the engine, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Repair wiring harnesses and looms
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to repair wiring harnesses and looms in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, repairing wiring harnesses and looms, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Remove, inspect, and refit light vehicle wheel and tyre assemblies
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to remove, inspect, and refit wheel and tyre assemblies in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, safely removing wheel and tyre assemblies, inspecting them for wear, damage, and compliance with specifications, performing necessary repairs or replacements, refitting the assemblies, and completing workplace processes and documentation. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle final drive assemblies
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle final drive assemblies. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing final drive assembly faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle drive shafts
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle drive shafts. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing drive shaft faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle manual transmissions
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle manual transmissions. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing manual transmission faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle automatic transmissions
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle automatic transmissions. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing automatic transmission faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle clutch systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle clutch systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing clutch system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Select and use bearings, seals, gaskets, sealants, and adhesives
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to select and use bearings, seals, gaskets, sealants, and adhesives in vehicles. It involves identifying work requirements, selecting appropriate components and materials, using them correctly, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Assemble and fit braking system components
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to assemble and fit braking system components in vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, assembling braking system components, fitting them to the vehicle, and completing work processes. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect and service cooling systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service cooling systems in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the cooling system for leaks and component wear, testing coolant concentration and temperature, flushing and refilling the system, and completing workplace processes and documentation. Servicing may include replacing coolants, hoses, and other components as required. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect and service steering systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service steering systems in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the steering system for wear and damage, servicing the system, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect and service suspension systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service suspension systems in vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the suspension system, reporting the inspection findings, servicing and adjusting the suspension system, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR30620.name: Use and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace. It includes preparing for the task, selecting and using measuring equipment, maintaining measuring equipment, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect damaged vechile systems and recommend repairs
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves preparing for the task, inspecting vehicle system damage, determining the extent of damage by measuring and recommending repair options consistent with original equipment manufacturer (OEM) or authorised agency repair instructions. It also involves completing workplace processes and other documentation, including a final inspection report.

45637AUR30620.name: Inspect and service LPG fuel systems
45637AUR30620.desc: This unit involves preparing for the task, inspecting the system, reporting the inspection findings, servicing and adjusting the system, and completing workplace processes and documentation. It applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry. The LPG fuel systems include those of agricultural machinery, forklifts, heavy commercial vehicles, light vehicles or mobile plant machinery.

45637AUR31120.name: Follow environmental and sustainability best practice in an automotive workplace
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to follow environmental and sustainability best practices, including complying with established workplace procedures and environmental regulations as well as following sustainability practices that may reduce the environmental impact of work practices and outputs.

45637AUR31120.name: Follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to identify and follow safety and emergency procedures in an automotive workplace. It involves safety procedures to be followed when using workplace hand tools and hand-held power tools, fixed equipment, and chemicals, and when running vehicles and machinery. It includes the individualâ€™s responsibility for safety and emergency response in the event of an accident or incident.

45637AUR31120.name: Test and repair basic electrical circuits
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect, test and repair basic electrical circuits in vehicle and machinery electrical systems. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting and testing the circuit, repairing the circuit, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair vehicle dynamic control systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair vehicle dynamic control systems. These systems include the functions of a vehicle electronic braking control module (EBCM), such as anti-lock braking, brake assist, descent control, electronic brake force distribution, electronic park brake, hill start assist, stability control, traction control and active roll-over protection. The systems used vary based on the work context. The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair compression ignition engine management systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the compression ignition engine management systems of vehicles, vessels or machinery. The unit involves preparing for the task, selecting the correct diagnostic procedure, carrying out the diagnosis and the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Test charge and replace batteries and jump-start vehicles
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to test, charge, replace, retest and secure a range of automotive batteries, including vehicle or machinery jump-starting procedures. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting and testing the battery to determine serviceability, charging, jump-starting, removing and replacing, and undertaking the final retesting of batteries, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair charging systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair charging systems. The systems used vary based on the work context. The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair starting systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair starting systems. The systems used vary based on the work context. The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair automotive electrical systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair automotive electrical systems. It involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to electrical systems in various automotive contexts, including wiring, lighting, and electronic components. It requires the use of diagnostic equipment, tools, and materials appropriate for automotive electrical repairs.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle air braking systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the air braking systems of heavy vehicles. The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle steering systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair heavy vehicle steering systems. The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle suspension systems
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair heavy vehicle suspension systems. The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

45637AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle compression ignition engines
45637AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the compression ignition engines of heavy vehicles. The unit involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation.
